205503.name: Digimon World Re:Digitize
205503.description:
Digimon World Re:Digitize is a 2012 video game.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Digimon_World_Re Digimon World Re]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

205504.description:
Keymelequin is a mini-expansion for the game Keyflower that consists of the two colored Keymelequin keyples — Paulo and Sven — and a ship tile, the Keymelequin.

When the Keymelequin arrives in port, it transports two new characters, Paulo and Sven. Sven, who is a translator, co-ordinator and peacemaker between the blue and yellow keyples, disembarks from the Keymelequin at the end of spring. Paulo, who has similar abilities with red and green keyples, arrives on the Keymelequin at the end of the summer. Paulo and Sven will facilitate team work and co-operation between their respective factions, with powerful and interesting results.

Keymelequin is playable only with a copy of the game Keyflower, and it can be used with the base game on its own or in conjunction with any combination of the other Keyflower promotional tiles and expansions.
205504.name: Keyflower: Keymelequin
boardgamepodcastepisode: Ep 043 – Essen Part II Expansion Preview

205505.name: Bajevar Character Sheets
205505.description:
From the introduction:

The character sheets for Bajevar are only slightly different from the base Cypher System character sheets, including places for race, flavor (leave this blank if you don’t use a flavor), Bajevari money, and the various types of optional advancement. These changes are minor, making this version of the character sheet nice to have, but by no means necessary. You can use the standard Cypher System character sheets with no problem.

205506.name: Huh?
205506.description:
Description from the publisher:

—"It's a movie that begins with Irish dancing and ends with swimming..."
—"HUH?"
—"...because of a bit of ice..."
—"I got it!"

HUH? is a game in which confusing others can make you the winner! During the game, players attempt to describe movies, famous people, or characters in unusual and entertaining ways. Speak, act, sing — whatever you do, the goal is to have the fewest number of players possible understand what you are talking about! The fewer players who catch on, the better the score — but at least one person must figure out your clues.

Be careful not to say too much and keep an eye on which players might have caught on so that you know when to stop!

205507.description:
Description from the publisher:

In Key to the City – London, each player aims to develop their own London borough based around their home tile, using the large hexagonal location tiles. Each location tile gives victory points and may generate resources (skill tiles or connectors that connect two location tiles). Connectors and skill tiles can be used to upgrade location tiles for additional victory points and productivity.

The game is played over four eras, and in each era, new location tiles will be available for bidding. In both era 1 and 2, these tiles consist of six resource-generating tiles, plus some additional building tiles. In era 3, there will be only building tiles, which arrive already upgraded. In era 4, some of the Routemaster tiles become available.

On their turn, a player chooses one of five actions. They may use one or more of their team of wooden workers ("keyples") to (1) bid for a location tile, (2) use a location tile to generate resources, or (3) upgrade a location. They may (4) pass, in which case they may play again in that era, or (5) cease playing in that era by setting off in their sailing barge along the Thames. The game finishes after the last river barge sets sail at the end of era 4, at which point the player with the most victory points wins.

Key to the City – London has similarities in structure to the award-winning 2012 R&D game Keyflower.
205507.name: Key to the City – London

Episode 32 - The Essen Games We Have to Have
Episode 38 - What Exactly are We Using Kickstarter For?
HLG 9: Essen in Zicht
Podblast:  Edward’s Essen interview with Richard Breese!
The Game Pit: Episode 72 - Spiel 2016 Treasure Hunt Part 2
The Game Pit: Episode 77 - Picking Over the Bones
The Good The Board and Jon and Nate plus…10: Episode 97″Nate’s top 10 of 2016″

205508.name: Scoundrel D6
205508.description:
User summary:

Characters in the system are defined by Attributes (Body, Presence, Perception, Coordination, and Wits) - each with a possible Specialization - and Skills. Attributes and Skills may provide bonus dice to an action dice pool. Dice pool rolls are summed and then possibly modified. One die in each pool is identified as the "Wild Die" (usually, an off-color die) and this die can explode on a roll of a six, leading to potential critical successes.

The rules are concise and fairly light-weight, making the game suitable for beginning players and yielding a rapid style of play. The document provides little setting, though the skills enumerated strongly suggest a "modern" genre.

Publisher blurb:

The system outlined...borrows heavily from Micropend6 and Mini Six. This is a derivative work and all credit should go to Sigil Stone Publishing, AntiPaladin Games and, of course, West End Games for Open D6.

205509.name: Bad Elves
205509.description:
System-Independent Fantasy Adventure Supplement

From the introduction:

Elves... can’t beat ‘em. Can’t eat ‘em (well, most of us can’t). Like them or hate them, they’re a staple of every fantasy milieu. With their long lifespans, good looks, affinity for magic and the bow, they’re every adventurer’s dream (or bane, perhaps).

And since we can’t beat them (now would we want to eat them), we’ve decided to describe them in detail. Hence the creation of “Bad Elves,” the second system-independent fantasy supplement from yon folks at Crane Bump Pub. We hope you dig what we have to offer.

205510.name: Bad Dogs
205510.description:
A Collection of Less-Than-Upright Canines

From the introduction:

Gnolls... early game fodder for frivolous fantasy exploits. A stepping stone to bigger, better (hairier?) things. Snarling, stupid sycophants serving little purpose other than...

...then again, does it have to be that way? Perhaps there's more than meets the eye when it comes to these cunning canines. As far as we're concerned, there is..

205511.name: 10,000 Random Rolls: 2d4
205511.description:
From the introduction:

The 10,000 Random Rolls series...provides sheets containing ten thousand rolls of the named die or dice.

Who would want such a thing, when they can just roll some dice?

• Maybe when you GM, you don't always want to let on that you're making a roll. The sound of you crossing off a number from the list might just be you making a note of something, but the sound of dice clattering is a dead giveaway of a roll.
• Maybe you have terrible luck, or thing your dice are cursed (despite that time you microwaved the one that kept fumbling, as a warning to the others).
• Maybe you have an allergy to polyhedrons.
• Maybe you just like looking at lists of random numbers – I'm not here to judge.
• Maybe there's another reason.




User summary:

Provides summed results of 10,000 2d4 rolls (e.g., all numbers are 2 through 8. Numbers are formatted in six columns per page.

205526.name: 10,000 Random Rolls: Time of Day
205526.description:
From the introduction:

The 10,000 Random Rolls: Time of Day document enumerates ten thousand random times of day. Times are formatted in 24-hour format, from 00:00 to 23:59.

Time entries are formatted in six columns per page.

205527.name: Anthill
205527.description:
From the introduction:

Anthill is a roleplaying game. Players take on the role of mutated ants in a post-apocalyptic landscape. These ants and those like them - collectively “the Changed,” although their individual changes vary greatly - must work together to protect their home (“the Hill”) from predation, disaster, and collapse. The world is strange and full of new, unpredictable dangers, and the Changed undergo frequent metamorphoses through exposure to the mutagenic waste that infects the landscape.

User summary:

This game was entitled Antics during the first two iterations of the competition.

205528.name: The Perfected City
205528.description:
From the introduction:

In time lost to memory, noble Families of the mainland fled to establish Sagrea, ageless city of wonders. There are many tales about why they fled, but truth is long lost and records from the Crossing are scattered and crumbling.

The First Families who undertook the Crossing—also known as the Tretagi—rule a city unparalleled in the known world. Bastard offshoots of Tretagi (and Families ennobled after the Crossing) make up the lesser seed of the Low Families, or Barandi. Nobles find their diversions in art, running city bureaucracy, military leadership and adventurism, and dueling.

User summary:

The game title changed at each iteration of the challenge: The Wizard, Wizards of Xicarus, and The Perfected City.

205529.name: Unusual Townfolk
205529.description:
From publisher blurb:

There are common villagers and then there are unusual townfolk. This book contains five such characters compatible for 5E (Level 3-5). Among them are an orphan who hears the voice of her parents, a conman on the run from the law, and a talented entertainer looking for a powerful patron to help her career. These five individuals are ready to be allies, enemies, or even bounties for your home campaign.

205530.name: Archetypes of the Shoggoth
205530.description:
From publisher blurb:

Harness the Power of Shoggoths!

The eldritch, the strange, and the weird are often relegated to the domains of villains and NPCs in fantasy, with the good guys being the ones who stand in the way of the dark things that remain just beyond our perception, which we can never truly understand. But sometimes, it can be fun to take on the mantle of the otherworldly, and to embrace the alien terrors of the cosmos. Each installment of Weekly Wonders: Eldritch Archetypes contains five archetypes for eldritch characters—those that are weird, alien, and otherworldly, who don’t fit in with normal society—as well as a cleric domain devoted to a specific mythos entity or race.

This particular installment focuses on shoggoths, the ancient and primordial servitor race described at length in H. P. Lovecraft’s At the Mountains of Madness. These roiling horrors of pulsing flesh, which can take any shape and can spawn new organs and limbs as easily as most creatures breathe, have long been a source of fascination for readers of strange fiction. This book contains the following archetypes:

The transmografist, an alchemist archetype that specializes in transforming into weird and terrible shapes, and can spray horrible mucus to harm and blind his foes.
The protoplasmic rager, a barbarian archetype whose body alters in combat, giving her extendable arms, shielding her organs, and causing her to grow to immense size.
The writhing thrasher, a brawler archetype, which also has variable anatomy, and can gain monstrous features as easily as most brawlers gain feats.
The seeker of the strange, an investigator archetype that gains inspiration in strange ways, is a master of occult lore, and can harden his skin and warp his flesh.
The shoggoth bloodline, for sorcerers, which can create balls of protoplasm, grow various limbs, and attack foes with masses of tentacles.
A bonus cleric domain devoted to those who worship shoggoths as gods.




Whether you're about to embark on a campaign of eldritch horror (such as the official Paizo adventure path dealing with strange and alien entities), or you just want an excuse to play a servant of the unknowable and uncaring cosmic entities of the Cthulhu mythos, this book has lots of tantalizing options to offer. Even GMs can get in on the fun, as several of the archetypes here are perfect for insane cultist NPCs as well, and can make for exciting and memorable encounters.

205531.name: Knights of the Pentangle
205531.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Knights of the Pentangle Return to Fight Evil alongside King Arthur

Another offering in Misfits Studios' Super-Powered series for the Savage Worlds rules, The Knights of the Pentangle details the returned Once and Future King of the Britons and his new reincarnated knights. Together again, these heroes fight for justice across the United Kingdom (and abroad.)

Within the Knights of the Pentangle PDF you will find:

5 new Hindrances: Flashbacks, Hot Tempered, Man-out-of-Time, Meddlesome, and Past Life.
6 new general power modifiers: Alternate Resistance, Enhanced Knockback, Fatiguing, Increased Range, Source, and Test Required.
3 expanded powers: Attack, Melee; Copycat, and Heightened Senses, and 3 new powers: Dazzle, Postcognition, and Precognition
Game stats for Camelot, King Arthur (and Excalibur), Merlin, and other reincarnated Knights of the Pentangle: Galahad, Gawain, Guinevere, Lancelot, and Tristram. Also included are suggestions for other Knights the players could use as characters.
The Holy Grail.
The villains, Mordred and Morgan Le Fay, as well as two variations of the latter's deadly creations, the Fay'nabolg.

205532.name: Golden Jaguar (Supers!)
205532.description:
From publisher blurb:

This PDF contains a full write up on the Golden Jaguar. Sebastian Martinez was a talented but egotistical. archaeologist until the day he came into contact with the ancient Golden Jaguar Amulet. The amulet and Martinez bonded and the Golden Jaguar was born. Two consciousness now share Martinez's body. One, a thieving ladies-man and the other the fearsome Aztec warrior, Tonatiuth. The pair use their formidable skills to take what they want and to battle any that oppose them.

205533.name: Duke Dedrakon (HERO 6)
205533.description:
From publisher blurb:

This PDF contains a full write up of Duke Dedrakon, a terrible despot seeking his own demise. Cursed with immortality by a secretive order, the Duke will destroy any who cross his path. Includes full stats with tactical and plot suggestions.

205534.name: Afterlife
205534.description:
From publisher blurb:

Trying to find your place in the world can be tough. Amanda thought she was finding hers on that fateful night at the club. And then she died. Or did she? Whether strange mutation or revenant from beyond the grave, Amanda became Afterlife on that day. She would make sure to spend the rest of forever taking vengence on a world that had let her down.

205535.name: Vine and Willow
205535.description:
From publisher blurb:

Vine and Willow, a pair of clockworks devoted to nature and the Old Faith reveal the secrets of natural magic. This entry into the Poisoned Pages series reveals a bevy of new spells and potions to enrich you games. Will you bargain with these strange fellows on the tattered fringes of civilization?

205536.name: BeePack
205536.description:
User Summary

The BeePack was an adapter allowing the use of Bee Card games on MSX. The BeePack fitted into the MSX cartridge slot.

205537.name: Lightning
205537.description: Lightning is a fast reflex game that uses creatures from the Chinese zodiac. Players win by playing all of their cards before anyone else, with everyone playing cards simultaneously.

205538.name: Player's Advantage: Barbarian
205538.description:
From publisher blurb:

Let your rage take over...

Delve into your favorite classes with new rules, alternate class features, prestige classes, and other exciting additions. For the new player, you'll find helpful information to develop your character from both a rules and roleplaying standpoint. Experienced players will discover ample new options to breathe new life into old classes. Game Masters, do not despair, there are helpful chapters for you as well! Easily choose class combinations to create unique NPCs using detailed suggestions for barbarian characters. New monsters and sample NPCs makes it easy to add new flavor to your game. The series also builds on proven Open Game Content, taking it to new heights by integrating it into the new material. Don't be satisfied with just any expansion book, take the advantage!

The series continues with Player's Advantage: Barbarian - a mighty powerful option!

Primal paths detail numerous types of barbarians, their abilities, outlook, and reasons for fighting to give players a fresh look at the barbarian.
Alternate class features and prestige classes provide new variations on the Dungeons & Dragons barbarian.
Character options are useful for planning PCs or creating memorable NPCs because they let you, at a glance, compare races, multiclassing options, backgrounds and feats to build the right character for the job. New feats offer additional customization for those who use them.
New equipment makes the slaughter easier and more exciting with new armor and weapons for the savage in your party.
And tons more! Uncover the secrets of the barbarian and see the class with new eyes.

205539.name: Delwyn Underhall
205539.description:
From publisher blurb:

Delwyn is a lawful good male dwarf with arcanist levels utilizing the white mage archetype. He has heavily invested in increasing his spellbook contents and provides a combination of arcane combat skill and magical flexibility to address a variety of situations. He is able to use his arcane reservoir to cast cure spells, and while he is limited on ability to remove maladies, he can function as healer of physical damage.

Product Overview

Oops! That six-hour marathon game session started 15 minutes ago, and you have already killed a player character (PC)! He was decapitated while being consumed in dragon fire, and his corpse fell into a sphere of annihilation. Your prediction for recovery is “not likely.” You built pre-generated characters for this campaign six months and four character levels ago! You don’t want your player to sit and read the newspaper for the next 5.75 hours. You need a comparable-level character sheet quickly.

OR… A new player has just shown up to your table willing to learn to sling dice. You found out he or she was coming thirty minutes before game time. Your regular crew of miscreants has already killed off all the spare pre-generated characters you rolled up with gleeful abandon, while cackling wildly and uttering something about “drive ‘em like you stole ‘em.” You want this first gaming experience to be fun and memorable, so you don’t want to completely wing it. You need a character sheet, right now.

Welcome to Instant Character! Just add a player, and go! In this product, you will discover twenty complete stat blocks for a single PC, level 1 through 20, adhering to the Pathfinder® Roleplaying Game rules. The core format adheres to the standard non-player character (NPC) stat block most GMs are already familiar with minus the Tactics section. This makes it easier for the GM to assist with finding information and also prepares the player for the day he or she is running games! The Special Abilities section includes more detailed write-ups of feats and character abilities than a standard NPC stat block to facilitate faster play. Sources for spells, races, classes, archetypes, and prestige classes from sources other than the Pathfinder® Roleplaying Game Core Rulebook™ (PZO1110) are listed in the Sources section and can be referenced in the Pathfinder® Roleplaying Game Reference Document.

At the end of this document is a sheet of character and spell tokens including a token for this character and assorted Non-Player Characters (NPCs) and spell effects. For best results, print the token page and laminate the entire sheet. Initially cut out into squares. To improve ability to move and pick up the laminated tokens, trim off the gray corners to make an octagonal shape.

205540.name: Mouse in the House
205540.description:
Mouse in the House is a fun and simple game of hide 'n seek.
Players begin by giving the house a SHAKE. The mystery mouse will run and hide in a room inside the house. The excitement builds as players take turns looking for the mystery mouse. LOOK OUT! There he goes! Did you see him run across the room? When you do find him, he'll SQUEEEK!

Shake up the box to hide the mouse! Then the first player spins the spinner and counts out that many rooms. The last room the player counts, they get to check for a mouse. Use the cat to poke inside the hole in that room and if you hear a squeak, you found the mouse! You win! Otherwise play continues to the next player.

205541.name: Psychic Class: Overlord
205541.description:
From publisher blurb:

Who’s the Boss? You’re the Boss! You’re the – Overlord!

The world of adventuring is one fraught with danger, mystery, and the unknown. There are some who feel the need to assume control, to take over, to direct the aimless wanderings of warriors and wizard to achieve, succeed, and conquer! Such is the Overlord, a martial class with the status of Importance, which boosts his might according to the level of domination or challenge at hand, and the powers of Command, manipulating allies and enemies to succeed or fail as he sees fit.

The Overlord is a 20-level class, new from Purple Duck Games, that will bring a fresh new dynamic to your tabletop RPG game, giving players lots of choice in the combat dynamic of their dungeon or wilderness exploration. This product comes with all the info you need to play an overlord, favored class bonuses for core races and select races of Porphyra, and a sample character to get you right into play!

“Buck Up!” “Look at me, Scum!” “Up and at ‘em!” “Hit ‘em hard!”

Start ordering your allies and enemies around today, get The Overlord from the bossy bohemians at Purple Duck Games, where our games are what you want!

205542.name: Dark Castle
205542.description:
Description from the publisher:

Immortal Raven Lord may transform all of humanity to ravens by simply touching them. Miracle Princess may break the curse of the raven. Unfortunately, she was imprisoned in one of the towers in the Castle of Raven Lord. One day, the Brave with the power of bluebird, in order to rescue the imprisoned princess, opens the gate of the castle. He explores the rooms in the corridor carefully, trying to find a way to defeat the Raven Lord. Will he succeed? Or will the Raven Lord continue his dominion over the kingdom?

Dark Castle is a fantasy-themed two-player game, with one playing the Raven Lord and the other playing the Brave. They may move around the cloister to collect magic stones to control the five towers or use grimoires to cast powerful magic to interfere with the opponent.

Moving your character wisely grants you the most helpful magic stones, while casting magic at the right time helps you gain the upper hand over your rival. After four rounds, players earn magical powers for dominating the five towers and through the rewards from the secret chambers. The player with the most magical powers wins!

205543.name: Star Trek Panic: Vulcan Mind-Meld Promo Card
205543.description: Promo card for Star Trek Panic which allows you to use the special ability of another character in addition to your own this turn OR to commit as ANY DIVISION credit

205544.description:
Rescue Polar Bears happens in A.D 2045. With increasingly serious global warming, the last area of ice on land at the North Pole is melting and all the polar bears are homeless. Players in this game will be a team formed by all nations to save them. This is a co-operative game for 1-4 players. Players will co-operate with each other by choosing proper actions and card effects, so that they can save all of the homeless polar bears.

Each player chooses a ship of a nation at the beginning of the game and he or she will be the captain of the ship. Different ships have different abilities, which can be improved during the game. Also, there are various cards of 4 main kinds in this game. Captains start with some of them and they can get or use them during the whole game. Rescue Polar Bears is played in turns. In one captain’s turn, he has several actions to choose, such as moving, delivering and using cards. A captain has 3 action points per turn, which can be used to choose the actions mentioned above.

The homeless polar bears stand on ices, waiting the captain’s rescue. The ices they stand on is melting with time elapsing, accidentally or step by step. When an ice is melt, the polar bears on it may drop down into the water and face their unlucky fate. So it’s crucial for the captains to co-operate with each other by choosing proper actions and card effects before that tragedy.

The game can be ended by 3 ways: Saving all polar bears, using up time or having a polar bear fall into the water. You group will get scores, based on your performance, in either ending. Then, share your scores with your friends and families!
205544.name: Rescue Polar Bears

205545.name: Bondegårdsspillet
205545.description:
Bondegårdsspillet ("The Farm Game") is a game for the whole family about the animals of the farm. For 2-4 players aged 5 years up.

Players move their pawns around the track on the board and collect animals. When landing on a 'cat' or 'dog' space they draw a card and may then e.g. get or loose animals.

The first player to collect all six different animals is the winner.

205546.name: RPG Tycoon
205546.description:
RPG Tycoon aims to create a familiar yet original experience for players of all ages by combining classic tycoon gameplay with the unique theme of Kingdom management.

Can you generate enough money to keep your struggling kingdom alive? Will you be able to keep the settlements you're protecting free from danger? Do you think you have what it takes to win the award for "Greatest Kingdom in All of the Land?"

As most of the data for RPG Tycoon is loaded from simple XML files and Spritesheets at launch it's hugely extendable.

With a basic knowledge of XML or image editing software you can create an endless number of additional content for RPG Tycoon with ease. Add new Quests, Buildings, Heroes, Items and more in no time at all.

Source: The Game Website.

205547.name: Racket Wars: The Business of Mafia is Business
205547.description:
Description from the designer:

The Racket Wars game can be played with 2 – 6 players.
It’s a 90 min game.
Racket Wars is an open world, fun, strategic and fast paced dice rolling board game based on mafia theme, where players play to take control of the city. The game play is constructed in two parts, inside map and outside map. Outer part is controlled by MAFIA BOSS, where the inner city map is played using a soldier and a car. The city map is designed in a very detailed manner to give players a fun filled strategic experience interacting with the map. The idea behind this game is accomplishing a design which is very interactive for the players. That is why we made it an open world map.

205549.name: Microbot Racers
205549.description:
Description from the publisher:

The AI's at the abandoned spaceport got bored. To pass the days they used the maintenance systems to modify two of the small housekeeping bots to race around the site's reconfigurable service-ways. As they are semi autonomous the 'bots have to receive their directions in burst transmissions. Now the AI's are happy steering, drifting, and jumping their machines against each other in full on races.

In Microbot Racers players assume the role of one of the two spaceport AI's racing the other. Each round they select the actions their 'bot can take on the action card before sending them their instructions in a burst transmission. Players will need to avoid obstacles, hazards and each other in their mad dash round the track, but can make life difficult for one another by triggering the reconfiguration switches that cause sections of track to rotate or flip, changing the course in mid-race.

This game was an entry in the 2016 2 player PnP competition. A microgame requiring only the 11 cards and a few extra components, its is quick and easy to build and play.

205550.name: The Waystation at Morcomb-Tor
205550.description:
From the introduction:

A routine stop for the Adventurer's and their familes on a long caravan trip. A clifftop city, a city under siege, but no enemy is in sight. Locked doors and the shrieks of terrified people echo through the streets. Some run with knives and some are covered in blood. Your party turns to leave and finds they cannot.

Some arcane influence has trapped them inside the town. A voice whispers in the adventurer's minds, "Give me what I want and I'll go away" and suddenly the streets are filled with the mad and the insane, all begging for help against a presence that they cannot resist. In the distance, on a tall pyre, are the bodies of some of the townfolk's young.

Today is the day of the Sacrifice.

User summary:

For characters of any experience level.

205551.name: Dicedoku
205551.description:
Dicedoku is a small game you can even print it on business card.
Each player take a sheet with 6x6 grid.
Each turn,roll a die to decide a tetris shape and roll 4 dice to decide 4 numbers(if 3 or more dice are same number,reroll them).Each player then need to fill in their 6x6 grid using these 4 numbers and this shape.Shape can be rotated or flipped.Shape can overlap on exist numbers or outside of 6x6 grid,then these overlap or outside positions dont need to be write number(old number stay).
The object is,like Sudoku, make as many rows,columns and 3x2 blocks contain all digits of 1~6 as possible.
First player complete a row, a column or a block contain 1~6 will get 3 points of bonus.
At the end of game, each complete rows, columns and blocks give player 3 points.
Each empty space is -1 point.
Player with most points wins!

205552.name: Worlds of Adventure
205552.description:
User summary:

This booklet typically was distributed with the core rules as a package (often in a plastic bag). This booklet provides basic information on a variety of possible game settings, from about the 15th to the 30th centuries, noting prevalent or probably technologies, etc. The settings were insufficiently detailed to use without further development by the game master.

205553.name: Kobold Guide to Plots & Campaigns
205553.description:
From publisher blurb:

Run Your Best Campaign Yet

Whether you’re a new gamemaster or a seasoned vet looking for a new angle to shake up your game, these 19 essays by expert gamemasters help construct your campaign from the ground up—and keep your players engaged until the dramatic conclusion.

Kobold Guide to Plots & Campaigns shows how to begin a new campaign, use published adventures or loot them for the best ideas, build toward cliffhangers, and design a game that can enthrall your players for month or even years. Want to run an evil campaign, or hurl the characters into unusual otherworldly settings? Want to ensure that you’re creating memorable and effective NPCs and villains? We’ve got you covered.

Complete with discussions on plotting, tone, branching storytelling, pacing, and crafting action scenes, you’ll find all the tips and advice you need to take on the best role in roleplaying—and become an expert gamemaster, too! Featuring essays by Wolfgang Baur, Jeff Grubb, David “Zeb” Cook, Margaret Weis, Robert J. Schwalb, Steve Winter, and other game professionals.

This latest volume in the best-selling and award-winning series of Kobold Guides tackles the storytelling and campaign planning at the heart of any great RPG. Improve your game and expand your plotting and scheming skills with the Kobold Guide to Plots & Campaigns!

205554.name: Rune Magic
205554.description:
From publisher blurb:

Deep Magic of Giants and the Northlands!

Beneath the auroras is a savage land of frenzied barbarians, doom-laden heroes, flinty dwarves, and giants who dare to wage war against the gods themselves. The magic of the north is deep and ancient, and its practitioners are masters of the secret powers of the runes.

Deep Magic: Rune Magic brings the secrets of rune magic into your 5th Edition campaign, with 24 pages featuring:

New Rune Knowledge and Rune Mastery feats
25 runes that grant wisdom and power over time, fire, water, wealth, and more
5 new rune rituals, including Curse of the Wild Moon, Scourge of Hateful Nettles, and Tyr’s Peace
32 new or updated rune spells, including curse of Boreas, Loki’s gift, snowblind stare, and Wotan’s rede
New magic items, monsters, and more!




The ravens gather, and the wolves howl. Ready yourself, wizard: whatever emerges from the cold, dark forests this day will learn the power of rune magic!

205555.name: Void Magic
205555.description:
From publisher blurb:

Speak Not The Words. Read Not The Glyphs.

The speech of the void is oblivion given form. It corrupts and degrades physical reality. The Great Old Ones murmur it to their followers in nightmares, and it is whispered by creatures that dwell in the silent, cold expanses between the stars. Void magic is anathema to existence itself. Only the mad, desperate, or power-hungry seek to wield it—and you are one of them.

Deep Magic: Void Magic brings the secrets of these dark conjurations into your 5e campaign, featuring:

A Void school of wizard magic, with two new feats: Void Channeler, and Void Scribe
A Void Speaker arcane tradition, with new abilities including Whispers of the Void, Rebuke from Beyond, and Powerful Echo
13 new spells, including conjure voidborn, life drain, maddening whispers, word of misfortune, and more!




Who can say what drives you to master the magic of the void, casting spells that threaten to unmake the universe itself? Yet it may be that someday, when all seems lost, you will be the one who has the power to save the world.

205556.description: A thin playmat for Roll for the Galaxy for holding the supply of dice (ordered by dice color) and victory points. The front side works for the base game, and the back side includes a space for dice from the first expansion: Ambition. Both sides are in German. The playmat is a preorder promo from spiele-offensive.de
205556.name: Roll for the Galaxy: Playmat

205557.description: This deck contains 120 cards from the revised edition (2016). The deck makes older editions compliant with the 2016 standard for tournaments, and are compatible with old cards.
205557.name: Agricola: Upgrade Deck – Revised edition

205558.name: System Crash
205558.description:
System Crash is a story-driven cyberpunk collectible card game inspired by Blade Runner and Neuromancer. When corporations own everything and the line between man and machine is blurred, your only option is to fight to survive!

Source: The Game Website.

205559.name: Intrude
205559.description:
https://twitter.com/filuto4000

Intrude is a first-person shooter. Your mission is to get into a long time abandoned base, suddenly taken over by some kind of private military, find your way up and destroy the source of a signal comming from the base. Collect as much data as you can to find out what they are up to.

205560.name: Lethe - Episode One
205560.description:
Lethe is a first person adventure with survival horror elements. Explore an atmospheric and frightening world and uncover the dark secrets of your origins.

Source: The Developer Website.

205561.name: Zombie Camp
205561.description:
Zombie Camp is a room-scale VR shooter! Experience 360 degree virtual reality shooting in a desperate attempt to protect your campsite from crazed ZOMBIES!!

Source: The Developer Website.

205562.name: Corpo Tale
205562.description:
User Summary

You play as Martin, a Senior Test Engineer, working in a Test Department and it is Monday.

205563.name: Selma and the Wisp
205563.description:
“Selma and the wisp” is an astonishing platform game with a particularly eerie feel to it. Densely packed with logical puzzles and unexpected obstacles, the game incorporates innovative gameplay, low-poly models and an spectacular animations.

Source: The Developer Website.

205564.name: HALP!
205564.description:
HALP! is a single-player VR sandbox puzzle game where you help a stranded scavenger pirate captain fix his broken ship before spaceworms attack... or where you DON'T do that and just enjoy poking around and messing with the ship's various gizmos and contraptions.

Source: The Developer Website.

205565.name: Layers of Fear: Inheritance
205565.description:
Layers of Fear: Inheritance expands the plot from Layers of Fear and tells the story of the painter’s daughter, who comes back to her childhood home to face her past. Can she forgive her father, or will she resent all that has happened? Relive her experiences and witness the full scope of the tragedy that has swallowed up the family.

Lead the daughter through what’s left of the mansion and take part in the madness that her father bestowed upon the whole family. Face the memories of her past and shape them into the destiny that awaits her.

Source: The Game Website.

205566.name: Near Death
205566.description:
Stranded at an abandoned Antarctic research base with no hope of rescue, you must battle a deadly blizzard in a desperate fight to find your way home.

Source: The Game Website.

205567.name: Rising Islands
205567.description:
User Summary

Rising Islands is an adventure game where you’ll have to combine fast-paced action with quick thinking.

205568.name: Space Rift - Episode 1
205568.description:
Be part of the action! SPACE RIFT is a breathtaking action space adventure with a captivating story specifically designed for Virtual Reality! Experience the excitement of flying through the expanses of our galaxy up close in your own cockpit and join the fight for the freedom of humanity on Mars!

Source: The Game Website.

205569.name: Dead Island Retro Revenge
205569.description:
Time for some 16-bit retro revenge! When his beloved cat gets kidnapped, Max sets out across a zombie-infested California to get him back by force!

Source: The Publisher Website.

205570.name: GM's Monthly Miscellany (August 2016)
rpgissuearticle: 20 Things to Find in a Mine
The Mistfall Refuge At a Glance
Why Your Campaign Needs More Rumours
205570.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Pathfinder Roleplaying Game GM's Resource by John Bennett, Creighton Broadhurst, Kalyna Conrad, Jeff Gomez, Neal Litherland and Jacob Trier

Featuring material from some of Raging Swan Press’s newest products as well as classic releases of yesteryear, advice articles and material from Creighton’s on-going design of the megadungeon Gloamhold, the GM’s Monthly Miscellany series is a terrific free resource for the busy, time-crunched GM.

This month’s issue features:

Why Your Campaign Needs More Rumours
Macrimei At A Glance (from Village Backdrop: Macrimei)
The Mistfall Refuge At A Glance (from Places of Power: The Mistfall Refuge)
Whispers & Rumours: Local Legends (from Whispers & Rumours: Borderland Town)
20 Things to Find in a Mine

205571.name: Snow Horse
205571.description:
https://www.facebook.com/snowhorsegame

This is Snow Horse - the snowboarding game you never asked for, where the points are made up and you are a horse riding a snowboard. Official Twitch Levels and Twitch Snowboard Graphic!

205572.name: Genius Greedy Mouse
205572.description:
GENIUS GREEDY MOUSE is a clay based puzzle game featuring a host of fun and challenging levels.

Source: The Publisher Website.

205573.name: Extreme Forklifting 2
205573.description:
Always dreamed of becoming a forklift operator? Now you can!

Source: The Developer Website.

205574.name: CASE: Animatronics
205574.description:
CASE: Animatronics is a truly scary and challenging first-person stealth horror on PC. Control of the police department is in the hands of anonymous hacker. All exits are locked. Electricity is off. Metallic thumps are getting closer. Will you survive, Detective Bishop?

Source: The Game Website.

205575.name: Blood & Treasure Fantasy Role Playing Game Rulebook (2nd Edition)
rpg: Blood & Treasure Fantasy Role Playing Game
205575.description:
From publisher blurb:

Blood & Treasure is the fantasy role-playing game for people who want to spend less time arguing over rules and more time playing, and the new 2nd Edition continues this tradition.

Compatible with old school games, it strives to be rules lite and options heavy.

You get ...

Thirteen character classes, as well as suggested variations on the existing classes
The classic fantasy races
A streamlined and easy optional feats system
Hundreds of spells and magic items - you can run games for years without running out of new things to try
Optional scientific treasures for those who like science-fantasy
Quick and easy rules for exploration, combat, mass combat, naval combat, strongholds and domains and a simple task resolution system
Guidance on designing dungeons, wilderness, settlements and even the cosmos
Suggestions on converting to other old school systems and changes between the first and second edition




Blood & Treasure 2nd Edition is designed to give you years of enjoyment in just two volumes, this book and the forthcoming Blood & Treasure 2nd Edition Monster book, which features over 600 monsters to challenge players.

Blood & Treasure doesn't want to tell you what kind of fantasy game you should enjoy, it just wants to put all the tools in your hands and let you play YOUR GAME, YOUR WAY

205576.name: Wizard Implements - Alternate Class Rules
205576.description:
From publisher blurb:

Seeing the power that can be harnessed from psychically charged objects, there wizards that forego their normal connection to the classical schools of spellcraft to harness the powers of specific tokens of arcane significance. This issue presents an alternate means of implementing the wizard's arcane bond and specialization of arcane energies based upon the implements used by the Occultist as found in Paizo's Occult Adventures.

205578.name: Morcegos Saídos do Inferno
205578.description:
From publisher blurb:

"Morcegos Saídos do Inferno" é uma aventura curta para um Mestre e um jogador, em que o personagem deverá salvar mineradores de uma perigosa praga mutante.


Translation courtesy of Google:

"Bats coming out of Hell" is a short adventure for a Master and a player, in which the character must save miners a dangerous mutant plague.

205579.name: Expedição ao Pico do Abismo
205579.description:
From publisher blurb:

Expedição ao Pico do Abismo é uma aventura desafiante e divertida para personagens de 8º a 11º nível que confronta dois estilos de aventuras, a Espacial e a Fantasia Medieval.

Criada para ser jogada com as regras do Old Dragon e do Space Dragon, ela apresenta duas visões sobre uma mesma história e possibilita que seja jogada duas vezes ou com dois grupos diferentes terminando num épico encontro final. Por fim, acompanha a aventura um manual de conversão completo entre o Space Dragon e o Old Dragon, permitindo que você utilize regras de um sistema no outro sem nenhuma dor de cabeça!

OBS: Este produto possui duas capas, uma capa com a Identidade visual do Old Dragon e outra com a Identidade visual do Space Dragon.


Translation courtesy of Google:

Expedition to the Abyss Pico is a challenging and fun adventure to 8 characters to 11 level that confronts two styles of adventure, the Space and Medieval Fantasy.

Designed to be played with the rules of the Old Dragon and the Space Dragon, she has two views on the same story and allows it to be played twice or two different groups ending an epic final meeting. Finally, follows the adventure a complete conversion manual between the Space Dragon and the Old Dragon, allowing you to use rules of a system in another with no headache!

Note: This product has two layers, a cover with the visual identity Old Dragon and another with the visual identity of the Space Dragon.

205580.name: Old Dragon: Regras para Jogos Clássicos de Fantasia
205580.description:
From publisher blurb:

Volte aos tempos da fantasia clássica dos role-playing games em um mundo de espadas, magias, monstros e perigosas aventuras! O Old Dragon: livro de regras básicas contém tudo que os jogadores precisam para construir seus heróis e para o mestre criar suas fantásticas aventuras, com regras simples e rápidas que dão o tom da verdadeira diversão. Crie seu aventureiro, escolha seu equipamento e prepare-se para ganhar riquezas, fama e glória!

Neste Livro você encontrará:

Todas as regras necessárias para aventuras do nível 1 ao 20;
Raças de personagens: humanos, anões, elfos e halflings;
Classes Basicas de personagens e novas classes avançadas como bárbaro e druida;
Lista completa de equipamentos e itens mágicos;
Sistema de combate simplificado e ágil;
Mais de 150 magias entre arcanas e divinas;
Bestiário com mais de 70 monstros para desafiar os heróis;
Seção completa para o mestre.





Translation courtesy of Google:

Return to classic fantasy days of role-playing games in a world of swords, spells, monsters and dangerous adventures! The Old Dragon: Basic Rulebook contains everything players need to build their heroes and to the master to create your fantastic adventures, simple and fast rules that set the tone of real fun. ! Create your adventurous, choose your equipment and get ready to gain wealth, fame and glory

In this book you will find:

All the necessary rules for level 1 to 20 adventures;




characters of races: humans, dwarves, elves and halflings;

Basicas character classes and new advanced classes as barbarian and druid;
Full list of equipment and magic items;
System of simplified and agile combat;
More than 150 spells between arcane and divine;
Bestiary over 70 monsters to challenge the heroes;
complete section to the master.

205581.name: Subterranean Mine
205581.description:
From publisher blurb:

A System Neutral Edition GM's Resource by Creighton Broadhurst, Ron Calbick, Kalyna Conrad and Jeff Gomez

Are you a busy GM? Does session prep take too long? Do you never have time to work on the cool little details that can bring your session to life? Well fear not! That’s where the 20 Things line comes in. Compiled from the free 20 Things posts available at Raging Swan’s website, this short, focused compilation gives you, the time-crunched GM, the tools to effortlessly add verisimilitude and detail to your adventure. Use the material herein either before or during play and bask in your players' adulation. This instalment provides nine tables designed to help you to flesh out and bring to life a subterranean mine.

20 Things #5: Subterranean Mine comprises the following 20 Things articles, along with other supplementary material:

12 Perils to Encounter in a Mine
20 Hauntings to Encounter in a Mine
20 Strange Discoveries to Make in a Mine
20 Things to Find in an Abandoned Mine
20 Things to Find in a Mine
20 Things to Find in a Mining Cart

205582.name: MAYOIGA - The Lost Village
boardgamepublisher: Pony Canyon, Inc. (株式会社ポニーキャニオン / Kabushiki kaisha Ponī Kyanion)
205582.description:
User summary
迷家-マヨイガ - The Lost Village (MAYOIGA - The Lost Village) is a game from a popular Japanese anime series. Mayoiga translates as "Illusion House" and the name comes from Japanese folklore stories which say that those who have visited the mysterious house in a hidden village will gain wealth. In the anime, there is a hidden village but no illusion house.

Form a team of five out of 30 characters, and survive them!

"Mayoiga - The Lost Village" is a survival horror card game which is based on the Japanese TV anime program of the same name. In this game, characters confront the NANAKI, monstrous beings shaped by the characters' own mental traumas.

Reveal a number of character cards equal to the number of players plus one on the table. Players strengthen the characters' mind by playing mind cards of five types on them. Then each player adds one of the characters to that player's team, along with mind cards on that character. However, the NANAKI devour the remaining cards on the table, making themselves hard to be overcome. At the end, the characters must confront the NANAKI which has been grown by the players' intentions!

Publisher's summary
日本のアニメーションを原作にしたカードゲーム！

30人のキャラクターの中から5人のチームを作り、生き延びろ！
トラウマが具現化したバケモノ〈ナナキ〉と対決する
サバイバルホラー・カードゲーム！

公開されたキャラクターカード（プレイヤーの人数+1枚）を、
心の力を象徴する5色のマインドカードで強化し、チームに加えていく。
だが、残ったカードはナナキに吸収され、成長していくのだ。
プレイヤーの思惑を吸収しながら成長するナナキと対決するのだ！！

205583.name: Intrigue Feats I
205583.description:
From publisher blurb:

Intrigue Feats I is the latest Mythic Mini devoted to exploring the subtle arts of intrigue, using the power of suggestion and sedition to upset and dismay your enemies, leading them astray through clever wordplay. The art of deception and cruel cunning can win the day without baring steel, and this PDF brings you 10 new feats to do just that, from Shadows of Fear and Darkness Trick to Incite Paranoia and Notorious Vigilante!

205584.name: Forest Paths
205584.description:
From publisher blurb:

Modular Kit: Forest Paths is a printable dungeon tileset compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. It can be used as a standalone set, or combined with any same-scale tileset.

Modular Kit: Forest Paths comprises 64 different tiles that can be printed multiple times and arranged in limitless combinations. Three different width paths pass through dense forests. Straight pieces, junctions, bends, and clearings allow you to build forest paths of any size. There are also special 'encounter' tiles with plot ideas - an animal den, a fallen statue, a barrow, an abandoned camp and some ancient steps.

205585.name: Bowling Lounge
205585.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a 20 x 48 inch, Battlemap of a Bowling Lounge, it has Hex, Square and No Overlays, it also includes the VTT files for online play.

“We didn’t join this bowling league to lose! “—Super Villain alter ego

Bowling Lounge is a single level interior map of a twelve lane bowling alley with a bar/lounge area.

Bowling Lounge is intended for use in modern games.

Adventure hook for use with this map:

Bowling for Villains: The super heroes as their secret identities have joined a bowling league for leisure. They’ve made a pact to not use their super powers while in the league.

Some of their super villain nemeses have also unknown to the super heroes joined the bowling league as their secret identities. Unfortunately for the heroes, the super villains have made no such pact to not use their powers and start the match by cheating using their powers to influence their bowling success (such as using super strength to toss the ball at faster velocities to result in more strikes, telekinesis to move the ball, knock over pins that would normally be part of a spare, etc.).

Now the super heroes need to make a choice. Do they lose gracefully to the cheating villains? Do they break their pact and use their powers to make it even?

After the match, the super heroes and super villains change out of their bowling clothes. The super villains change into their super villain costumes. They threaten the bowling lounge employees and demand the cash from the cash register. The super heroes may have changed into their street clothes for their secret identities and have to go back to get their super hero costumes.

When the super heroes get out of the changing room it’s time to stop the super villains from stealing the cash at the bowling lounge (and perhaps get revenge on them for cheating at bowling). Bowling balls can be used as throwing weapons and bowling pins can be used as makeshift clubs. The super heroes may want to limit collateral damage but the super villains don’t care at all about damage to the property.

205586.name: The Temple of Lies
205586.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Temple of Lies is a small light hearted adventure about the typical shennigans one gets into involving human sacrifice and severe opiod addiction. This adventure is statted for both Neoclassical Geek Revival as well as your favourite retroclone or other Old School adventure game. It is meant for levels 1 to 2. This adventure was created as promotional offer for a Bundle of Holding breaking a record and is now available to everyone.

rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
205587.name: The Crocodile's Tear
205587.description:
From publisher blurb:

Advanced Adventures #34: The Crocodiles Tear is an OSRIC module designed for 4-6 adventurers of levels 3-6.

A wealthy patron is outfitting an expedition to sail to the mysterious southern continent. The goal of the expedition is none other than the legendary Crocodile’s Tear: a massive magical emerald! Many tales are told about the southern continent, most of which paint it as a disease-ridden jungle filled with hostile natives, reachable only by crossing a pirate- and monster-infested sea.

As the port winds fade into the winds of the open sea, the sails of The Mermaid billow firmly. Will the player characters survive the voyage, and will they find more than they bargained for? Oh, and was it mentioned that that two other trips set out before this one only to be swallowed up by the dense jungle…

205588.name: Night Wizard!
205588.description:
From the back of the book:
This world is being targetted.

The hidden true history.
The world we live in is threatened by the danger of destruction. Enemies called "Emulators" have incaded, breaking through the kekkai surrounding the world. Only you can save it from this danger. Yes, only the "Night Wizards".

Fell the enemies diving into the kekkai.
When the red moon rises in the sky, the common sense we know breaks down and the truth is turned out. The enemies hide in the darkness between tall buildings, in a mirror at night, and in the hearts of humans, waiting for a chance to rewrite the world. The players become "wizards", dive into the laws (kekkai) controlled by the enemies, and destroy them.
Here comes the present day fantasy presented by Takeshi Kikuchi of "Seven Fortress".

Night Wizard!

205589.name: Bakudan Takarabako
205589.description:
User summary
爆弾宝箱 (Bakudan Takarabako), in English is Bomb & Treasure.

In the game of Bomb & Treasure, players are pirates who try to grab treasures while avoiding bombs.

Each round, a player (sender) places a card face-down, which is either a treasure of 1-10 value or a bomb, and sends it to another player (receiver), saying the value the card. The sender may lie if it is a bomb and say any value, but if it is a number card, they cannot lie and must say the actual value of the card. The receiver may either accept and reveal it, or sends it back to the sender and forces the sender to reveal it, or adds another card and passes both cards to any other player, including the sender.

Now the card or cards must be revealed and the player who has them takes all of them, including bombs revealed, and puts them face-up in front of themself. After each player has taken a turn as sender, players draw back to five cards in hand.

With total of three bombs, that player is out of the game. If a player has two bombs in front of them, they don't want to risk getting a third bomb, and so may easily decline an offer of a high value card.

If a player gets a set of 1,2 & 3, they equal 10 points, so players may accept low value cards and be fooled into taking a bomb.

You win the game if you accumulate 30 value of treasures, or all other players are out of the game, or you have the highest value of treasures when the ninth bomb is revealed.

Publisher's summary
プレイヤーは海賊となって、宝物と爆弾を送りあいます。うまく宝物だけをゲットし、爆弾を相手に押し付けましょう！
手札のカードを1枚伏せて、他の人の前に出します。
カードを出された人は、「受け取る」「返す」「さらに1枚追加して他の人に渡す」のどれかを選びます。
宝物であれば点数に、爆弾であればダメージを受けます。爆弾を3枚引き取ってしまったら脱落です。
「先に30点以上集める」「自分以外の全員が脱落する」「9枚爆弾が出た時に、一番多くの点数を持っている」のどれかで勝ちになります。

205590.name: The Book of Changing Years
205590.description:
From the back cover:

"I'm writing this anonymously, because I'm spilling some secrets that aren't supposed to slip out. Just know that I'm on the side of true history - whatever TimeWatch says it is - and I've done my best to make that happen. Ad if I screwed up a few times? Well, no one's perfect..."

On 1st May 1895, an agent of TimeWatch delivered a manuscript, bound in waxed paper and string, to the offices of Pelgrane Press for publication. Months later, the entire print run was discreetly collected and the book was never seen again. Until now.

You hold in your hands The Book of Changing Years: an assortment of time travellers' tales put together on the quiet by agents of TimeWatch, and passed secretly from agent to agent.

It's also a handout for players of the TimeWatch roleplaying game in the style of the award-winning The Book of the Smoke and The Armitage Files.

Follow these writers' leads through time and space, and discover why:


There are too many cats in London in 1840 and no dogs at all, and how this related to the pyramids of Kush.



Edward V is scouring the time lines in search of Caravaggio's St. Francis Preaching to the Birds.



Somebody time-pranked Alexander Graham Bell into thinking he'd heard spirit voices on his new invention.


Seek the answers to these questions, facing psychic beetles and sentient veociraptors on the way - and if you don't like what you find, repair the timeline and restore true history.

Fire up your time machine, unhook your tether, and dive into the gaps between the chimes.

205592.name: No Quarter (Issue 67 - Jul 2016)
rpgissuearticle: Courage at the Crossroads: Season One
The Blood of Kings - Historical Scenario
rpg: Iron Kingdoms Full Metal Fantasy Roleplaying Game

205593.name: Seeds of Chaos
205593.description:
The Horror of Horticulture

From the introduction:

Valentine Manor is beauty entrapped in architecture. The lavish stately home is renowned throughout the realms, and its gardens even more so. However, despite its famed beauty something has found its way into the garden and corrupted its allure. Could it be something to do with the new gardeners, or something even more sinister?

User summary:

For 1st - 4th level characters

205594.name: City of Adventure
205594.description:
A Sword Coast Adventure

From the introduction:

This is the first module in a series that develops the ruined town of Leilon. This module is an overview that describes the town as it is today and several of the local threats and allies that inhabit the region. One of the chapters describes the town itself and how the changes over the last 100 years affected the whole region. Another chapter describes the abandoned farm turned fort where rest may be harder than you thought. This module also contains a few location based adventures within the town for characters level 3-8 and several other ideas for developing your own adventures.

Leilon is located to the west of the Sword Mountains and several days travel north of Waterdeep along the Sword Coast. This is a stand-alone adventure location that can be easily modified to suit your campaign.

User summary:

For 1st - 12th level characters

205595.name: Crazy Chicken Invasion
205595.description:
The day of the invasion has come. Flying saucers are darkening the skies and the fall of civilisation as we know it is halfway through the door already. The world is about to be conquered by the alien Crazy Chicken invaders. Nothing and nobody is safe from these birds from outer space. It's a good thing there are still plenty of hunters about to stop the invaders with their old shotguns.

In Crazy Chicken Invasion, arguably the most famous bird in the world is back in just the kind of genuine shooter that fans have come to appreciate in the past years: high-quality graphics, tons of hidden puzzles and extras, a Crazy Chicken at every corner and plenty of lead to be hurled through the air.

Source: The Game Website.

205596.description:
Description from the publisher:

Darwin’s Dice is a simple, fast-paced trump card game, where two dice set the conditions of every turn. You’ll need both a tactical approach as well as a fair amount of luck. Two to four players meet in this game for a struggle of sheer survival. Only the player who’s best prepared and whose cards match the conditions can obtain the opponents’ cards and collect points.

Before each turn a player – the Darwin – rolls the dice. The combination of number (1 to 8) and colour (blue, green and yellow) determine which card becomes the trump during this turn. Additionally, one die (with + and -) specifies if high or low numbers have an advantage.
Each player then plays a card upside down and then flip them over simultaneously. The player of the strongest card wins, becomes the new Darwin and rolls the dice for the next turn.

The strongest card is either the trump or – of no trump has been played – the highest or the lowest card. If it comes to a draw, the size of the animal is of the essence (+ for big / - for small). But there are three special cards as well:
The red cards (1 to 8), if they should win a turn, although they are not able of becoming the trump and will always lose in a draw, they can destroy the collected cards of the player with the second best card.
The grey cards (0 and 9) are always the highest or lowest numbers. They can only be beaten by the trump.
The brown cards (4.5) are the worst cards, because they are neither the highest nor the lowest cards - they are right in the middle. But if the trump has been played, they are the only ones able to beat it.

A game consists of several rounds, each consisting of individual turns. Each turn consists of rolling the dice and playing one card. A round is over when all the hand cards have been played. The game is over when the card deck is used up.

At the end of each round – after all the hand cards have been played – the points of the cards, according to the number of symbols in the corner, are counted and written down. These points are safe and cannot be destroyed.
At the end of the game – when the card deck is used up – the player with the highest score wins.
205596.name: Darwin's Dice
boardgamepodcastepisode: TRCP - Launch Episode 11

205597.description:
Description from the publisher:

With the invention of Jump Drive, the race for the galaxy begins! Develop new technologies and settle worlds to build a space empire. Find winning card combinations!

Race for the Galaxy: Jump Drive is a fast-paced card game that introduces players to the Race for the Galaxy universe. Can you build the most prosperous galactic civilization?

Jump Drive is a standalone game and offers simpler rules and a shorter game than its older brother Race for the Galaxy.
205597.name: Jump Drive
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 025 – Gen Con 2016
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 037 – Top 10 Publishers
Episode 104 -- I Landed on the Dog
Episode 193
RDTN Episode 116: Assault of the Giants, Jump Drive, Moons and Chit Chat

205599.name: Temporum: Alternate Realities
205599.description:
Description from the publisher:

What is time? Is it like a river? Or maybe an ocean? Is it like up, but sideways? Is it churning chaos, background noise, held together only briefly by our own awareness of it? You don't know. You just work the machinery; someone else built it. To you, time is a means to an end, a glorious end in which humanity's crowning achievement turns out to be your own benevolent rule. It's a simple process of weeding through the alternatives, snipping prudently — an ungrateful utopia here, a useless revolution there. In the end, from the Age of Atlantis to the Zombie Apocalypse, the eras will sing your praise.

Temporum: Alternate Realities, an expansion for Temporum, adds 48 more Zones and 60 more Player cards, plus chits and cards used by the new Zones.

205600.description:
Topoum: Bratatatata – Expansion Deck I consists of:


49 cards in 7 new types
1 farmer card
1 Event card
4 player aids card
1 rulebook
205600.name: Topoum: Bratatatata – Expansion Deck I

205601.name: BATTLESHIP (2016)
205601.description:
With a modern, dynamic and interactive 3D board, BATTLESHIP brings the classic franchise to a new level for a memorable experience.

Deploy your fleet and shoot at your opponent’s grid to find and destroy enemy ships before yours are sunk. Enjoy the game you know and love with the Classic mode or get more tactical in a brand new way to play with the "Clash at Sea!" mode.

Source: The Publisher Website.

205602.name: 2016.A
205602.description:
Description from the designer:

Players take turns to swap a card, then predict where an arrow will travel to. It's critical to not only remember what the face-down cards are, but also consider what you're swapping, what cards you're giving to the other player, and what they could swap.

Setup: make a 3x3 grid of cards. Both players see the middle 3. Each player looks at the 3 closest to themselves. The remaining 3 cards are given to the start player, along with the arrow.

Each turn:

the arrow is placed in front of the central card on the active player's side.
the active player swaps a card on the table with one from their hand, then gives the 3 cards to the other player.
the other player swaps a different card on the table.
the active player predicts which side of the grid the arrow will exit on
the other player chooses a different side
cards are turned over, one at a time, to reveal the path that the arrow follows, until it exits the grid
if either player predicted the exit side correctly, they get a point.




First to 3 points wins the game.

205604.description:
Tricksters is a fast paced card game for 1-4 players (or up to eight with two copies) held in a mystical world populated by cute crazy creatures, the Annukuhs, created by dark and light energy. In the game, players must seek and absorb only light or only dark energy. If a player would gain the other type of energy, they get farther from winning; but any side can win.

Energy is obtained by favoring a race of Annukuh each round. Cards are placed in a general pool made by all players and revealed once each round. So, the longer the game, the fastest the Annukuh will collect energy.

Choose your side carefully, and don't be outrunned by the other players!
205604.name: Tricksters
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 91- The Manhattan Project: Energy Empire

205605.name: Vigilante
205605.description:
Overview:
Your city is being threatened by ruthless and corrupt organizations who seek to profit off the backs of your friends and neighbors. It’s time for someone to stand up and fight back. The odds are stacked against you and your fellow justice seekers, but maybe, with the right strategy, equipment and training you can chase the Minions out of your city.

Objective:
Create a hero and go on patrol to take down the corrupt organizations and their minions that threaten your city. Beat the clock, against schemes that empower the Villain, uncovering their identity and stopping them once and for all.

Gameplay:
Vigilante is a campaign, deck construction game with a sprawling city of Schemes that you and your friends' heroes move through, playing cards and rolling dice to combat. The challenge is knowing which Schemes are most important to stop, because the ones that you fail to prevent add new abilities to the Villain and his lair. Reward cards will give you temporary upgrades and gear can be combined to unlock new equipment and weapons. Upgrade your team's base or your own vehicle? The choice is yours!

205606.name: Gold-Hilted Daggers
205606.description:
(publisher blurb)

The streets of Tosi are filled with drunken revelers, the smell of roast pigeon, and the taste of sweet quince wine. The celebration of a local saint is carried on with little temperance around here.

A defiant shout, far too familiar for your liking, halts the festivities. All attention is drawn to two men brandishing swords, and the band of mercenaries, the city’s hired police, rushing towards them.

What do you do?

Gold-Hilted Daggers is an adventure for Dungeon World that throws players into the middle of two rival merchant families and the powers that mean to profit from the chaos. The setting is lightly based off of medieval Italy, and draws inspiration from Guy Gavriel Kay's Tigana.

205607.name: Comparity: USSR
205607.description:
In Comparity: USSR, players must place their goods-cards on the table in a grid according to how many they think the cost of goods: the lower-left of the grid for lower-cost goods, and the upper-right of the grid for higher-cost goods.

On your turn, you can place a card in the grid or check if a previous player placed their card correctly. If you check and the placement is correct, you must draw a 2 card, but if it was placed incorrectly then the person who played it must draw 3 cards.

The player who manages to get rid of all their cards first is the winner.

205608.name: Warlock's Journal (Issue 28 - Jul 2016)
rpgissuearticle: Music & Lights: A Bardic Mage Duo
Together We Fall: A Twin Titans Setting
205608.description:
Warlock's Journal
Issue 28
July 2016

Built right here on RPGGeek!
Call for Submissions: Warlock's Journal July 2016
Warlock's Journal

Participants received this microbadge:

205609.name: Casino Challenge
205609.description:
From the back of the box

Casino Challenge simulates all the fun and thrills of a real live casino, allowing you to re-create all the thrills of the gaming action you find in real casinos from Las Vegas to Monte Carlo. Choose your game and hit the tables. All the great and classic casino games are included in this one exciting package, including blackjack, simulated live horse racing, roulette and even jackpot-style slot machines. Playing Casino Challenge gives you an insight into how to play casino games more effectively; you can learn the secrets and develop your own play strategies the more you play and practice.

205610.description:
Description from the publisher:

The king has called for a lavish feast and tourney, the likes of which have not been seen in the Seven Kingdoms since the days of Aegon the Conquerer. What's more, the king has declared that at this feast, he will choose his new Hand — and you have a chance of rising to this lofty position. Of course, you're not the only one with eyes set on becoming the power behind the Iron Throne. In A Game of Thrones: Hand of the King, you need to scheme and backstab to outwit your opponents, and you need the help of Varys, the Master of Whispers, to do it.

Hand of the King is a fast-paced card game of conspiracies and sudden twists of fate for two to four players, challenging each of you to gain the most support among the twisted intrigues of the King’s Landing court. Each turn, you send Varys to do your bidding, moving through the court and inciting iconic characters from A Song of Ice and Fire to support your cause. With the help of some companions and crafty alliances with other players, you just might rise to become the king's new Hand!

In more detail, players move Varys in orthogonal lines in a 6x6 grid, stopping it on a character token, then collecting that token and any other character from that House that you passed over. Possess as many characters from a House as someone else, and you claim the banner from that person. Collect the final character from a House, and you immediately use the power of one of six companions; since the game contains fourteen companions, the mix of powers will differ each game.
205610.name: A Game of Thrones: Hand of the King
boardgamefamily: A Song of Ice and Fire
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 14 - Bruno Cathala: Prolific Designer Extraordinaire!
Episode 85- Mystic Vale and Capstone Games Hot Seat
Harry Potter Hogwarts Battle Review
The Game Pit: Episode 78 - Battle Report from LobsterCon XII

boardgamecompilation: Isle of Skye: From Chieftain to King – Adjacency Scrolls
205611.description:
The Deutscher Spielepreis 2016 Goodie Box is a product to support the Deutscher Spielepreis, the second biggest German board game prize, for which thousands of players vote each year between May and July for their favorite game. This box contains a small expansion for four of the top ten games of the Deutscher Spielepreis 2016: Mombasa, Codenames, Isle of Skye, and T.I.M.E Stories.

Promos include:

T.I.M.E Stories: Special Reward - contains three beacon tokens, which can be used in the third run of a mission.
Codenames: Authors & Games - Additional cards for the game, on one side game designers, the other games titles.
Mombasa: Cooked Books - Includes 6 book tiles and 1 bookkeeper tile, adding extra point score for the end of the game.
Isle of Skye: Adjacency Scrolls (Nachbarschafts Schriftrollen) - Six tiles added to the mix, containing scrolls that score features on adjacent tiles.
205611.name: Deutscher Spielepreis 2016 Goodie Box

205612.name: Longinus
205612.description:
From the back of the book:

Longinus

Thou, become a spear piercing evil!

Its name is "Longinus"
The persons protecting the world, becoming the spear for the powerless people. ...
That is "Longinus" under the leadership of Anzelot. In this book we explain, at the same time as putting a spot light on them who have been an unknown existence thus far, the demon lords - strong invading demons coming from the Rikai, as well as the arbiters manging the world.

The End of Childhood
In addition, this book includes the complete replay "The End of Childhood - HUMAN SYSTEM", which is right on the spot for the theme of this book. Its writer is Shinji Tanaka, who has gained a valorous reputation as a player.
You will shed tears, in the bursting "Kawatana" season!

205613.description:
'Imperial Skies' is a table top miniatures-based wargame of airship, dirigible, Zeppelin and aircraft battles, played out over the land, sea and skies of the early 20th Century.

"Fleets of flying ships are pitted against each other in fast-paced aerial tactical combat. Gather powerful fleets of your favourite nation including Battleships, Dreadnoughts, Cruisers, Destroyers, Aircraft, Bombers and Patrol Boats."

Imperial Skies is set in an alternate historical period ranging from the late 19th Century through 1920. Although designed around the Brigade Models 'Aeronef' line of miniature figures, the system does include guidelines for creating game profiles for original creations and figures from other miniature lines.
205613.name: Imperial Skies

205614.name: ナイトウィザード The 2nd Edition
205614.description:
From the back of the book:

When the red room rises, the fight begins.
When a moon shining crinsom rises into the sky, the world distorts, the truth becomes exposed. Emulators - Invaders coming from outside the world. The only ones who can defeat those strong enemies, are the "magicians of the dark of night" - the Night Wizards.

New enemies, new wizards.
New emulators called "dark demons" have appeared. Because of the appearance of these strong enemies, who surpass "invading demons", the emulators thus far, the world is facing new danger. And as if responding to this danger, among the wizards as well, persons appeared awakening to new power. Borrowing the strength of the demon lords, the kings of the invading demons who should be their enemies, the night wizards carry on fighting.
The present day magical fantasy TRPG "Night Wizard" presented by Takeshi Kikuchi becomes The 2nd Edition and makes a grand appearance!!

Night Wizard! The 2nd Edition
The world is being targetted

205615.name: Stranded No More: Captain's Revenge
205615.description:
Description from the publisher:

Nearly five years have passed since your crew led a mutiny against you, Captain Oscar Locke. After surviving the island and the unfortunate souls who landed there to bury their treasure, you have set sail back to your old pillaging grounds, the West Indies. A little birdy has informed you that your former crew has split up and now five of them are leading their own vessels. It’s time to take back what’s yours by any means possible. Whether you steal their treasure without them knowing and sail away or decide to send them to Davy Jones’ locker afterwards, your goal is to collect all five treasures and return safely to the open water.

SNM: CR is a free Print and Play solitaire game that relies on dice rolling to move both the player's ship, 5 other NPC ships, and to decide all combat. The goal of the game is collect all of the treasure held by the NPC ships without being sunk.

205616.name: Civilian Starships
205616.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Stars Without Number science fiction role-playing game has a wonderfully simple starship design process based on installing Fittings into a few standard hull types, but the books lack a comprehensive list of basic ship designs for quick use by a GM or players. Given the assumed setting of most SWN games, it isn’t surprising that standard ship designs would not be common. Each world or small interstellar state would most likely have unique designs that meet their unique needs. However, we have found that it is often a lot easier to have some basic designs to start with that can be modified to fit a given situation rather than designing each ship from scratch every time. There are essentially no civilian designs for starships for SWN. This product hopes to help solve this problem.

During the design of these civilian ships, there were several additional Fittings that we felt would have helped us, so below the designs you will find a list of new Fittings, aimed at Civilian ships such as would be used by player characters. This product also details six “standard” ship designs created using the core rulebook and the Skyward Steel supplement, both available from SineNomine Publishing; additionally, there are six ship designs including new Fittings defined in this publication.

Included are:

Clarified starship operation cost rules.
6 civilian starship designs using core-book fittings.
6 new starship fittings.
6 civilian starships utilizing the new fittings.

205617.name: Kung-Fu Kuma: The Price of Death
205617.description:
From publisher blurb:

Price of Death is an adventure for the Kung Fu Kuma campaign world and the Pathfinder Game System ™. It is an introductory adventure for 3-5 adventurers without any experience. While 1st level characters with some experience can be brought into the adventure without any difficulty, the wealth and equipment they have acquired will make the adventure much easier than intended. This adventure is also specifically intended for four characters. Bringing along fewer or more characters will affect the difficulty of the adventure accordingly.

205618.name: ナイトウィザード The 3rd Edition
205618.description:
From the back of the book:

The red moon rising in the broken world, that is the beginning of the fight.

Together with the red moon, the gate to another world opens.
The third bullet of the present day fantasy RPG presented by Takeshi Kikuchi makes its grand appearance!
The stage for the game is Far The Earth, a world very similar to present day earth. Unknown to the people, this world is being invaded by the "invading demons (emulators)", inhabitants of another world. They are fearsome enemies, against whom normal weapons are virtually useless. But there is still hope left for the world. The name of that hope is "wizards", persons fighting with the lost power of magic.
You become "wizards", and challenge the invading demons in order to defend the world.

The disintegrating world, the four knights of the end, arrive.
The "world kekkai" protecting the earth from the invading demons. But because of the layers upon layers of invasions by the invading demons, the "world kekkai" has weakened. The "four knights" of the end appear in order to infringe on the world and destroy it. In order to resist them with their great power, the wizards have to grow stronger and concentrate their powers. Now, the power of new wizards - you are needed!
