Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_Frenzy Battle Frenzy]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

205718.name: Malifaux: Guild – Lawyer
205718.description:
Description from the publisher:

"Objection!" The Lawyer is a support piece that inflicts damaging de-buffs, improves your models' defense against horror and doles out Hard to Wound. 32mm 'heroic' scale high quality metal cast miniature.

205719.name: Malifaux: Outcast – Lazarus
205719.description:
Description from the publisher:

Outcast Box Set, containing one 32mm 'heroic' scale miniature made of high quality Plastic.

205720.name: デーモンロード
205720.description:
From the back of the book:
The temptation of the demon lords lure the wizards into darkness

"Demon lord seal" and "seal bearers"
"Demon Lord" is a supplement (collection of additional rules and data) for "Night Wizard The 3rd Edition", introducing the demon lords of the Rikai who are opponents of the wizards. In this book, the new rule '"demon lord seal" and "seal bearers"' is added as a new relationship between demon lords and wizards. The demon lords pushes their coat of arms called "demon lord seal" onto all their belongings to make them "seal bearers". Having received the seal, "seal bearers" are granted the power of the demon lord at the price of their soul. Can you resist the temptation of darkness?

New Records
Besides the "demon lord seals", we have prepared additional data to strengthen existing characters and classes and to widen special skills, brooms and their options. And in addition as new powers for recorders, we added 3 records, beginning with WW2 (air).

205722.name: Miracles of the Sleeper
205722.description:
From the introduction:

The Sleeper is one of the oldest deities known, easily predating this age or possibly even the current concept of ages. The Sleeper has been revered as Death before the mainstream cult adopted the new name. As one might expect the cult of The Sleeper is not limited to one race or once culture. Death, the long sleep, is a very universal principle after all.

205723.name: Hedge Wizard Apprentice's Spellbook
205723.description:
From the introduction:

The Apprenticeship of a Hedge Wizard will last at least three years. Quite often it take a young man or woman longer to master all the basics to the satisfaction of their master. And even if a young apprentice should prove to be a astonishingly fast learner a master will hardly ever let them finish their apprenticeship before the end of the third year. Instead they will have their apprentice get more practice under their belt in the remaining time.

205724.name: Apprentice's Spellbook of the Flame Eternal
205724.description:
From the introduction:

The Towers of the Full Moon are one of the four large formalized schools of magic. The teaching at these towers are focused on offensive and defensive combat oriented spells, although spells more commonly found in the repertoire of students of the other schools are not entirely unheard of either.

205725.name: ナイトウィザード　The 3rd Edition 上級ルールブック
205725.description:
From the back of the book:

Under the red moon,
new wizards are gathering

Broom wizards appear
The present day fantasy RPG "Night Wizard The 3rd Edition" delivered by Takeshi Kikuchi. This book is an advanced rules book containing additional data, additional rules for it. This book adds 13 kinds of classes, like the recorders, fighting by wearing the "memories of the world", "aspects of the past", or the "broommen", human shaped brooms ... that is wizards who are robots, or "broom riders" who are pilots mounting brooms as weapons. Adding these to the rule books already printed, that's 31 classes.

School Maze
"School maze", the training facility for wizard pupils stretching out under the Kimei campus. It is the world's most dangerous lesson. By using the school maze, the range of your "Night Wizard The 3rd Edition" sessions should widen greatly.

205727.name: Virtual Gate
205727.description:
From the back of the book:

The real world (copied world) is false (a game), games are reality (real).
The battlefield of the night wizards moves to the electronic world

Cyber World
"Virtual Gate" is a supplement introducing the cyber world defined by IT arts and computers. It contains an online recorded replay with the cyber world as the stage, additional dara protecting PCs in the world of electronics, as well as rules for "avatars" the appearances in the cyber world and clans showing solidarity between wizards.

A world of technology and the soul
It also introduces the other world that exists just like the cyber world overimposed over the real world, in other words the psychic world created by human souls. Just as in the cyber world, wizards, beginning with dream hunters, get to fight in it wearing appearances called "dreamers". Try putting alien worlds together yourself using the new data, avatars and dreamers.

205728.name: Millennial Apartment Hunters
205728.description:
Publisher's blurb

Millennial Apartment Hunters is a saterical descriptive horror game designed to combine HGTV’s House Hunters with the harsh economic dystopia faced by young people trying to live in major cities.

MAH is a descriptive horror game, focused on creating detailed horrific environments.

205729.name: Heroes of Normandie: Kampania Czterej Pancerni
205729.description: Promo campaign from Portal Games. Contains 3 missions based on polish TV series "Czterej Pancerni i pies"("Forum tankist and a dog") and hero tank tile "Rudy 102"("Redhead 102").

205730.name: Reflections
205730.description:
Publisher blurb
Reflections is a two-player RPG about samurai that will duel to the death. The game begins with the two players setting the scene of their duel, then flashing back to play through the events that have led them to this moment. The game ends when one, or both, samurai are dead.

205731.name: オーバーライト
205731.description:
From the back of the book:

Everything has been stolen from the girl.
Colour, feeling, and memories ...

Appearance of a campaign scenario collection
A campaign scenario collection enters the stage for the present day magical fantasy RPG "NIGHT WIZARD The 3rd Edition" presented by Takeshi Kikuchi. This book contains a campaign scenario (scenarios that take a shape like a serialized drama) formed by 5 + α scenarios. By playing these scenarios, you should be able to play sessions that have offer an amusement differing from that of one-off-play.

Let's rewrite the heroine
In this campaign scenario, the heroine slowly grows along the PCs, recovering (randomly defined by the rules for creating cute heroines) the elements that make up the self she has lost. Yes, every time the campaign is played, the heroine has a completely different individuality, colour. We hope you will raise her via the campaign to your very own heroine.

205732.name: BattleTech D6 Dice
205732.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sets of six plastic dice in for BattleTech game from Catalyst Game Labs. Customized for House Marik.

205735.name: Knights of the Doom
205735.description:
From the back of the book:

The four knights of destruction, they come accompanied by fear, devastation, and death.

Appearance of a scenario supplement
The appearance of a scenario supplement for the present day magical fantasy RPG "NIGHT WIZARD The 3rd Edition" presented by Takeshi Kikuchi. This book records 3 scenarios whose theme are the invading demons called "the four knights". Through these scenarios, the wizards step deeply into the schemes of the destruction of the human race surrounded by the four knights. It also includes detailed introductions and explanations of the four knights and their servants for the creation of original scenarios.

Scenario creation tool
The book contains rules and charts for the creation of scenarios, as well as templates for boss characters and enemy special skills. In addition, a chart for the conception of NPCs for usage in scnearios as well as templates for scenario creation have also been prepared. Putting these to use, you should be able to generating scenarios via building blocks.

205738.description:
A solo/cooperative mode for Vikings Gone Wild.
It includes:

18 undead units card
15 undead buildings
5 bosses
6 tasks
8 objectives
1 Ragnarok!
1 helper card
205738.name: Vikings Gone Wild: Ragnarok!

205739.name: ディア・フレンド
205739.description:
From the back of the book:

Would you please be so kind as to come to our christmas year-end-party?
Please answer either "Yes" or "Okay"♪

This one book brought to "NIGHT WIZARD" fans
Reading the replay, listening to the voice drama, playing the scenario! The supplement where 3 joys have been pressed in - that is the "NIGHT WIZARD The 3rd Edition Fanbook"!

The feast of the wizards and the greater demon lord
This time, the stage for the voice drama is a christmas year-end-party held by Anzelot. This entertainment is coloured by full versions of all theme songs and insert songs used in the fanbooks until now! In addition, a new song sung bei voice actress Naomi Wakabayashi is also recorded. And it also contains the replay "Hello Goodbye" where Itsukaichi Korone, who stars in the voice drama is the main character. Having become famous in a single leap as a "painfully cute idol" she gets caught up in an incident -.

205740.name: A Million Random Digits with 100,000 Normal Deviates
rpgcategory: Non-Rankable Item (item will not show in the rankings)
205740.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

Not long after research began at RAND in 1946, the need arose for random numbers that could be used to solve problems of various kinds of experimental probability procedures. These applications, called Monte Carlo methods, required a large supply of random digits and normal deviates of high quality, and the tables presented here were produced to meet those requirements. This book was a product of RAND's pioneering work in computing, as well a testament to the patience and persistence of researchers in the early days of RAND. The tables of random numbers in this book have become a standard reference in engineering and econometrics textbooks and have been widely used in gaming and simulations that employ Monte Carlo trials. Still the largest published source of random digits and normal deviates, the work is routinely used by statisticians, physicists, poll-takers, market analysts, lottery administrators, and quality control engineers.

205741.name: Mobius Final Fantasy
205741.description:
Despair has cast a long, dark shadow across this land. The winds have stopped, the seas churn, and the earth rots.

The people await for a hero to appear—the hero foretold in an ancient prophecy: "When darkness shrouds the land, the Warrior of Light will come. Hope rides in his wake."

After a long journey across the Ether, castaways without pasts appear on the shores of Palamecia. One of them is destined to become the warrior of legend.

You stand among them.

Are you the hero whom the prophecy foretells?

Source: The Game Website.

205742.name: Elves Adventure
205742.description:
User Summary

This FPS has you collect coins/stars and weapons to attack enemies.

205743.description: Le Docte Rat Bouffe is a trivia game on the words and pleasures of eating, not on cooking. Through humorous questions, it covers themes such as food, dishes, national dishes, health, food labels, food vocabulary and expressions, eating and singing, eating and cinema, etc.
205743.name: Le Docte Rat Bouffe

205744.name: Schema
205744.description:
User summary:

Schema presents a generic, universal mechanism to enable rapid character creation and resolve complex actions. Although generic, the game is presented with a fantasy veneer of formatting and examples. The mechanism is light-weight and fairly rapid to utilize.

The game uses Fudge Dice during resolution. Characters are created by drawing custom cards (provided as print-and-play components) with various traits and components on them. Cards may be randomly distributed or deliberately selected. Tracking statistics, such as health, is done with token pools. The game uses an atypical play surface organization, more typically seen in collectible card game play.

205745.name: Fairest
205745.description:
Boons for Schema

From the introduction:

A boon is a special ability possessed by, or magical treasure bound to, a character. Most boons have an ongoing effect, as well as one or more "Invoked" effects.

User summary:

The document presents several custom cards intended for print-and-play use.

205746.name: The Elder Scrolls Online: Shadows of the Hist
videogameexpansion: The Elder Scrolls Online: Tamriel Unlimited
205746.description:
User Summary

The Elder Scrolls Online: Shadows of the Hist is the fifth official DLC game pack for The Elder Scrolls Online.

It is a Argonian-themed DLC pack that have two new dungeons: the Cradle of Shadows and Ruins of Mazzatun, but is the first DLC that does not add a new zone. The setting is the Black Marsh, a province under the control of the Ebonheart Pact.

The DLC will also feature: New Monster Masks, New Item Sets, and Costume Dyeing.

205747.name: Danger Cards
205747.description:
From the introduction:

Action using this mini-system proceeds as usual in a roleplaying game; players describe their actions, the guide responds with results, and so on. The rules are engaged when the Guide thinks that the actions are dangerous and would like to add a somewhat random element to play.

User summary:

These print-and-play cards present an essentially self-contained "mini-system" to use in any roleplaying game. Although they feature a light fantasy genre, they could easily be adapted to any other genre.

205748.name: Tenocha: Art Pack
205748.description:
From the introduction:

[Tenocha: Art Pack] exists primarily so anyone wishing to translate Tenocha into their preferred rules, or wanting to make their own handouts and notes look "official", can do so with ease.

User summary:

This item is distributed as a ZIP archive that expands into a directory structure with dozens of graphic images drawn from the game. Also included is a PDF introductory description.

205749.description:
BattleTech: Interstellar Operations is the fifth core rulebook in the BattleTech Total Warfare line. It enables players to scale the action up beyond a single solar system.

Interstellar Operations contains rules for running an entire faction's military as a player tries to conquer numerous solar systems, including rules for how to conduct warfare through scales larger than previously represented within the core line of rulebooks. Finally, perhaps one of the most anticipated portions of the book, the Alternate Eras section introduces a huge swath of rules for playing across the thousand years of Battletech history, including weapons and equipment mostly unique to a given era, such as complete rules for building and playing with LAMs.
205749.name: BattleTech: Interstellar Operations

205750.name: Situations for Tabletop Roleplaying: Second Set
205750.description:
From the introduction:

[Situations for Tabletop Roleplaying: Second Set] is a compilation of five articles - methods for building situations for tabletop roleplaying. Each of the methods is a simple procedure; by working through one of these procedures, you'll generate the core "stuff" needed for a session or two of play. This is the second set of five such articles available.

205751.description:
BattleTech: Campaign Operations is the sixth core rulebook in the Battletech: Total Warfare line. It contains force construction and campaign rules the BattleTech system.

Campaign Operations contains rules for creating and running forces, whether a down-on-their-luck mercenary battalion, or a fully-supplied House regiment. The volume also contains complete rules for devising solar systems, allowing players to recreate existing star systems or craft all-new worlds to challenge each other. The final sections of the book bring several options to the table for campaign play. Building off of previous sections in Total Warfare and Strategic Operations, the Narrative Campaign, Map-based Campaign, and Chaos Campaign rules allow players to build exciting, fun campaigns of almost any stripe for their newly-minted forces!
205751.name: BattleTech: Campaign Operations

205752.name: Pour les nuls: Le jeu
205752.description:
Move from one room to another in the house (kitchen, bedroom, ...) and answer questions: history, religion, sports, cooking, ...

Accumulate points with every good answer! The winner is the first to get 20 points!

205753.name: Gallows of Madness
205753.description:
Publisher's Blurb

The Abyss Approaches!

Something wicked—and monstrous—stirs around the rugged Isgeri town of Saringallow, where the hated legacy of noble Chelish diabolists runs deep. With the recent disappearance of several apprentices, the nearby menace of particularly grotesque goblins, and the unsettling rumors about the old Sarini Estate, Mayor Sandra Trinelli knows that she needs help, and she needs it fast! The heroes must confront one of these crises, or all three, if they hope to stem the tide of darkness that looms. Before too long, the heroes discover that villains with ties to the Abyss have set their sights on Saringallow, and won't rest until the settlement and all its innocent inhabitants fall victim to their madness-inducing predations!

Gallows of Madness is a 64-page, highly versatile collection of three adventures for 1st-level characters. Each adventure also includes scaling information for parties of 2nd-level characters. Written with beginning Game Masters and players in mind while also providing challenging content for veterans, these adventures can be prepared quickly and run separately or in any order. For GMs who wish to run a deeper, more narrative game, this volume also offers an overarching timeline of events and detailed tips for running these adventures as a cohesive whole. Bonus content includes new monstrous foes and a gallery of NPCs to help easily connect the adventures, plus a gorgeous double-sided poster featuring an overview of Saringallow and a miniatures-scale battlemap!

205754.name: Children's Radio Hour
205754.description:
#Threeforged RPG Design Challenge Entry



This RPG item was a submission to the #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge. It was developed by three different designers in a randomized, anonymous fashion. For details, and for information on how the versions are structured, see the series RPGGeek entry here: #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge 2015. All of the entries are available here: #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge Winners and Everything
Entry #15100; Stage One: Steve Jakoubovitch; Stage Two: Ivan Nevill; Stage Three: Mendel Schmiedekamp




User summary:

Most of the game document is designed for print-and-play use. Players each receive a "playbook" specific to their role in the game. The rules they will need are included in their handout.

During development, this game was known as The Tellers, One Hour 'til Bedtime, and Children's Radio Hour.

205755.name: Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Issue 233 - 2016)
rpgissuearticle: Back Room at the Games Pit
205755.description:
"The Lost Knights"
Cover by The Fraim Brothers

205756.name: The End (2015)
205756.description:
#Threeforged RPG Design Challenge Entry



This RPG item was a submission to the #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge. It was developed by three different designers in a randomized, anonymous fashion. For details, and for information on how the versions are structured, see the series RPGGeek entry here: #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge 2015. All of the entries are available here: #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge Winners and Everything
Entry #15102; Stage One: J Groves; Stage Two: Aaron Kesher; Stage Three: Sean Duncan





From the introduction:You had a life before The End. It may have been worse; odds are it was better. Whatever the case, who you were is the foundation of what you now can do, though not always in the way you expect. Everyone who's going to be a player in the game should make a crew member. One person will need to play everything else -- they are the “Master of the End”, and shouldn't make a character, but can contribute suggestions.

205757.name: Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Issue 234 - 2016)
rpgissuearticle: Back Room at the Games Pit
205757.description:
"The Incredible Hack"
Cover by The Fraim Brothers

205758.name: The Woodlands
205758.description:
[Taken from the publishers site.]

'THE WOODLANDS, A TABLETOP ROLEPLAYING GAME'

The Woodlands is a game about woodland creatures, both big and small, who have banded together to fend off the dangerous and callous predators who have plagued them since the first sunrise.

To see this done, they've created an order or animals known as The Wardens. The Wardens patrol the woodland passageways, carry messages between animal settlements, defend the borders, and help those in need wherever they may be and whatever the danger.

You are a Warden, whether newly recruited or a veteran of many battles, you give your time, and if necessary your life, to keep others safe from harm. You'll face many challenges in the wild, from raging storms to the most dangerous of predators, but you will prevail; 'A Warden gives all to live all!'

This project was funded through My Patreon and requires previous experience with another Powered by the Apocalypse roleplaying game to play. Inside you'll find the playbooks, moves, and MC materials to play and run The Woodlands.

4-6 Players. Ages 12+. Low-Prep. Low Emotional Intensity.

205759.name: VHS Fury
205759.description:
From the introduction:

Each of you plays a specific and important role in the film-making process: the Script Writer, Financier, Company Actor, and Cinematographer.
...
The roles can be played as any race, gender, religion, sexual orientation, etc. The only things known about the characters are the things written below. If you think of something that would be interesting to establish about your character, make it so! Figure out a way to interject it into the discussions you have about the films, before and after they are made, with the other characters.

205760.name: State Cinema
205760.description:
From the introduction:

You have been given the great honor of fulfilling His Majesty’s decree to make a weekly action television series about the evil machinations of the vile foreign powers and cowardly traitors. The latter will be personified as fantastic super villains to be defeated by His Majesty himself (played by a body double) for the glory of the One True State. Week after week, the people of The One True State will see the futility of corruption and the glory of His Majesty!

Unfortunately, all of The One True State's scriptwriters and similar intellectuals are currently being reeducated, so you will have to improvise. Surely seasoned actors like yourselves are more than up to the task!

205761.description:
Description from the publisher:

Dixit: Revelations invites you to go beyond what you see at first glance and discover what lies hidden between — or hidden by — the lines. Featuring art by the French illustrator Marina Coudray, Dixit: Revelations looks utterly unlike any Dixit expansion that has preceded it. Coudray's mysterious and enchanting images are heavily influenced by early twentieth century design, from the Art Deco movement to Surrealism, even while they convey stories and ideas that may be millennia old. In her art you’ll find echoes of Picasso, Magritte, Matisse, Escher, Greek myth, Indian religion, pop music, internet memes, and much, much more... In these stylized pieces, reminiscent of New York City’s architecture and glass Tiffany lamps, you’ll find many allusions to ancient myths and folk tales.

Dixit: Revelations is an expansion for Dixit that contains 84 new cards for use with that game. In Dixit, each round one player takes on the role of Storyteller, choosing one card from his hand, then telling a story, singing a ditty, or otherwise doing something that in his opinion is associated with the played card. Each other player then chooses one card in her own hand and gives it to the Storyteller in secret. These cards are shuffled and revealed, then players vote on which card was played by the Storyteller. If either no one or everyone votes for the Storyteller, then he receives no points; if he received some votes but not all of the votes, he scores based on the number of votes received. Each player who submitted a correct vote or who received a vote on her card submission also scores. After a certain number of rounds, the player with the most points wins.
205761.name: Dixit: Revelations
boardgamepodcastepisode: Ep 043 – Essen Part II Expansion Preview

205762.name: Wizarding
205762.description:
From the introduction:

This is a storytelling game that seeks to recreate the adventures of many tales about the experience of magic, and of learning about magic in an otherwise mundane world. The storytelling is generally of a highly collaborative nature, with the players working together with the game master to develop a consensus setting for the game, and then the players acting as a close-knit group of friends who are engaged in learning about magic, while solving mysteries and having adventures.

205763.name: Down
205763.description:
Down is based off a traditional ladder game played in Korea. You play by following a set of lines from the top of the cards to the bottom, making turns as needed. In Down, the player must try to collect gold coins and avoid red hexagons. Players have a limited number of stars that they can use to control the course they take...they are great for squeezing out those extra coins, but use them too much and you are left at the cards' mercy.

This game uses 9 cards, and can be played with the cards being held in one hand, so you can play it while standing on the train after work, waiting in a queue for a rollercoaster, or even when taking a well-needed 'parent break' (hiding from children in the bathroom).

205764.name: Salt Crown
205764.description:
Besides armored vehicles and planes, [several] countries started to use experimental drugs that gave supernatural abilities to their soldiers. This great power provoked accelerated deterioration that caused users of the drugs to wither away at incredibly accelerated rates. To compensate for this undesired effect, these "lab rats" were young men and women in their prime but without beloved relatives who would miss them and who had their whole lives ready to be sacrificed in the name of the faction that were using them.

Playable characters (PCs) are a group of young soldiers exposed to these experimental serums and their effects.

205765.name: Pocket Rivals Strategy Card Game
205765.description:
Pocket Rivals Strategy Card Game first edition comes with two 9-card 'deck' teams: Monsters Vs Robots. The game is designed for 2 players and is friendly for ages 8 and up. The first player to reduce their opponent's team of 9 cards to a single card left on the playing field is the winner.

Pocket Rivals Strategy Card Game playing field is a 3 x 6 grid with room for a single card within each grid space. The board is placed between the two players who face each other across the longest edges of the board. Each of the two players has 9 cards. Each card has stats for Power, Wits, Charm, & Speed arranged on the top, Left, Right, & bottom sides respectively. Each stat is printed with a value from 1 to 4.

Starting from a random arrangement of all 18 cards on the grid, players take turns removing one another's cards via a 'challenge' mechanism that compares stats on adjacent cards.

On a given turn, players activate a single card from their team on the field. They may move that card (one space in a cardinal direction), challenge an adjacent card (removing it from the field), and use the unique 'talent' ability associated with their activated card. The player may do up to all three of these actions in a single turn in any order. Gameplay continues with the players alternating turns until one team has been reduced to a single card.

Each card features a single character. The front of the card is Gallery Mode: full color art with the character name. The back of the card is Challenge Mode: single color gradient art, character talent, and a yellow rim containing a stat for each edge of the card.

The story conceit behind the game is that each player is an Ace Tactician who has selected 9 Ally Champions from across a myriad of Pocket Dimensions to face off against 9 Rivals and a Rival Ace. First to force their foe's faction from the field finishes as First Place Ace!

205766.name: Mino & Tauri
205766.description:
Mino & Tauri are aliens who have crashed on Earth and need to recover twelve items from the cornfield for their spaceship so that they can head home. Time to lend them a hand!

The game is set up with one of four magnetic game boards being placed vertically between the two active players. (With more than two players, you play in turns based on colored team cards.) The Mino and Tauri characters are placed on opposite sides of the game board, and players take turns leading them through the cornfield, trying not to step out of bounds along the way. Can you collect all twelve items before the sandtimer runs out?

205767.name: Cayzle's Little Splat Book of Prestige & Class
205767.description:
From the front cover:

Being a treasury of twelve prestige classes (and one excellent race) for use with the Pathfinder flavor of Dungeons & Dragons.

User summary:

Includes brief notes about implementing prestige classes in the game, including issues of balance.

205768.name: Monster Mash
205768.description: Monster Mash requires players to match monster color or card color or monster type before other players. Be the first to grab the squishy monster in the middle of the table, and you win the round, which allows you to add cards to your opponent's hand. Whoever first rids themselves of cards wins!

205769.name: ButterKO
205769.description: In ButterKO, players attempt to win the most point cards (large butterflies) by matching existing butterflies on the board. Incorrect matches forfeit points. A bit of strategic placement is required with basic rules for placing new cards onto the board.

205770.name: Hootie Cutie
205770.description: In the real-time game Hootie Cutie, players attempt to find matching animals on the cards placed on the board, but they cannot play on previous played cards. In the end, whoever collects the most friend cards wins!

205771.name: High Risk!: Expansion Module 1.0
205771.description:
Description from the publisher:

Now enhance you High Risk! system with this exciting new Military module! Continue the Struggle with SAC Bombers, Electronic Countermeasures, Surface to Air Missiles, Rapid Deployment Forces or Tactical Nuclear Weapons under your commend!

205772.name: Snatch
205772.description: In Snatch, a new take on Spoons and similar designs players try to collect the full set of one type of animal card, while passing unwanted cards to the next player. Aside from simply collecting all of the cards, though, a number of tokens lie in the middle of the table, and if a player can collect a set of cards matching one of these tokens, then they can collect one fewer card and still win.

205773.name: School Maze
205773.description:
From the back of the book:

A place where young wizards study
This book "School Maze" is a sourcebook containing additional rules and data for "Night Wizard! The 2nd Edition". The 4 new classes mutant, alchemist, samurai, taoist are added, and additional special abilities for the classes that have existed thus far have also been prepared. In addition, it adds spells and magic items and the like that are useful when exploring fortresses.

Challenge the gekkou that have become mazes
The book adds rules for handling "fortresses", maze-shaped gekkous and data for traps and enemies and the like, and it also contains rules for random fortress generation. And, as an establishment for using these rules and data, the Kimei campus has been prepared. Young wizards! Challenge the giant maze "School Maze" stretching out under the ground of the campus!

School Maze
The campus maze waits for you

205774.description:
Welcome to the post-apocalyptic battles of tireless robots! You're watching "Steel Arena: Friday Night Robot Fight Show"; more precisely, all that remains of it because the world is in ruins, but they keep on fighting! Arm your robot directly while fighting and conquer your enemies!

In Steel Arena: Friday Night Robot Fight, you can make a cruel duel and gather up to four robots in a team battle or in a crazy war against everyone. Each player takes control of a robot and tries to eliminate the other players in the modular arena; the arena consists of hexes that are "spaces" to move and also modules that can be picked up during the fight and used to upgrade your robot to make it more deadly.

Each turn, a player activates their robot's modules in different combos that allow it to turn, move, fight and defend. There are a lot of weapons working in various ways: melee, direct fire, plunging fire, explosives, acoustic, etc. Causing damage to an opponent's robot destroys its modules and lets you take it as a trophy (victory points). The game ends when any of the robots are completely eliminated or when the stack of the modules runs out, then the player with the most trophies wins.

They were created for the show, so even after the apocalypse, the show must go on!
205774.name: Steel Arena: Friday Night Robot Fight

205775.name: Shifter Bots RPG
205775.description:
From publisher blurb:

Have you ever wanted to tear things up as an enormous shapechanging robot? Well now you can! This complete game takes the Black Hack OSR rules and reskins them for intense Saturday morning action.

Inside you get four classes, the Infiltrator, Officer, Tech and Warrior. There are also rules for creating your own alternate mode so you can turn from a robot to a car and back again.

The weapons system allows you to customize your gear after every mission. Want a lazer crossbow? Sure! How a bout an extendible chainsaw. Why not? You can do it all in Shifter Bots!

205776.name: Gentleman's Deal
205776.description:
Description from the publisher:

In this game, you turn into one of the influential citizens of a small but very wealthy town. Gathered together with others authoritative persons like yourself in some hidden place, you share money earned from another shady business. You need to use all your diplomatic tricks to make deals to determine how much money everyone collects. Can you be silver-tongued enough to please everyone, including yourself? You should because the player with the most money wins the game!

Gentleman’s Deal is a diplomatic party game about sharing money. Each turn, one player becomes a dealer and receives a secret card with the amount of money they must share. They make offers personally to each player, then those players simultaneously vote "yes" or "no". If a deal was accepted by a majority of players, they gain all offered by dealer and the dealer takes the rest! The dealer must balance between being too generous and too greedy because if a majority of players vote to decline their offer, the dealer heads to jail and must skip their next turn.

Acquiring money isn't the only goal of the deals. Players also share useful contacts represented by the cards of different accomplices that give powerful benefits, and everybody wants to obtain them.

The game ends after several rounds depending on the number of players, and whoever has most money wins!

205777.name: Generic Non-Player Characters: An Assortment of Wizards, Warlocks, and Their Followers
205777.description:
From publisher blurb:

ARE THEY FRIENDS OR FOES?

The player characters are the stars of the adventure, but they are measured by the foes they fight... and they move through a world populated by others who would help or hinder them in their quests. DMs can find both of those in this book!

Generic Non-Player Characters: An Assortment of Wizards, Warlocks, and Their Followers is a collection of NPC stats, presented in the format used in the Monster Manual of the world's most popular roleplaying game for immediate use. You bring the adventure, and we provide the stats.

As a bonus, this product includes several new spells with which to bedevil the PCs... and which they can add to their rewards when they stand victorious at the end of the battle!

205778.name: Spin It
205778.description:
This two-player game from Milton Bradley comes with two acorn-shaped wooden tops and a target sheet of cardboard inset in the box bottom. The sheet has 18 holes with values ranging from 5 to 100.

Players take turns spinning their tops and recording the value each time it stops. First player to 500 points wins.

The earliest version of this game has a box cover showing two children playing the game on a small table, with a rural landscape seen through the window behind them. While the game is undated, the style of the graphics and the "Bradley's Best Games" logo on the box suggests a 19th Century or early 20th Century publication date.

205779.name: Road to Armageddon D10 System Players Handbook
205779.description:
From publisher blurb:

The dogs of war have been loosed – the world is facing down nuclear and biological Armageddon between the West and two ruthless power blocs aiming at nothing less than total victory and the complete emasculation and/or destruction of anyone who opposes their cultural dominance.

The struggle between these blocs has been going on for years, but has only recently become a hot war ... normally called the Three Way War in the west, the Anti-Imperialist War in the Russo-Japanese alliance and the New Jihad in the Islamic states ... and a nasty one.

Rationing is commonplace, consumer goods in short supply or, in some cases, completely unavailable ... even the militaries of the nations involved have begun to suffer from the inability of their damaged national economies to build the needed equipment for their expanding war efforts (or, indeed, even to repair or replace damaged equipment).

It is against this background that your campaign will be set, and in which your players will be running the characters that they create using this rule booklet. They will have the opportunity to defend their nation and its allies and to oppose the fanatical plans of the opposition ...

Can they do enough to make a difference?

This book covers a cut down version of the Core Rules – for Character creation, combat, and for many actions Characters are likely to be faced with. There is also a small selection of Personal Gear, Weapons and Vehicles to enable a basic game to be run using this book alone.

205780.name: Ultramodern5
205780.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ultramodern5 is the follow-up of the popular Ultramodern4

The mission of U5 is to present 5th EDITION rules for use in non-fantasy settings. These include pre-modern settings, contemporary settings, and those that are far flung fantastic and futuristic. U5 presents modern and science fiction rules in a game usually reserved for fantasy. There is no established setting in U5.

It presents classes, gear, and scenarios that can be inserted into any campaign, including the following:

Cyberpunk
Espionage
Modern Warfare
Space Opera
Techno Fantasy
Urban Fantasy
Steampunk
Wild West (with or without aliens)




You may explore the rules in whatever context you wish. Rules are generalized, encouraging homebrew settings and the rebranding of elements.

Create a pure science fiction setting, or insert these rules into your own fantasy world to offer a unique spin.

THIS SOURCEBOOK INCLUDES:

A revised “ladder” system, offering more adjustability with character creation. Modify your class with one of seven ladders.
Revamped rules around being human.
A new lifepath system incorporating backgrounds (with eleven new ones) into an adjustable life history where characters can select every aspect of their character’s history, from family and friends to past love affairs.
Ten new classes including the infiltrator, medic, sniper, and techie.
Twenty-four archetypes
All new weapons including traditional firearms, rocket launchers, and laser rifles
New armor including powered combat suits.
Purchase and modify vehicles
Over forty new monsters including giant robots.
Two included adventures — a zombie apocalypse and an alien invasion.

205782.name: Egyptian Heroes
205782.description:
From publisher blurb:

Heroes to Plunder the Pyramids

Egyptian Heroes brings you 8 richly detailed, ready-to-play pregenerated characters, created specifically to shine in any Pathfinder delving into the ancient and accursed (yet treasure-filled) ruins of a long-fallen civilization. Featuring classic races and classes, as well as newer or more unusual options, these characters make ideal allies, rivals, cohorts, contacts, or even replacement PCs, and include:

Asep Arukhet, human sorcerer
Dorian Masuud, human slayer (grave warden)
Kephenes Enterra, human cleric of the God of Magic (ecclesitheurge)
Merradine Feist, dhampir bard (archaeologist)
Namala Ikenwe, half-elf arcanist (school savant)
Parvanah Lisay, catfolk rogue (cat burglar)
"Val" Valdeseer Harringer, human paladin (holy gun)
and last but not least, the mysterious Ziyadi Sahrebe, human oracle (dual-cursed)




Each character includes a detailed backstory, roleplaying tips, special equipment, and links to each other and to official published Egyptian-themed adventures, with suggestions for advancing the character and fantastic character portraits with foldable paper miniatures for every character!

205783.name: Kingdoms
205783.description:
From publisher blurb:

Kingdoms brings you a complete system for creating cities and founding and ruling a nation of your very own. Designed for the 5th Edition rules, Kingdoms provides rules for settlements of every size, from tiny wayside villages to a sprawling metropolis, detailing prosperity and corruption, law and learning, and a wide range of government types and special characteristics. In addition, it includes a complete system for founding a kingdom, from exploring and claiming territory to building and developing cities and issuing edicts to manage your kingdom's economy and stability and for building up the loyalty of your subjects. You can play with a simple, abstract system or use any number of optional rules to develop trade, diplomacy, and more, and Kingdoms also includes a simple system of mass combat, allowing you to build armies to defend your kingdom from enemies or raise a mighty crusade to conquer all who stand before you. Your heroes have beaten the bandits, overcome the orcish onslaught, and defeated the dragon, but in between their adventures your heroes would rather return home to a mighty throne instead of a warm campfire, now they can with Kingdoms! Grab this fantastic 5E supplement today and Make Your Game Legendary!

205784.name: Soul Arts
205784.description:
From the back of the book:

A new power is born

The battle of the boys and girls begins
This book "Soul Arts" is a sourcebook for "Night Wizard! The 2nd Edition" containing a replay and additional data. It contains the replay "The Lights in The Sky are all Stars" depicting the battle between a boy who has awakened to to a new wizard's power as a "medium tuner" and emulators on the stage of the average rural town Aratoyama-shi as well as additional data starting with two new wizard classes.

The newly awakening wizards
Ever since the magical warfare, the world kekkai's weakening has been significant, and even now the world is on the brink of danger. But, at the same time, the number of newly awakening wizards is increasing. The two classes added thanks to this book are also symbolizing this new wizards' power. The "medium tuner" who fights projecting the powers of wizards remembered by the world into their other self, the "medium", and the "broom rider" who has specialized in the usage of "brooms", the symbol of present day wizards. Protect the world with new powers, magic users of the night!

205785.name: Nocturne (13th Age)
205785.description:
From publisher blurb:

For this realm of Suzerain, we mix gothic horror with dark fantasy to create a Frankenstein's monster wielding a vorpal sword.

Is Nocturne Dracula, or Frankenstein, or the Wolfman? Is Nocturne Ravenloft, Dark Souls or The Witcher? No, indeed not. Nocturne is its own gothic fantasy, holding many classic tropes dear to its heart while striking off in its own direction. Follow the Weave of the Lands and see where it leads you.

The darkness is a friend, a weapon and a mystery.

Hear the midnight song. Heed the nocturne.

Inside, you'll find what you need to create characters in this unique setting, a wealth of background information, a full campaign, heaps of side quests, and stats for all manner of new NPCs and critters

205786.name: Nocturne Player's Guide (13th Age)
205786.description:
From publisher blurb:

For this realm of Suzerain, we mix gothic horror with dark fantasy to create a Frankenstein's monster wielding a vorpal sword.

Is Nocturne Dracula, or Frankenstein, or the Wolfman? Is Nocturne Ravenloft, Dark Souls or The Witcher? No, indeed not. Nocturne is its own gothic fantasy, holding many classic tropes dear to its heart while striking off in its own direction. Follow the Weave of the Lands and see where it leads you.

The darkness is a friend, a weapon and a mystery.

Hear the midnight song. Heed the nocturne.

Inside this player's guide you'll find what you need to create characters in this unique setting, background information on key realm features, and a section on new equipment. Note: the player's guide is an extract of the players section from the full Nocturne book.

205787.name: Sky Heist
205787.description:
Admit it, you’d like to hit an airship bank high in the sky with the help of your not very faithful companions and a reliable single-seated airbike.

In Sky Heist you will join an airship bank robbery in a steampunk world. Being part of the gang you’ll have to take as much money as possible from the safe till the sheriff comes. But, as you know, a gangster riding a single-seated bike-plane hybrid can’t be trusted since you can get into a shootout and try to steal all the money for yourself. Load barrels, check parachutes — it is going to be epic.

Sky Heist is a fun card game that requires fast reaction. Each turn players discard cards into a loot deck using combinations. Besides they can play different special cards and also put the cards from their hands into a “revolver” area which limits their opportunities during the game but helps in the final duel. There are several sheriff cards inevitably causing the duel in which the card combinations that are put into the players’ revolvers are very important. As a result of the duel all the cards from the loot deck are shared as victory points among players. The game lasts for several rounds and the one who has got the most victory points becomes a winner.

205789.description:
Playing The Cookie 2.0 you will try yourself as Alice in the Absurdland or as a double agent who has to hunt for his victim and kill it on the one hand and not to become a victim himself on the other. But the game itself is not that cruel as it sounds: the cutest characters and bright illustrations will always remind you about it. Deduction, bluff, surrealism, sweet insanity and a cookie for the first player are in set!

The Cookie 2.0 includes basic rules for 4-6 players from the original version of The Cookie but also an absolutely new 2-4 player mode. In “The Big Hunt” mode players will have to figure out which character’s head is a price is put on. Besides to the price you need to stay in the game.

Each round consists of three stages. During the first stage you need to announce your role in the game… but you can lie! It’s up to you to choose what to say but keep in mind that any of your decisions will give useful information to other players. During the second stage you can try to uncover the role of the player that lied (as you think). And finally, during the third stage all the players, based on the information received, attack the hidden target card, then it is revealed and the winner is decided. But pay attention to the fact that you can not only attack the target but also other players!

This game is pure insanity where bluffing skills and cold-blooded premeditation can help to win!
205789.name: The Cookie 2.0

205790.description:
Doodle China (游画小镇) reimplements Doodle City and includes two playable cities: "Suzhou" and "Shanghai".


"Suzhou" plays like Doodle City. Players draft dice that indicate where on their sheets they may draw. Players try to draw a network of canals that connect houses, parks, markets and ships.



"Shanghai" uses the same basic mechanisms for dice drafting, but is played on a 6x6 grid and introduces completely new rules for scoring. One new building is the skyscraper. When activated, you either add another floor to the skyscraper, or finalize the building by drawing a road in its space. You then score 1 point per floor multiplied by the number of connected parks. When you score points, all other players must cross out this point value on their sheets, so each value can be scored by only one player throughout the game.


Shanghai also has hotels, with which you score points for the length of the road passing through the hotel (as in Doodle City), but again, each value can be scored by only one player.

There are no "wildcard dice" in Shanghai. Instead, when you choose dice that activate a park, you can draw in any space in that park's row; doing so costs you a tree.

At game's end, players score points for having made a large network of taxis and buses.
205790.name: Doodle China

205791.name: Trouble In The Manor
205791.description:
Trouble In The Manor is an online mystery game set in an old manor and is focused on working with your team of either innocents or murderers and bringing the opposite team down accordingly.

Source: The Developer Website.

205792.name: Embargo
205792.description:
Embargo is a pick up and delivery game with play mechanics similar to Monopoly or Easy Money, but laced with political jabs...just look at the box cover. The game challenges players to deliver 9 barrels of oil to a port in each country, while trying to avoid going broke. Landing on a competitor’s port (occupied by their colored barrel) makes you roll and multiply the dice together, then multiply them again by one thousand- ultimately paying that cost to the owner of that port.

While the goal is to deliver a barrel to each country you can forego that objective by placing all your barrels as strategically as possible, hoping to bankrupt the other players. This is a risky endeavor since you are preventing yourself the opportunity of an outright win, and you may end up going broke yourself while pursuing the rapid acquisition of ports.

With 4 players, ships are divided into pairs which navigate the oceans in opposite directions. Collisions with other ships are just one of the hazards when seafaring around the globe. Landing on an "Embargo" space causes you to pay $25,000 or lose your precious cargo of oil. Choosing the latter causes you to lose a turn the next time you want to reacquire another barrel of oil. Other spaces can reward you with a cash payout, which you can possibly double or triple with another roll of the dice...but beware, the wrong dice roll means you get nothing. Some spaces allow you to draw a card, most of which are fortuitous but some will be detrimental to your pocketbook.

Money can be tight in this game unless you land on a money space or the start space (yes, passing start nets you nothing), you draw a card or you have other players land on your ports. The player that delivers 9 barrels first or forces everyone else into bankruptcy is the winner.

205793.name: The Red Dragon's Lair: The Role-Playing Game Second Edition
rpg: The Red Dragon's Lair: The Role-Playing Game Second Edition
205793.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tired of long character making sessions in Your role playing Game? OR are you tired of role playing games that feel like and Algebra class because of all the rules to memorize? Then you need this Game. Escape to the shattered world of Gateway where refugees from the red dragon travel north seeking refuge and where adventurers from every realm prepare to become tough enough to enter the Red Dragon's Lair. This product is fully compatible with Ancient Steel the Role playing game.

205794.name: The Red Dragon's Lair: Monster Manual
rpg: The Red Dragon's Lair: The Role-Playing Game Second Edition
205794.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Red Dragon's Lair is a successful character-driven adventure game, with a wide range of character types. The stories of Robin Hood, Merlin, Daphne, and many other masters of combat are told with furious battles on across the world. Some rise, some fall, though none of these characters survive unscarred. Their stories have become legend. Now it is time, Your Quest Awaits. The Red Dragon’s Lair, the fantasy adventure where you become a Magician, Rogue, Warrior, Paladin, Alchemist, Berserker, Bard and more on a quest to slay an evil Red Dragon. You control the actions of a daring adventurer finding the way through hideous surface creatures, a cave of wonders, and a dark dungeon filled with, undead monsters, elementals and treacherous traps. In the mysterious adventure your quest continues against the evil forces that oppose you. Your daring efforts to reach the Red Dragon’s Lair are where your adventure begins and Your Quest Awaits! The evil Red Dragon dwells far across an unexplored land and lives deep within a dungeon filled with undead monsters and elementals. Your quest is to cross the great unknown, clear the dungeon of evil and slay the Red Dragon. You and your friends will make the journey looting monsters and plundering the dungeon in search of magical items, weapons and treasure! This game is a character driven game, and built upon my d10 system. Players use a pre-made character or create one of their own! Creating a character is fast and easy or choose a character and begin the game. Next equip your character with special items and weapons. Each character is unique and uses different styles of combat. The crafty Rogue hides in the shadows firing arrows from a distance. The Paladin engages the monsters head-on with shield and sword. The Warrior jumps in the fray without regard for himself slaying monsters near and far. The alchemist mixes up concoctions for many things, the Magician uses powerful magic to protect the others and destroy monsters and the Berserker is immortal and Berserk. The awesome forces that oppose you can prove to be more than a match and adventurers will die! Mwahahahaha!

205795.name: Dragon Slayers (The Red Dragon's Lair)
rpg: The Red Dragon's Lair: The Role-Playing Game Second Edition
205795.description:
From publisher blurb:

Behold your gateway to a land of adventure and excitement. Take your role in this easy to play first story for Red Dragon's Lair role Playing Game. or ancient steel RPG. Unfold this first story that turns your bunch of hometown misfits into Dragon slayers. You will need Either two of the main Game books Red Dragon's lair second edition RPG or Ancient steel RPG to play this adventure.

205796.name: Black Knight (The Red Dragon's Lair)
rpg: The Red Dragon's Lair: The Role-Playing Game Second Edition
205796.description:
From publisher blurb:

Behold brave adventurers. When faced with duty can you defeat the Black knight? Take your upstanding place in the king's royal guard or will you be added to the growing hoard of undead?. You should assume your role in this easy to play second story for Red Dragon's Lair role Playing Game. or Ancient Steel RPG. Play in the world of Gateway as it unfolds. Included in a continent map of the world You will only need either two of the main Game books Red Dragon's lair second edition RPG or Ancient steel RPG to play this adventure

205797.name: Castle of Chaos
rpg: The Red Dragon's Lair: The Role-Playing Game Second Edition
205797.description:
From publisher blurb:

Behold brave adventurers. When faced with duty can youp discover the Castle of Chaos before the necromancers? Will you go on to plumb the dark depths of the Castle itself and gain it's mysterious secrets? This is the third story for Red Dragon's Lair role Playing Game. or Ancient Steel RPG. Play in the world of Gateway as it unfolds. Included in a continent map of the world You will only need one of the two, of the main Game books Red Dragon's lair second edition RPG or Ancient steel RPG to play this adventure.

205798.name: The Summoner
205798.description:
Description from the designer:

The Summoner is a one-player mission-based board game inspired by “count-and-capture” mechanics of Mancala. Instead of using a number to represent mana (magical points), this game introduces a new concept of using mana token to form patterns on the board. When the mana pattern on the board matches the mana pattern of a monster, you can capture that monster. Each monster captured along the way will give you more power and higher chance to complete the mission.

Your objective is to complete all 3 missions assigned by the Elders. Through the course of your adventure, you will encounter various monsters in different lands. Each land has a special environment that will weakens your life and power. You need to endure through these environments and complete all the missions to achieve the title of Master Summoner.

205809.name: Larppaajan Käsikirja
rpgcategory: Non-Rankable Item (item will not show in the rankings)
205809.description:
Translated from back of the book:
Live roleplaying aka LARPing is a hobby which has gained huge popularity, which combines acting, creative writing and handicraft skills into a unique experience.

Larppaajan Käsikirja (eng. LARPer's Handbook) tells what it is all about, how to prepare to live roleplay and how the games work. To interested parents it tells about the psychology and games eg. as children's activity for church parish. The handbook contains detailed and proven instructionsfor manufacturing of safe weapons, armour, costumes, masks and even tooth prosthetics and also tells where to get the needed equipment. It tells about historical, modern and futuristic conflict safe simulation and correct use of equipment. It includes overview of the most common game types and special vocabulary and explains the LARP terminology and slang. The book also contains introduction to the people on this field and contacts for gaming groups and gamemasters (in Finland).

Larppaajan Käsikirja isthe basic cornerstone of the field, to which the only competitor in usefulness is duct tape.

In Finnish:
Live-roolipelaaminen eli larppaaminen on huiman suosion saavuttanut harrastus, joka yhdistää näyttelemisen, luovan kirjoittamisen ja käden taidot ainutkertaiseksi kokonaisuudeksi.

Larppaajan käsikirja kertoo mistä on kyse, miten live-roolipeliin valmistaudutaan ja miten pelit toimivat. Kiinnostuneille vanhemmille se kertoo live-pelaamisen psykologiasta ja peleistä mm. seurakuntien toimintamuotona. Käsikirja sisältää yksityiskohtaiset ohjeet turvallisten aseiden, panssareiden, pukujen, naamioiden ja jopa hammasproteesien valmistamiseksi sekä paljastaa hyväksi havaitut hankintapaikat. Se kertoo historiallisten, nykyaikaisten ja futurististen konfliktien turvallisesta simuloinnista ja välineiden oikeaoppisesta käsittelystä. Se sisältää yleisimpien pelityyppien esittelyt ja eri aihepiirien erikoissanastot sekä selvittää larppaamiskäsitteet ja -slangin. Kirjasta löytyvät myös alan vaikuttajien esittelyt sekä koko maan pelaajaryhmien ja pelinjärjestäjien yhteystiedot.

Larppaajan käsikirja on alan perusteos, jonka yleiskäyttöisyydelle vetää vertoja vain bofferiteippi.

205814.name: Challenger Cup Race
205814.description:
This is a very basic yacht-racing game by All-Fair. The four tracks of 45 spaces include two bonus spaces and two hazard spaces. Moves are determined by a 1-6 spinner. First player to reach the finish line by exact spin wins. The board includes the rules and art of sailing ships, buoys, lighthouses and gulls.

There is a second spin-and-move game called Circus pasted to the inside of the box lid. This also has four tracks leading from the start to the Big Top Entrance. Each track has 36 spaces including two bonus spaces and two hazards. The board decoration includes the rules and art of a marching clown, trained seal and lion.

205815.name: Ancient Lore (Issue 1)
rpg: Ancient Steel Fantasy Steampunk Role-Playing Game
The Red Dragon's Lair: The Role-Playing Game Second Edition
205815.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the first issue of Ancient Lore. This is one shot pay what you want for 5 pages of material that is for use for Ancient steel Fantasy or Red Dragon's Lair the Role Playing Game ( now in kickstarter).

205816.name: Takaroo
205816.description:
This is an action/dexterity game played with five small wooden cubes, a 15" wooden rod, a dart made of a wooden disk with three feathers attached to one side, and a board with various shapes and targets. Wooden pegs are used to keep score along ladders of holes punched into the board.

The game is played in five rounds, each of which requires a succession of physical moves. In the first round, for instance, cubes are placed on each of four stars on the board, and the player must toss the dart in the air, pick up a cube and catch the dart all with the same hand. This is then repeated for the second cube, then the remaining two cubes, and then all four cubes at once. Finally, the dart must be tossed up and hit the blue circle in the center of the board.

Each player turn lasts until he fails to complete a required trick. When his turn comes again, he starts with the failed trick. First player to complete the requirements of all five rounds wins.

205817.name: Trick or Treat Horror Role Playing Game
rpg: Trick or Treat Horror Role Playing Game
205817.description:
From publisher blurb:

While watching a horror movie it occurs to some that they could do better. Trick or treat is the game that puts you in that seat and gives you the chance to live up to those words. Can you really make better decisions or is it all talk? Can you play the ROLE and still trick the classic monsters or will you become their treat? Trick or Treat provides players with a solid framework and quick generated characters so they can get right into the action rather than spend a whoile session creating characters. Don't miss out on the fun grab a copy today!

205818.name: Zombie Convention: Ancient Steel RPG Scenario 2
rpg: Trick or Treat Horror Role Playing Game
205818.description:
From publisher blurb:

Zombie Convention is set inside your local convention. That's right make the adventure and your convention really come to life as you use the very convention hall as a prop for your role players to experience. This is a must have adventure for any con goer. The first in an adventure set of three modules. This module has the Rules To Ancient Steel the RPG to stand alone or use it for your favorite system. Set in your convention as it exists in the horror universe of the novel Vampire Hotel with it's dark humor.

205819.name: Black Hills
205819.description:
Description from the publisher:

1876 — the Gold Rush is rising up and the Wild West is full of adventurers, golddiggers and all kind of characters looking for the gold piece that will change their lives. The city of Black Hills is right in the middle of this struggle, and a tough mayor is needed to put things in their place.

Black Hills is a resource management game for 2-4 players in which they need to accumulate resources to exchange them for status points. The first player to obtain five status points is appointed as the brand new mayor of Black Hills and wins.

The game has three different resources: wood, gold pieces and leather. In every round, each player chooses two character cards from the four cards they receive. There are 16 character cards between cowboys, settlers and indians; each character has its own ability and should be placed in one of four locations: woods, plains, city or the jail. Depending on the character and the locations, players acquire different resources or can invest their previously amassed goods in the city in exchange for status points.

The second deck of cards is the deck of the events. Every player can buy an event for the price of one gold piece and use it whenever they want. The events affect the regular development of the game, granting extra status points, closing locations, or forcing the rest of the players to lose some of their resources.

Don't want to invest your gold in event cards? Are you a more aggressive kind of player? Do you hate to manage resources? Keep calm because this is the Wild West and what would it be without some hired gunmen? In Black Hills, you can also use your money to hire a gunman to try to steal all the resources from your fellow players.

So what are you waiting for? Come to the city of Black Hill and find your luck, but watch out because you could end up with nothing in your pockets or a bullet in your head!

205820.name: F.A.M.A.T.O.M.
205820.description:
From the introduction:

F.A.M.A.T.O.M. is a fantasy, horror, historic, sci-fi role-playing game. It can be played with any setting, in any style, or combination thereof...The monsters and villains are easy to create..And to really make it easy on the person running the game...they shall be known as "Games Operation Directors" a.k.a. G.O.D.

205821.name: Ancient Steel Horror Edition
205821.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ancient Steel Horror is an RPG of suspense and Horror by Roger Huntman Set in the world of the Vampire Hotel Novel. Players take on the role of everyday people caught in the grip of supernatural terror. Using a quick and intuitive system, Ancient Steel provides players with a solid framework and quick generated characters so they can get right into the action.

205822.name: Space Cadet Alpha
205822.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tired of long character making sessions in Your role playing Game? OR are you tired of role playing games that feel like and Algebra class because of all the rules to memorize? Then you need this Game. Escape from the shattered world of Earth where robots have taken over the planet. Play as a zany three armed alien Zoi, beautiful amazon, Vermurr, human or a robot. Explore dangers of space and help establish new space colonies as one of the newly graduated Space cadets.

205823.name: Rookie Fireman
205823.description:
This 1978 educational firefighting game has a playing board, a deck of 34 Fire cards, a deck of 32 Result cards, four Patrol Piece tokens, four badge cards (Chief, Captain, Engineer and Rookie), a D6 with a fire symbol over the 1, and an unpainted lead firetruck.

The board has a white track running around the edge, and an inner pattern of six vertical and two horizontal streets, connected to the fire station in the middle. In between the streets are numbered houses, retail outlets and industrial locations.

Each player starts on a different corner of the board and rolls the die to move along the white track on the outside of the board. Each time he passes his starting station, he completes one patrol. The last player to complete his third patrol gets stuck with the Rookie badge.

Whenever a player lands on a "fire" space, he draws the top card from the Fire deck, which illustrates the cause of the fire and gives a location. The player then has four rolls of the die to move the fire engine from the station to that location to put out the fire. If he succeeds, he draws a Results card and follows directions; if not, he moves his piece back one space.

The game is said to have been designed by a firehouse in Scottsdale, Arizona, and the box shows it was distributed as an educational tool through other fire departments. (One copy has a label saying "Compliments of Roy L. Parrish, Fire Chief, Clark County Fire Dept., Nevada".)

205824.name: Vampire Hunt
205824.description:
From publisher blurb:

Drawn to a small town can your mismatched group of adventurers hunt down the evil that is slowly devouring the town person by person. Pit your group against the vampire Elizabeth Bathory and her minions as you scour the countryside looking for her lair. This adventure is the second in a series of horror modules for the Ancient Steel RPG system. This expansion expands upon Zombie convention with more rules, creatures, templates, weapons and a system of faith powers. This adventure is based upon and features characters from the novel Vampire Hotel.

205825.name: Go for Gold
205825.description:
This is a British sports quiz game published as a promotional item for Webster's Yorkshire Bitter. The board has three concentric rings of spaces (Qualifying, Bronze and Silver) with a large Gold Medal space in the middle. There is a deck of 56 cards, each with six questions and answers (one for each of six color-coded categories).

Players roll a die and must first complete a full circuit of the outer track, answering a question of the appropriate color as they land on each space. Then they must aim for a Qualify space, where they must answer a question of another player's choice from the next card in order to move to the Bronze track.

Similarly, players must move around the Bronze track before trying to move up to Silver, and around that track before trying for a Gold Medal question to win the game. The questions range from familiar ("Name all five events in the modern Olympic Pentathlon") to the obscure ("Which snooker player was able to claim pints of lager as tax-deductible?").

The game box included an opportunity to enter a real contest to win tickets to five premier sporting events in late 1987 and 1988.

205826.description:
Description from the publisher:

Kilt Castle adds a simple and highly interactive card mechanism to the classic Euro game genre of outbuilding one's opponents in an attempt to control the largest territory.

The game board shows a grid of 5x5 squares. Ten cards are placed beside the first four rows in stacks of 4, 3, 2 and 1 card. On their turn, the player picks up an open card from one of the stacks next to the game board and places it in another row — always in a clockwise direction. All players whose colors are on that card (one or two) are then allowed to build a new tower or build on top of an existing tower in this particular row. Building on an open space is free, while building on top of somebody else's tower costs as many ducats as the number of "floors" already built. A player can decide to trigger a general round of scoring simply by moving the last card of any stack. High towers are a good way to claim a large, connected territory and collect a lot of ducats.
205826.name: Kilt Castle
boardgamepodcastepisode: 19. Devon Dice Dreaming to Essen trip 2016, Top 10 wants to Buys

rpg: Ancient Steel Fantasy Steampunk Role-Playing Game
The Red Dragon's Lair: The Role-Playing Game Second Edition

From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the fifth issue of Ancient Lore. Inside is the expansion map to the elven lands, guns and a new creature and template to expand on the world and bring more steampunk to your Ancient Steel game. This is several pages of material that is for use for Ancient steel Fantasy or Red Dragon's Lair the Role Playing Game.

205831.name: Dreams
205831.description:
Description from the publisher:

Dreams is a game of perception and intuition with 72 large cards illustrated by eight different artists.

In each round, four pictures are revealed. The players are gods who transfer one of these images onto the night sky as a new constellation of stars. Which one is transferred is determined in such a way that all players but one know the picture in question. The one who doesn't know which picture was chosen tries to remain undetected during the round.

Star by star, the players now transfer the picture onto the night sky (i.e., the central mat) until all stars are placed. There is a good chance that different players will emphasize different aspects of the picture in question. After the placement phase, the "Gods" try to detect the "ignorant" player, while the ignorant player tries to name the picture that was chosen. The right balance between keeping the imposter in the dark and not giving the regular players cause for suspicion has to be struck...

205832.name: Ancient Lore (Issue 6)
rpg: Ancient Steel Fantasy Steampunk Role-Playing Game
The Red Dragon's Lair: The Role-Playing Game Second Edition
205832.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the sixth issue of Ancient Lore. Inside is the expansion map to the elven lands, rules on swimming and climbing, a new naga creature and character template to expand on the worlds and bring more fantasy to your Ancient Steel game. This is several pages of material that is for use for Ancient steel Fantasy or Red Dragon's Lair the Role Playing Game.

205833.name: Ancient Lore (Issue 7)
rpg: Ancient Steel Fantasy Steampunk Role-Playing Game
The Red Dragon's Lair: The Role-Playing Game Second Edition
205833.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the seventh issue of Ancient Lore. Inside is new race of the Dogmen, a new pet, Information on the Dog Warren town of Gur, Werebear and a new Barbarian template. This is several pages of material that is for use for Ancient steel Fantasy or Red Dragon's Lair the Role Playing Game,

205834.name: Ancient Lore (Issue 8)
rpg: Ancient Steel Fantasy Steampunk Role-Playing Game
The Red Dragon's Lair: The Role-Playing Game Second Edition
205834.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the eigth issue of Ancient Lore. Inside is a, a new pet, Information on two new rituals, the Phantom,a new Marine template. This is several pages of material that is for use for Ancient steel Fantasy or Red Dragon's Lair the Role Playing Game.

rpg: Ancient Steel Fantasy Steampunk Role-Playing Game
The Red Dragon's Lair: The Role-Playing Game Second Edition
205837.description:
From publisher blurb:

205838.name: Ancient Lore (Issue 12)
rpg: Ancient Steel Fantasy Steampunk Role-Playing Game
The Red Dragon's Lair: The Role-Playing Game Second Edition
205838.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the twelth issue of Ancient Lore. Inside is a chapter of the continuing story,two magical ancient steel blades, the Shangri La monkeys, the Shangri La wasp, the lhealer template. This is several pages of material that is for use for Ancient steel Fantasy or Red Dragon's Lair the Role Playing Game.

205839.name: Ninja
205839.description:
From publisher blurb:

Undefeatable is the new supplement line for fans of The Pathfinder Roleplaying Game who are looking to add more interesting a different feats to their gaming sessions. Undefeatable 23 which focuses on Ninja has 30 feats including Ethereal Weakness, From The Darkness, Injected Poison, Magical Trickery, Mirror Duel and Telekinetic Trickery that are perfect to be used in any game setting. This 5 page PDF is just the sort of thing needed for GMs to add depth to any great Pathfinder Roleplaying Game gaming session.

205840.name: Golden Jaguar (ICONS)
205840.description:
From publisher blurb:

This PDF contains a full write up on the Golden Jaguar. Sebastian Martinez was a talented but egotistical. archaeologist until the day he came into contact with the ancient Golden Jaguar Amulet. The amulet and Martinez bonded and the Golden Jaguar was born. Two consciousness now share Martinez's body. One, a thieving ladies-man and the other the fearsome Aztec warrior, Tonatiuth. The pair use their formidable skills to take what they want and to battle any that oppose them.

205843.name: From Unformed Realms
205843.description:
From publisher blurb:

As a Gamemaster, you just can’t have something planned for every eventuality. Perhaps you have to step in to run something on short notice or the normal group can’t meet so you want something to change the pace. The Cthulhu Hack offers a simple system for investigative horror, but where to get the horror? From Unformed Realms offers you a gathering of random tables to provide a springboard for your creativity just when you need it most.

Below the waist… all human resemblance left off. The skin was thickly covered with coarse black fur, and from the abdomen a score of long greenish-grey tentacles with red sucking mouths protruded limply. Their arrangement was odd, and seemed to follow the symmetries of some cosmic geometry unknown to earth or the solar system. On each of the hips, deep set in a kind of pinkish, ciliated orbit, was what seemed to be a rudimentary eye; whilst in lieu of a tail there depended a kind of trunk or feeler with purple annular markings, and with many evidences of being an undeveloped mouth or throat. The limbs… terminated in ridged-veined pads that were neither hooves nor claws.

Of genuine blood there was none; only the foetid greenish-yellow ichor which… left a curious discoloration behind it.

The Dunwich Horror, H P Lovecraft (1929)

For those moments when your players have taken the inevitable path away from whatever you have planned, From Unformed Realms provides the ideal tool for conjuring up a flash of inspiration. In 20 horror packed pages, the supplement provides myriad options for the random creation of horrific nightmares and unnameable monstrosities. You can either roll randomly with a 6-sided die or flick to a random page and choose a numbered section, then inflict the content on your appreciative players.

The supplement contains references and monsters based on the Horror genre. The book does contain references to acts of fictional violence and biological functions, but nothing unsuitable for someone sitting down to play a game of Lovecraftian investigative horror in the first place!

From Unformed Realms is a system-free supplement, easily adapted it to your favourite game system or campaign setting. Some material previously released under the title Consult Appendix Z.

205847.description:
Join Hiram, Nellie, Jean and Toro on an adventure to uncover the horror-western town of Pariah Missouri. Follow the graphic novels in this fan-made scenario for the hit game.

TIME Stories is a "deck-ploration" board game published by Space Cowboy games. They published a developer kit and with it I created a Pariah Missouri scenario, a full-fledged game.
205847.name: Pariah Missouri (fan expansion to T.I.M.E Stories)

205848.name: SurvHive
205848.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still in active development and available to the public for purchase in it's unfinished state, either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between).




The only one you can trust is yourself, as alien shape-shifters lie in wait. Will humans be able to eradicate the alien menace? Will the infection spread instead? Welcome to their Hive...

Source: The Game Website.

205849.description:
Description from the publisher:

Enter a futuristic utopia. You are a citizen living an idyllic life among your fellow Cybrids when the entire world falls apart around you.

A sinister force known only as The Machine has sent a wave of corrupting Drone programs to infiltrate your safe haven, absorbing you one by one. To save yourselves, you must deactivate the drones before all of you are assimilated.
