Use intuition, items, special abilities and blind luck to solve the mystery and save your peaceful city! Play as a citizen, drone, or special character who can use special abilities to help or hinder the search. Item cards add to the chaos and fun!

Each round you have a chance to find and eliminate the drones but be careful: you can eliminate normal citizens too! If all the citizens are eliminated you lose.

Accuse. Eliminate. Win.

Or face Assimilation.
205849.name: Assimilation

205850.name: Bones
205850.description:
'Bones' is a party game with simple game play and lots of changing dynamics.

You play a Grim Reaper, and collect lost souls by helping them find the things that make them happy, but beware the villainous Bone Dog!

Choose a character to be your reaper, then collect and lay down your stash of Happiness Items and use them to entice other souls into your possession. Souls also have special abilities that you can take advantage of to give yourself bonuses or to mess up your opponents!

Be the first to gather enough souls and you win!

205851.name: Legacy of the Ming
205851.description:
From the introduction:

The Manchus invaded China in 1644, and by 1681 had succeeded in completely deposing the Ming Dynasty. Even after the Manchus were ensconced in power, rebellious groups continued to spring up, many set on reviving the Ming Dynasty and ousting the foreign Manchus. For the next two centuries, rumors of hidden Ming treasure ran rampant, but the truth of this rumor always seemed in doubt. Until now.

User summary:

This scenario originally was published in Valkyrie (Volume 2, Issue 6 - 1998) and subsequently published as a standalone PDF available for free download.

205852.name: Delinquent Schoolgirl Cop
205852.description:
A New Character Type

From the introduction:

"I'm sorry I don't have my history essay done, ma'am, but I spent the whole weekend foiling a plot to turn all us kids into zombies..."

User summary:

This character type was made available for free download.

205853.name: Alternate Beginnings for Feng Shui Campaigns
205853.description:
From the introduction:

Players, being the pesky critters that we all know and love - and let's face it, that we can't really do without - are always looking for an edge... A way to be one up on you, the poor, over-worked GM. And players are not above reading the rules, even when they know you don't want them to. Perhaps even especially then. Feng Shui players are no different in this regard from players of any other system.

User summary:

This item was available for free download.

205854.name: Fire and Sword (2nd Edition)
205854.description:
From the introduction:

These rules can be freely copied and amended. This allows users to record the changes they make to cover the needs of their particular campaign, and the extensions to the rules the make to handle situations the authors did not envisage or dismissed as unimportant. This recording can be done in a searchable form, by modifying the copy of the rules your campaign uses as authoritative, directly.

User summary:

The document presents a robust skills system, flexible combat rules, and three magic systems. Additionally, everything needed for a fantasy roleplaying campaign is included.

205855.name: Fire and Sword: The Short Version
205855.description:
User summary:

This document presents a greatly abbreviated version of the game rules, particularly focused on new character creation and routine task resolution.

205856.name: Fireborn Gamemaster's Screen
205856.description:
User summary:

This three panel screen presents game art to the players and commonly-used reference materials (primarily tables) to the game master.

205857.name: Flatland: An Adventure of Many Dimensions
rpg: Flatland: An Adventure of Many Dimensions
205857.description:
From the introduction:

The greatest length or breadth of a full grown inhabitant of Flatland may be estimated at about eleven of your inches. Twelve inches may be regarded as a maximum.

User summary:

This game is similar to, but distinct from, previously developed roleplaying games that implement the eponymous novella to the tabletop.

205858.name: Instant Campaign Builder
rpgcategory: Non-Rankable Item (item will not show in the rankings)
205858.description:
From the introduction:

This project will help you achieve 2 of the main goals a dungeon master should have when preparing a campaign:


● Create the best campaign ever.
● Not spend any time doing it.


They seem to be contradictory goals. Well, they are. Compromises have to be made. The more time you spend planning and plotting, the better your campaign should be. But I believe that it is possible to prepare a quality campaign without spending too much time at the drawing board.

205859.name: Instant World Builder
rpgcategory: Non-Rankable Item (item will not show in the rankings)
205859.description:
From the introduction:

The D&D Instant World Builder Project focuses on 2 goals:


• Create a mind-blowing D&D campaign setting.
• Not spend anytime doing it!


That's right: kicking back, blowing minds. They seem to be contradictory goals. Well they are, but compromises can be made. Just like the Instant Campaign Builder, this project will suggest ways to save time while shaping a unique and stimulating environment.

205860.name: Low Fantasy Population Generator
205860.description:
From the introduction:

Creating quasi-realistic populations for your low-fantasy Chimera campaign.

User summary:

Presents a system to generate regions, populations, settlements, and specialists.

205861.name: Medieval Demographics Made Easy
rpgcategory: Non-Rankable Item (item will not show in the rankings)
205861.description:
Numbers for Fantasy Worlds

From the introduction:

Fantasy worlds come in many varieties, from the "hard core" medieval-simulation school to the more fanciful realms of high fantasy, with alabaster castles and jeweled gardens in the place of the more traditional muddy squalor. Despite their differences, these share a vital common element: ordinary people. Most realms of fantasy, no matter how baroque or magical, can not get by without a supply of ordinary farmers, merchants, quarreling princes and palace guards. Clustered into villages and crowding the cities, they provide the human backdrop for adventure.

205862.name: Farm, Forge and Steam
rpgcategory: Non-Rankable Item (item will not show in the rankings)
205862.description:
A Nuts and Bolts Guide to Civilisations

From the introduction:

If you’ve been playing Role Playing Games for any length of time you’ve almost certainly picked up some historical knowledge – most RPGs are, after all, set either in earth’s past history or borrow elements of that history as the basis for much of their setting.

Having at least a passing knowledge of pre-modern societies and cultures, or some aspects of them, is a handy thing – it gives the player an edge and enables the GM to make the game more interesting and believable.

205863.name: What is FlexTale?
rpgcategory: Non-Rankable Item (item will not show in the rankings)
205863.description:
From the introduction:

FlexTale is an attempt to make roleplaying game adventure content dynamic and interesting. A module created using FlexTale is different each time it is run. Treasure, monsters, plot activities, NPC backstories and character arcs, and various actions and plot elements can all occur differently.

Differences can occur using the roll of dice, or the GM can simply choose the content that s/he prefers or feels would be most engaging to the play group.

There are two ways that FlexTale can help make an adventure dynamic: Dynamic Content and Dynamic Plots.

205864.name: Privacy Numbers
205864.description:
Everyone hides secrets, even from their friends, but in Privacy Numbers you get to discover some of those hidden secrets — you just might not know to whom that secret belongs!

In the game, players are presented with a question that has a numerical answer, e.g., how many hours each day do you surf the internet? Everyone secretly writes their answer on an "I" token, then each player guesses what the sum of all these answers are with their "We" token. Whoever is closest to this sum advances three spaces on the scoring track, while the second- and third-closest answerers advance two and one spaces.

Whoever first reaches the scoring line on the game board wins!

205865.name: Naova
205865.description:
Players in Naova use their cards to fight one another, but the challenge comes in knowing what to play when.

Each round, each player starts with a hand of six cards with values 0-4; some of the cards have special powers that take effect if the card is played during the proper phase in the round.

To start the round, each player simultaneously reveals one card of their choice. If only a single player has the highest card, then that player collects all of the cards played; if not, then all tied players reveal two cards of their choice from their hand. Once again, a clear winner collects of the cards that have been played, while tied players play their final three cards to see who wins the whole shebang.

The game ends when the deck runs out. Each card collected is worth one point, while the Naova card is worth 10 points. Whoever has the most points wins!

205866.name: Platonic Mastery
205866.description:
From the introduction:

You are an old man, a philosopher and a Platonic Master, a denizen of highest tiers of your civilization. As play begins, after decades of private doubt and self-deception, you have concluded that your society and your place in it are based on human atrocity.

You have made a final and irrevocable choice to change your society for the better or sacrifice yourself in the attempt. The GM, representing society, will resist your efforts in every way they can, attempting to destroy you rather than change.

205867.description:
Bohnanza® – Das Duell: Give as good as you get!

What was that thing about the gift horse? In this two-player variant of Bohnanza, both bean farmers give each other gifts of beans they can‘t use themselves – to make life harder for their opponent, if possible. Trying to fulfill their secret “bo(h)nus” requirements, they both need to keep a vigilant eye on the other player’s bean fields. Give as good as you get in Bohnanza – Das Duell, there can be only one winner!

How to play Bohnanza – Das Duell:
Both duelists have bean field mats in front of themselves to plant their beans on. Between them, there is a row of eight gift cards. Each player holds five hand cards and three “bo(h)nus cards” with secret objectives. Playing the bean duel, you have the option of planting more than one type of bean in the same field, but when you plant a different bean than the one you’ve planted before, it has to have the next highest number than the one before. When harvesting your beans, it’s the beanometer of the last card you’ve planted that counts.
At the start of each turn, the active player plants two beans from their hand and turns over bean cards as usual. Instead of trading, however, they offer their opponent one bean as a gift by pushing this bean type’s gift card in their direction. The other player can accept the gift or decline it, but if they don’t take it, they have to offer a gift in return. You are allowed to bluff, but it may cost you if your bluff is called! Important: Only the first player to accept a gift actually receives the bean card in question. After this exchange, plant all beans you have received and turned over, then draw new cards.
“Bo(h)nus” cards can be fulfilled at any time when the required combination of beans printed on the card can be found in any bean field. Fulfilling an objective earns you bean dollars and the brand new bean cents. When the draw pile is used up, the player with the most bean dollars wins the game.

Bohnanza – Das Duell is a variant of the popular bean trading game Bohnanza designed exclusively for two players. The gifting rules and “bo(h)nus” cards facilitate interaction between the two players and give fans something new to try out.

(source: press information from AMIGO)
205867.name: Bohnanza: The Duel
boardgamepodcastepisode: #45: Six-Player Six Pack; Las Vegas on tap; Barcelona; Mystic Vale; Betrayal at the Brewery on the Hill

205868.name: Hound/ed
205868.description:
From the introduction:

There are two separate small decks of cards, one for the Hound and one for the Hounded. Each player shuffles their deck into a draw pile, and draws the top 3 cards into their hand.

Also, a sheet of paper is placed between the players (from now on called the central sheet) for writing down each character’s attributes and other information regarding the story including locations explored.

User summary:

The game requires custom cards to play; the cards are provided as text but not as print-and-play components.

205869.name: The Reunion
205869.description:
User summary:

The game setup involves players selecting and bringing personal objects for use during play. Dice are used for setup only, to select random inputs. Play is, essentially, free-form narrative development.

205870.name: Clonk Rage
205870.description:
Clonk Rage is the current stable 2D title of the Clonk series.

The main focus of Clonk Rage is on the new fullscreen menu for player management and scenario selection which comes in proper gaming style and transitions smoothly into the actual game worlds. Players new to Clonk will find a completely reworked mode of control much closer to the principles of well known Jump'n'Run games.

The network code has been completely rewritten and now allows considerably faster internet play while still supporting the physically demanding landscape simulation of Clonk. This is complemented by numerous additional networking features such as a lobby, chat, and a new league server.

Clonk Rage is the first Clonk game to be released simultaneously for the Windows, Linux, and Macintosh platforms.

Source: The Developer Website.

205872.name: Warbit: DICEJAR vs PSYCHOLON
205872.description:
Description from the designer:

"Warbit" means "War on the planet orbit".
You dispatch a spaceship, and cut the opponent's side ground!

"Warbit:DICEJAR vs. PSYCHOLON" is a sci-fi space game.

［Game board］
Photos in Gallery is a prototype.
In the final product, this sheet is on a white board.
It applies lenticular printing.
It’s a technique using optical illusion.

Planets and routes appear three-dimensionally and some stars appear to move.
Put a spaceship on the board and move it. You can enjoy a mysterious three-dimensional impression.

[Spacecraft]
Three types of spaceships in red and blue, total of 16 vessels in the box.
Made of plastic, it’s strong.
Erect the plastic sheet’s wings and attach the disk.
You can easily assemble the spaceship.

The big number indicates the ship’s "max cruising speed" and "durability".
The little number in the window is its "defense shield".
Turn the disk to change the "defense shield" value.

[Overview]

This is a two-player game.
The players alternately take turns.
Each player has 8 spaceships.
Deploy spaceships on the planet under your power.
Move your spaceships to the planets ruled by your opponent and conquer them.
You win by conquering your opponent’s 5 planets or 1 mother planet.

In your turn, you can take one of two actions.
Move your spaceship to another planet.
Or, raise your spaceship’s "defense shield" level.

A spaceship can advance over distance matching its “big number”.
When you stop at a planet without using up this power, the remaining power counts as the defense shield.

Multiple spaceships can move to the same planet.
All planets have a satellite orbit for spaceships to anchor.
The spaceship entering the orbit earlier takes an advantageous position.
If both players move their spaceship to the same orbit, a battle breaks out.

The battle outcome is judged by dice.
Thus, the battle is based on probability.
Move spaceships strategically to battle at an advantageous position.
You can make a preemptive attack if your spaceship is at an advantageous position on the satellite orbit.
The "defense shield" protects your spaceship from your opponent’s attack.
With your multiple spaceships, you attack your opponent’s spaceship from both sides.
You can retreat and attack later when the "defense shield" of the opponent falls down.

If you have power remaining after annihilating the enemy on the same orbit, you can build a base or shipyard on the planet.
The "base" improves your spaceship’s offensive power.
The "shipyard" helps your destroyed spaceship go into service again.
Conquer your opponent’s planets and build a base or shipyard.
Using such facilities, advance further to your opponent’s mother planet.
Such is the gameplay of "Warbit : DICEJAR vs. PSYCHOLON".

205873.description:
In Freaky, you want to grab all the cards that you can, but to grab them, you need to play the right cards!

Each card in Freaky features three characteristics: number, number color, and background color. Each player starts with three cards in hand, and three cards are placed face up on the table.

On a turn, a player plays 1-3 cards onto the table, and each card played must match at least one characteristic of the card on which it is being played. If a pile now has at least four cards in a row with a matching characteristic, e.g., four yellow number circles, that player claims all of the cards in that pile. A player refills their hand to three cards at the end of their turn.

When the deck runs out, the game ends and whoever has collected the most cards wins!
205873.name: Freaky

205874.name: Future Tales
205874.description:
Description from the publisher:

WELCOME TO THE FUTURE!

The Future is space ships, robots, laser guns, and much more. It’s about journeying to countless worlds and encountering all sorts of alien life. It’s about adventures of all shapes and stories of all kinds. And these stories are all yours for the telling!

Future Tales puts you in your very own Science Fiction story. Explore a variety of planets; from sprawling civilizations to barren volcanic worlds. Meet all kinds of characters; from furry little creatures, to monstrous robots. And face off against horrors never seen before.

Will you be a Soldier, defending your galaxy from a race of murderous Space Pirates? Will you jump in your ship and explore planets no one has visited before? Or will you be a Detective, attempting to learn who stole the Queen’s third hat (one for each head)?

Inside Future Tales, you’ll find:

Over 30 Attributes to customize your characters; Brawler, Marksman, Pilot, Magic and more.
A variety of characters to play as, with, or against; Stars, Co-Stars, Big Bads to name a few.
The Alien Generator, which create aliens from your favorite TV shows and movies, and some never seen before.
Rules for creating Robots of every shape, size, and purpose, as well as rules for playing as them.
Futuristic weapons like Laser Pistols, Repeaters, and even Disintegrators.
A system that allows your character to increase in Skills and Abilities when they succeed, but make life difficult for them when they don’t.
Different locations to visit, such as Space Stations, and Civilizations hidden in the corners of the galaxy.
Interactive terrain that’s simple and easy to use; from obstacles like locked doors and stacks of crates to hazards like bottomless pits, laser grids, and out-of-control machinery.
Multiple kinds of Villains to face, such as Crime Boss, Military Villain, and Rogue Robots.
Over 50 Professions for your characters and those you meet, such as Pilots, Computer Hackers, and Soldiers.
A story mechanic that moves you from Scene to Scene of your story, as you uncover Clues and track down the Big Bad.
Story Scenes that change each time you play them. No Space Battle or * Confrontation will be the same.
All this and more!




Like all THW games, Future Tales is made with the solo gamer in mind, can be played cooperatively against the game mechanics or competitively, head to head. Play it any way you like, it’s your game!

205875.name: By Savvy & Steel
205875.description:
Descriprion from the publisher:

One For All... Well, you know the rest.

By Savvy and Steel takes the player back to 17th Century Europe. Everyone’s heard of the Three Musketeers and the Cardinal’s Guard, and yes, By Savvy and Steel will work for that, but we’ve taken it a bit farther. How far? Glad you asked! Instead of tying you into Paris of the Musketeers we let you travel the countryside in a generic country called Edenstein. It’s based on the Europe of the 17th Century and it could be France or England if you want, but it doesn’t have to be.

You have the choice, it’s your story!

In By Savvy and Steel you can choose to be a Guardsman, Rogue, or Civilian. Civilian? Yes, you probably won’t want to be a Civilian but you could be if you wanted to. So why are they there? Because it’s not all about dueling every day, in *By Savvy and Steel*, it’s about the adventure and Civilians make for good story lines.

Maybe you have to rescue a kidnapped daughter of a wealthy Noble. Or maybe you’ve decided to be a Highwayman and rob coaches. It’s all about the story and that’s what* By Savvy and Steel* is about, the story, your story.

In By Savvy and Steel you’ll find:


A complete area to adventure in.



Multiple scenarios.



A variety of Classes for you to play.



A fun and interactive Dueling system (well it is in the Musketeers time period!).



A light book keeping campaign to track your character’s progress and link your adventures together.


You’ve received a message from the King. He requires your services but there’s still time for a mug of ale if you hurry. As you enter the Drunken Stallion, a foot is extended and causes you to trip into another man. With a curse he turns on you and tries to slap your face. You grab his hand, and he pulls away. You see him grab the hilt of his sword. “You sir, are an oafish pig and I demand an apology or satisfaction! “, he shouts. The tavern is suddenly quiet. Which will it be? Do you risk looking foolish in front of all, or do you accept his challenge. And who was it that tripped you? Welcome to … By Savvy and Steel

205876.description:
SENGOKU JIDAI—the central government's authority had weakened and local lords were fighting each other. Japan fell into a chaotic era of warring states.

With the Warlord Oda Nobunaga's arrival in Kyoto, people started dreaming that the age of peace would begin. Oda Nobunaga tried to unify the country and reorganize the government by bringing the authority back to TENNO. In 1576, he selected Azuchi, a town on the eastern shore of Lake Biwa where he started to establish his new castle and power. This unconstrained and lively city reflected his ambition to bring an end to a chaotic era. The city was characterized by a luxurious castle and open markets; his city underwent unprecedented growth. Now it is your turn!

In Azuchi Castle, players acting in the role of retainers need to complete Oda Nobunaga's mission: Construct Azuchi castle. You need to produce resources (roof tile, stone, wood) and earn money. You should also raise armies against upcoming attacks. Based on your efficient choice of actions, you could win the game by earning more victory points than your competitors.
205876.name: Azuchi Castle

205877.name: Bolt Action: Band of Brothers
205877.description:
Description from the publisher:

New Plastics, New Starter Set

Introducing the shiny new Starter Set for the Bolt Action game, this time featuring German Grenadiers against a brand new plastic infantry set, the elite US Airborne:

'Band Of Brothers'

Contents:

24 New Plastic US Airborne
12 Plastic German Grenadiers
Plastic SdKfz 251/10 AusfD. 3.7cm PaK half track
Plastic Ruined Farm
A5 Softback Bolt Action 2 Rules Book
Quick Start Guide
Quick Reference Sheet
12 Plastic Pin Markers
Plastic Templates and Tokens
Construction Diagrams
10 Six Sided Dice
10 Order Dice

205878.name: マルチジャンル・ホラーRPG　インセイン
205878.description:
From the back of the book:

The darkness of the heart ...... peek into it!!

Everyone has a secret. The nice woman living next door is a bloodthirsty killer. The teacher at school is a demon hunter. And there is the rumor the girl in your class you are interested in is a vampire ... . In a world that is absolutely commonplace at first sight, people holding secrets in their hearts get caught up in strange mystery incidents. Is what awaits them destruction, or ... ? The multigenre horror RPG depicting people played with by fear and insanity appears on stage.

The 7th installment in the "Saikoro Fiction" series where anyone easily creates stories just by rolling dice!! In addition to a replay making it easy to understand how the game is actually played, the book contains the basic rules. Become Oumagabito - people with the fate of attracting the grotesque, and ascertain the truth of the strange incidents. However, when you make fearsome experiences, your heart is encroached by insanity. Can you protect your heart to the end !?

205879.name: Dakardsmyr: Im Nebel der Myrkansümpfe
205879.description:
Publisher blurb

Tief in den Myrkansümpfen, am Rande des Krakengrundes, liegt Dakardsmyr, Heimat der Sumpfgnome und legendäre Zitadelle der Alchemisten. Hier, wo Schwefeldämpfe das Atmen schwer machen, wo sich schwankende Brücken hoch über träge dahinfließenden Kanälen erheben, streiten Gildenräte und Bürgermeister um Ansehen und Einfluss, erkunden Gelehrte die jahrhundertealte Geschichte, wagen sich Schatzsucher in die im Sumpf versunkenen Kavernen der Unterstadt und forschen die besten Alchemisten von ganz Lorakis an immer neuen Rezepturen.

Dakardsmyr ist eine Insel der Zivilisation mitten in einem der größten Sumpfgebiete von Lorakis. In den Senken und Wasserläufen der Myrkansümpfe warten nicht nur Gefahren wie Sumpflöcher, feindselig gestimmte Feen und lauernde Sumpfdrachen, sondern auch wertvolle Rohstoffe und kostbare Ingredienzen für die Labore und Werkstätten in der Stadt. Immer wieder senden die Gelehrten der Stadt Sumpfkundige oder Abenteurer in den ewigen Nebel, um seltene Zutaten zu suchen oder einem alten Mysterium nachzugehen, und nicht immer kehren die Ausgesandten zurück.

Dakardsmyr – Im Nebel der Myrkansümpfe ist eine Erweiterung für das Rollenspiel Splittermond, das die namensgebende Stadt und die umliegenden Myrkansümpfe beschreibt. Hier wird Spielern und Spielleitern Einblick in Kultur, Leben und Geschichte der Sumpfgnome geboten, in die Tier- und Pflanzenwelt der Sümpfe und in die Geheimnisse der Unterstadt. Ebenfalls enthalten sind zwei Abenteuer in der Region, sodass Sie die Wunder und Gefahren der Myrkansümpfe direkt erleben können…

205880.name: インセイン2　デッドループ
205880.description:
From the back of the book:

The tragedy ... repeats itself!!
Everybody and anybody is enthralled. The murder incident in the village stiffled by old customs. The ghost story that brings death to those who hear it. The cultural festival that definitely doesn't begin and doesn't end. We are prisoners of a miniature garden of fear. Tragedies that repeat themselves for infinity. Even if you escape, a new fear continues... . The second installmentwhere you can experience "Repeating Tragedies" for the multigenre horror RPG depicting people played with by fear and insanity appears on stage.

The second installment for "inSANe" of the "Saikoro Fiction" series where anyone easily creates stories just by rolling dice appearas on stage. In addition to the replay "The four visitors", this book contains the world setting "Repeating Tragedies" that makes it easier to enjoy campaign play. The oumagabito who succeeded in setting of to the next world escaping the circle of fear can get the memories of the previous world as "strange awareness"! This is a book with which "inSANe" becomes more and more fun!

205881.name: ディオダディ荘の怪奇談義
rpgdesigner: 魚蹴とディオダディ荘の客人たち
205881.description:
From the back of the book:

Adventure of inSANe "Villa Diodati"

Welcome
This is a mansion where fear gathers

Will you be experiencing fear? Or will you be a narrator of the grotesque?
Oumagabito who get involved with the grotesque while each of them holds their own concealed truth - this book contains many incidents they get involved with.
The first scenario collection for "multigenre horror RPG inSANe" containing altogether more than 20 scenarios, consisting in addition to scenarios that have been published in "Role&Role" like for instance "Kisaragi Station" where they stray into a weird station, or "Shadowfires" where they get entangled in the strange concerning fire, and 10 newly written scenarios like "Crusader for Prohibition" set in a hidden bar, or "Camp inferno" which brings the encounter with a murder incident at a camp site, there are also scenarios that are popular on the net.

205882.name: Feats of Song
205882.description:
From publisher blurb:

The More Feats! PDFs introduce a single page of themed feats for use with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. Every PDF contains a full page of high-quality content (no fluff or filler)!

Feats of Song includes ten new feats for bardic characters who want to add a little flair to their attacks and performances: Bashing Instrument, Captivate, Conductor's Wand, Instrumental Expertise, Masterpiece Mastery, Melodic Meditation, Nuanced Notes, Steadying Song, Summoner's Song, and Warshout.

205883.name: Peat's Bog
205883.description:
From publisher blurb:

The free Filbar Friday offering for August is OP3 – Peat’s Bog. This short adventure can be used to give a 5th level PC an experience point boost, if they have fallen behind. As the name suggests, it takes place in a swamp, where a group of Lizardmen are terrorizing the local farms. Unbeknownst to the farmers, a far larger threat exists in the swamp…

This adventure setting was designed for 5th Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for a 5th level character and a DM. This scenario is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for a one shot adventure or a continuing campaign!

205884.name: Schwupps
205884.description:
In Schwupps, you want to rid yourself of cards before anyone else, but sometimes you might find it difficult to dump cards from your hand — even with four discard piles in play!

Each player in Schwupps starts with a deck of face-down cards and four cards in hand. Four discard piles are started on the table with a card in each pile, and next to each pile is a rule dictating which card(s) may be discarded on this pile, e.g., cards of the same color or cards exactly two higher than the current top card of the discard pile.

If possible, a player can lay down all four cards in hand, and what can hopefully help you (and pain others) are trouble cards that move the rule cards in play and introduce a new rule at the same time.

Whoever first rids themselves of cards wins!

205885.description:
It's time to run from the bulls once again in X nimmt!

This card game starts with the same premise as the well-known 6 nimmt!: Each turn, players all simultaneously reveal one card from their hand, then these cards are placed into existing rows one at a time, starting with the lowest-valued card. If a row is full, then whoever played that final card takes all of the cards already in the row, scoring negative points for all of the bullheads on those cards.

X nimmt! changes these rules a few ways. Each player starts with eight cards in hand and a personal X row. Played cards will be placed into three rows, with those rows being able to hold three, four or five cards. Whenever someone takes cards from a row, those cards go into the player's hand, then the player must play one card into their personal X row.

All cards in this X row must also be played in ascending order! If you can't do this, then you place all of those X cards aside in order to start a new X row, with the value of those set-aside cards now being doubled.

A round ends after someone plays the final card in their hand, and whoever has the fewest negative points after two rounds wins.
205885.name: X nimmt!

205886.description:
Description from the designer:

You have woken up early this morning.
All week long you have been working up courage for today´s big adventure:
Today you will dare to climb down old Doctor Humboldt´s cave to find his fabled diaries
that you and your friends had been talking about all summer.

And now you´re standing there at the cave´s entrance.
The first rays of the sun coming through the last remains of the forest´s foliage are still too weak to warm you up
and a strange smell hovers above the dark hole in the ground in front of you.
The sounds of your stomach make you realize that you must have forgotten your breakfast –
too late to go back now...

Infiltrate: into the bear cave is a cave exploration treasure hunting game for one player – without combat.
The goal of the game: Reach the bottom of the cave, search the storage chambers, find Dr Humboldt´s diaries and return with them to the surface – but don´t get caught by the bears!

The Cave
The cave you will be exploring is made up of two parts:

Part one is the cave itself – a randomized stack of cave tiles creating a three dimensional labyrinth.
Starting above ground all you can see is three manholes leading into the cave below stretching 4 floors deep into the rock. Glimpsing through those manholes might give you an idea what awaits you down there...
This allows you to make an educated guess about which way might be the best path through the cave while still allowing for surprises along the way.

The second part of the cave is the hidden information track that is used to store everything that is hidden and happening below ground in the chambers of the cave you haven´t discovered yet.
The track is not only used to store the items of the still hidden chambers but also to move the cave´s inhabitants through those chambers as well.

During the game when you gradually explore the cave you will fan out the cave tiles along the hidden information track to get a two dimensional representations of the cave that makes all chambers and possible routes between them visible.

The Bears (the AI of the game)
The rumours were right: There is indeed living a bear in this cave – and not only one, but three..
Those bears will roam the cave while you´re busy exploring.

They are steered by their own desires. Each bear´s desires are represented by a cup filled with wooden cubes of different colours.

Each colour stands for a different desire. The composition of those cubes represents what goes on in the bear´s head and will change during the game according to what that bear experiences.
The bears will either be tired – doing nothing, hungry – searching for food, angry – looking for things to destroy, or bloodthirsty – coming for you..!
During the game you will draw cubes form the bear´s cup to determine what the bear wants to do and in which direction and how far it will move.

Yourself and your actions
On your turn you can climb through the cave, open crates, carry and use items.
For all this you need energy. Like the bears you also have a cup with wooden cubes that represent your energy reserve – and also your fear that will get in the way of your plans from time to time .
Each turn you draw as many energy cubes as you like – the amount drawn equals the amount of energy you can spend on this turn. But if you draw a black cube you are instantly paralysed with fear. You could still make your body move but only for a certain cost - or you have to stand still shivering in the dark, hoping that the bears will not find you..

Experience
Certain key moments during your adventure will help you unlock hidden (one time) powers that you never knew to possess.

The Items
Dr Humboldt has stored away his belongings in a huge number of crates that can be found all over the cave. Those crates contain items that will help you survive on your quest.
Some make you stronger, some help you deal with the bears.
But to carry those items around in the narrow cave takes concentration. You have to set aside the necessary energy to be able to do that.
205886.name: Infiltrate: into the bear cave

205887.name: インセインカード　～狂気篇～
205887.description:
From the back of the box:

This item is a card set in order to enhance game play for "Multigenre Horror RPG InSANe" published by Shinkigensha. Instead of copying the cards printed in the rule book, you can use the cards in this set as insanity cards.


Contains all "insanities" from "inSANe", "Dead Loop", and "Villa Diodati"
This set adds 9 new original "insanities"!
Contains also 1 blank card for designing an original "insanity" to match your scenario!

205888.name: Symboletto
205888.description:
Description from the designer:

The game is a blind bidding game with a hint of bluffing. Each player has some money and a set of bidding cards which they use buy victory point cards with the twist that the used bidding cards will return for further use later on.

The game proceeds over several rounds, in which a) first a set of available victory point cards are revealed, then b) each player places their blind bid on each available victory point card and c) finally each victory point are resolved in order to see, which player will eventually get it.

The two (or more, if tied) players who placed the highest bids on a victory point card will have one change to raise their original bid and the player with the highest bid will get the victory point card. The winning playes pays his/her bid: the used bidding cards will be gone for some rounds (indicated by the victory point card) and used money will go the other player(s) in the duel.

In the end victory points are gained with a) victory points cards directly, b) money and c) suitable sets victory point cards. The player with the most points wins the game.

205889.description:
Animals Frightening Night! Tortoise and Skunk is a mini-expansion for Animals Frightening Night! that replaces the geese tiles with a tortoise and a skunk. What do they do?

• Skunk — In the Hiding Phase, after every player decides where to hide, the skunk may take their character token and activate their special ability. After doing so, whoever is hiding in the same place as the skunk must change their hiding place to another until the end of Morning Phase.

• Tortoise — In Morning Phase, before any player activates their character's special ability, they may take their character token and activate their special ability. By doing so, they hide in their shell and cannot be eaten by the wolf.
205889.name: Animals Frightening Night! Tortoise and Skunk

205891.name: Namco High
205891.description:
User Summary

Namco High was a freemium browser-based dating sim featuring characters from Namco Bandai's video game franchises. Andrew Hussie was the project's creative director. On July 1st, 2014, one day after the scheduled shutdown date, Namco High's servers were shut down and the game is no longer accessible on the ShiftyLook website.

205892.name: Shall we date?: THE NIFLHEIM
205892.description:
User Summary

Welcome to the world of Niflheim, the darkest and coldest kingdom for the dead, ruled by the King Jean!

205893.name: My Girlfriend Is the President
205893.description:
An alien spacecraft controlled by Ku Little Little launches into Earth, destroying the headquarters of the government of Nippon. To avoid chaos, the extraterrestrials brainwash the populace into the belief that Junichiro's childhood friend Yukino Ohama is leader of the country of Nippon. For some reason, the brainwashing does not affect Junichiro himself.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/My_Girlfriend_Is_the_President My Girlfriend Is the President]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

205894.name: Creature of Koi Shiyo! – Kokonoe Kokoro –
205894.description:
Romance alien creatures.

It has a scene with a swimsuit!
It has a scene with sex appeal!
It has a scene with a kiss!

There are two different versions. The newer version of the game has you being a female human witch in a high school of monsters. The older version is the one where you are a dude and you are tying to date a cricket.

Source: The Game Website.

205895.name: Paca Plus
205895.description:
User Summary

Saeki Kazuma and his girlfriend Izumi Yukari were spending a fun school life surrounded by plenty of friends.

Then one day, Kazuma and Yukari went to the Alpaca Kingdom together.

205896.description:
Rising Sun is a spiritual successor in the same mythic big box series as Blood Rage: same designer, same artist, same studio and same sculptors.

Rising Sun is a game about honor, negotiation and warfare in a feudal Japan where the ancient gods (kami) have returned to rebuild the empire.

Whereas the distant ancestor of Blood Rage was Risk, Rising Sun claims Diplomacy as its distant ancestor. Tackle negotiations, alliances and war. Capture hostages and commit seppuku. The game features an honor track, in which you can rise and fall based on your behavior.
205896.name: Rising Sun
boardgamepodcastepisode: #26: Gen Con 2016 wrap-up and Interviews with Jamey Stegmaier & Sun King Brewing
#41: Six Awesome Uses of Dice; Roll Player on tap; Kingdomino; Noch Mal!; Women in Beer
16 Devon Dice Podcast Scythe summer nights
29 Devon Dice podcast The Rising Xan,
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 025 – Gen Con 2016
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 036 – Blood Rage vs Scythe
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 040 – Airecon 4
Episode 15 - Get Hype! Most anticipated games of 2017 with Jack and John
Episode 15: The one about rising suns, gloomhavens, and intellectual properties
Episode 25 - Kickstarting the Habit
Episode 44 :: Gloomhaven Review - Granite Game Summit
Episode 93- Clank! and The Dark Side of Gaming: Obsession
Gen Con 2016 Finale
HLG 19: Honshu & Irritante Dozen
The Polyhedron Collider Cast Episode 9

205897.name: Ases del Basket
205897.description:
Description from the designer:

Ases del Basket is a competitive basketball board game for two players. Each player represents the coach of his team, which will give orders to players during the game to achieve victory.

With a system of actions and reactions created exclusively for this game, coaches can interact in attack or defense with each of their players, trying to score points in attack and protecting their basket on defense. Throwing custom dices that will determine the success or not of each action.

205898.name: Jurassic Go: Dinosaur Snap
205898.description:
User Summary

Different dinosaurs may appear each time players access the same levels, and dinosaurs may also be in different locations or poses from one game to the next.

205899.name: Mad Mage's Mansion
205899.description:
Small Party Adventure

From the introduction:

Who could know what is hidden within the secluded mansion of the crazed mage? Well, now, when nobody has seen him here for more than a year, it’s the best time to find out!

User summary:

Intended for two 1st - 2nd level characters. The scenario is supported with three PNG files (high-resolution maps) available as a separate ZIP archive download.

205900.description:
“If I told you half the things I’ve heard about this Jabba the Hutt, you’d probably short circuit.”
–C-3PO, Star Wars: Return of the Jedi

Imperial reprisals have swept the galaxy, targeting not just the Rebels, but their families and loved ones as well. In desperation, you and a team of other Rebel operatives have gathered as many refugees as you can in hopes of shepherding them to safety in the Outer Rim. Your escape is discovered, however, and you’ve been shot down on Tatooine. Here, the power of the Empire is not as strong as elsewhere—but that doesn’t mean you’re out of danger. This is the domain of Jabba the Hutt, and you’ll need to play by his rules if you want to survive.

Jabba’s Realm is a new expansion for Imperial Assault that offers a wealth of new content for your campaigns and skirmishes. You’ll find an entirely new full-length campaign that challenges you to survive among the desert wastes and criminal underworld of Tatooine, even as new skirmish missions invite you to battle in the Nal Hutta Borderlands or around the fabled Pit of Carkoon.

Eighteen new double-sided map tiles evoke the opening scenes of Return of the Jedi, giving you access for the first time to Jabba’s palace, his pleasure barge, and iconic locations like the sarlacc pit. Meanwhile, sixteen brand-new plastic figures offer new warriors and heroes for the Imperials, Rebels, and Mercenaries, even as new Command cards, Deployment cards, Agenda cards, and Class cards give you countless ways to customize your game. With characters like Jabba the Hutt, the Rancor, and Luke Skywalker as a Jedi Knight joining the game, this expansion draws you into the Star Wars saga like never before.
205900.name: Star Wars: Imperial Assault – Jabba's Realm
boardgamepodcastepisode: 26 Devon Dice podcast season 2 Sub Terra, sub DOOM and sub monsters
Episode 10 - 7 Wonders vs Among the Stars
Episode 11 - Notre Dame vs Ulm
Episode 12 - Tammany Hall vs Rialto
Episode 2 - Quarriors vs Dice Masters
Episode 7 - Glen More vs Lunarchitects
Podcast #34 – Jabba Jetpack
Podcast #35 – Aqualish Bowling Ball
Podcast #36 – Trade Fair Fever
Podcast #37 – Whining Farmboy
Podcast #38 – Flame Resistant Dewback
Podcast #39 – Allegations of a Cold
Podcast #40 – Aqualish for 2
Podcast #41 – The Pasi Rule
Podcast #42 – The Answer To Life And Possibly Skirmish
Podcast #43 – Wookie Hate
Podcast #44 – Coughing Contest
Podcast #46 – Full of Crumbs
Special Podcast – Interview with Paul and Todd of FFG

205901.name: Pepe Porcupine
205901.description:
Pepe Porcupine hates his job. He works the night shift in a warehouse. Each night he gets instructions about where the crates should go. Then he just has to push them into place. Sounds easy, right?

The style of the puzzles in Pepe Porcupine originates from a Japanese game called Sokoban. Sokoban means warehouse keeper in Japanese. Sokoban is a type of transport puzzle, in which the player pushes boxes or crates around in a warehouse, trying to get them to storage locations. The game is played on a board of squares, where each square is a floor or a wall. Some floor squares contain boxes, and some floor squares are marked as storage locations.

The player is confined to the board, and may move horizontally or vertically onto empty squares (never through walls or boxes). The player can also move into a box, which pushes it into the square beyond. Boxes may not be pushed into other boxes or walls, and they cannot be pulled. The puzzle is solved when all boxes are at the storage locations.

Join Pepe as he works through 254 crazy block pushing puzzles. They can be much more challenging than you might imagine!

Source: The Game Website.

205902.description:
The soldiers of the Rebel Alliance are utterly devoted to the cause, willing to venture into even the most hostile terrain if it means helping to bring down the Empire. Although all of these soldiers are trained in battle, a few truly excel at guerrilla warfare and long-range attacks. These renowned snipers are known as the Alliance Rangers, and they can join your campaigns and skirmishes with the Alliance Rangers Ally Pack.

Alliance Rangers may help a small team of Rebel heroes survive among the dunes of Tatooine, or they may battle Imperial Stormtroopers under the canopy of a mighty forest, but wherever they’re deployed, these warriors are among the most deadly long-range fighters in the game of Imperial Assault. This Ally Pack comes with plenty of other ways to alter your campaign missions or skirmish games as well. You may travel to the planet Ithor to silence an Imperial recon facility, or move deep into the Nal Hutta Swamps and silently battle another strike team in the backwaters of the Hutt homeworld. No matter which way you prefer to play, the Alliance Rangers are a powerful asset for the Alliance to Restore the Republic.
205902.name: Star Wars: Imperial Assault – Alliance Rangers Ally Pack

205903.description:
Imperial forces on Tatooine may not have the same sway as Jabba’s gangsters, but they can still be dangerous and violent—especially if their authority is not respected. Several Stormtroopers have adopted the native dewback as a mount and organized a cavalry division under the command of the vicious Captain Terro. A Stormtrooper mounted on a powerful creature like the dewback is not to be underestimated, and the Galactic Empire gains a new tool in its arsenal with the Captain Terro Villain Pack.

The heroes may come into contact with Captain Terro himself or just a Dewback Rider from his command, but either one would be a dangerous opponent. The dewback mount gives these warriors a prodigious amount of movement, and by striking from the creature’s back with shock lances or flamethrowers, a single Stormtrooper can cause a massive amount of carnage or split a hero party in two. With a new three-card Agenda set that challenges the heroes to stop a Stormtrooper reprisal against Anchorhead, a new skirmish upgrade, and new Command cards for your skirmish games, this Villain Pack offers a powerful new weapon to every Imperial commander.
205903.name: Star Wars: Imperial Assault – Captain Terro Villain Pack

205904.description:
The Galactic Empire may technically control Tatooine, but on the planet’s surface, the rules are seldom determined by laws made light-years away. Crime is the closest thing to government that Tatooine has, and all crime on Tatooine feeds back to Jabba the Hutt. Jabba has spend decades establishing his criminal empire and crushing all competitors. Now, he can help to guide your Mercenaries strike team to victory with the Jabba the Hutt Villain Pack.

Three new Agenda cards invite you to spread the might of Jabba the Hutt across the Star Wars galaxy, even when the Rebel heroes venture beyond Tatooine itself. When he takes the battlefield himself, Jabba the Hutt offers a formidable presence in your campaign or skirmish. Though he prefers to stay out of direct combat and his great bulk makes it difficult for him to move quickly, Jabba excels at ordering his minions into battle and subtly undermining your enemy’s plans. With this Villain Pack, your options for using Jabba the Hutt to control the crime world are nearly unmatched.
205904.name: Star Wars: Imperial Assault – Jabba the Hutt Villain Pack
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 6 - Stone Age vs Tzolk'in The Mayan Calendar
Podcast #41 – The Pasi Rule

205905.description:
For centuries, the Jedi Order endured as a symbol of truth and justice in the galaxy, with hundreds of Jedi Knights working to protect the innocent and safeguard the galaxy. The Galactic Empire gutted the Jedi Order, however, and by the events of Return of the Jedi, Luke Skywalker may be all that remains of that once legendary order. With the Luke Skywalker, Jedi Knight Ally Pack, you can bring a new version of Luke Skywalker into your Imperial Assault campaigns and skirmishes.

A Jedi Knight with the skills of Luke Skywalker would be an undeniable boon to any Rebel strike team. You might end up using Luke’s knowledge of his homeworld to infiltrate an Imperial base on Tatooine, or you may bring him into one of your other missions as an ally. With his fully developed Force powers, Luke Skywalker can fight for the Rebel Alliance whether you’re playing the new full-length campaign in Jabba’s Realm, skirmishing against a hostile strike team, or playing any of your other adventures across the Star Wars galaxy.
205905.name: Star Wars: Imperial Assault – Luke Skywalker Jedi Knight Ally Pack

205906.name: Dark Secret
205906.description:
From the introduction:

The game is intended to be played out in one to three sessions, with the story being divided into three acts: 1. Before the Reveal; 2. After the Reveal; and 3. The Climax. The Reveal is when the Protagonist’s Secret Identity comes to the forefront and the narrative explodes. Before the Reveal builds up toward the Reveal (it is also the phase where the players get used to their Traits) and After the Reveal should move to resolve what happens due to the revelation of the Secret Identity, culminating eventually in The Climax. Each act is divided up into a series of scenes. Special mechanics govern each act in different ways.

User summary:

The game was various titled The Man I Used to Be and Dark Secret during development.

205907.description:
Description from the publisher:

For years, the armies of Waiqar the Undying have stayed within their borders, launching only minor raids across the border. But now, a nameless threat stirs within the Mistlands, and legions of undead cross into the realm of Terrinoth under Waiqar’s command! The Daqan Lords have sounded the call to war, and their finest generals lead armies of warriors and golems to take up defensive positions in the border territory of Roth’s Vale. The first battles of the next great war are about to begin.

Runewars: The Miniatures Game is a two-player miniatures game of battles between the great powers of Terrinoth. In each game, you and your opponent will gather armies of miniatures and lead them into battle—blocks of infantry will maneuver for position, cavalry wings will wheel and slam into a weakened flank, and monstrous rune golems or carrion lancers will smash through formations of lesser warriors. Innovative command tools, two distinct factions, and countless ways to customize your experience combine to offer an unparalleled miniatures gaming experience in RuneWars. Finally, with forty-eight beautifully sculpted, unpainted figures, you’ll be able to paint and customize your armies to bring an entirely unique touch to your games and enter the hobby of miniatures painting!
205907.name: Runewars Miniatures Game
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 025 – Gen Con 2016
Gen Con 2016 Finale
Gen Con Day 2 Recap
The Polyhedron Collider Cast Episode 9

205908.name: Tales on the Weird Seas: Magical Oceanic Adventures
rpg: Tales on the Weird Seas: Magical Oceanic Adventures
205908.description:
From the introduction:

The PCs play living boats. No one knows how or why the experience the world as a boat... They just do. Some are happy to live as boats and go about boat-life with great enthusiasm. Others are saddened by this strange existence, forever drifting with the whims of the sea.

There are no humans on the boats, except on the mystic boat (and there, humans are treated as traits or tools, not as characters with rich personalities). The boats are propelled either by engines, sails, or oars. PCs are free to imagine their boats from any era; for example, there may be a longboat, a steam-powered paddleboat, and a jet ski in the same party. There is no need for any realistic approach to creating and operating the boat: a Viking drakkar might ram a modern cruiser warship, and still win the battle.

205909.name: In a Week of Sharks
205909.description:
From the introduction:

This game works best with a lot of players in a casual atmosphere. If you want a tighter story with fewer plot elements, you could have only about five players. If you want a more chaotic story with a lot of people getting eaten by sharks and some plot elements that get dropped partway through the game, you could play with up to ten players. These players do not need to know anything about roleplaying games or sharks. However, if they don’t know anything about roleplaying games, it would be helpful to know something about improv theater or some other type of collaborative storytelling. This game is appropriate for all ages. There is no math. You will also need some index cards or small pieces of paper and something to write with.

User summary:

Action resolution uses a humorous implementation of a game similar to "rock-paper-scissors". This game went through only two stages in the competition but was considered "completed".

205910.name: Evo Explores
205910.description:
In Evo Explores you have to trust your eyes. If you see something - it's really there.

If you don't see a problem - there is no problem at all.

Source: The Developer Website.

205911.name: Pride of Nations - The American Civil War 1862
205911.description:
DLC for Pride of Nations

This scenario starts in 1862 with the Union and the Confederacy locked in a titanic struggle for supremacy in a divided nation. It’s a challenge to the finish, where each side has it’s well-known strengths and weaknesses, but where sound strategic planning and operations will decide who shall prevail… Most of the key aspects of the ACW are here, including possible foreign intervention in the conflict.

Source: The Developer Website.

205912.name: Pride of Nations: Spanish-American War 1898
205912.description:
DLC for Pride of Nations

This short and epic scenario covers the 10 months of the ‘Splendid Little War’ fought between USA and Spain from April 1898. This is a fast paced scenario where the American player bears the pressure of having to achieve total victory in the same timeframe as his historical counterpart, mastering naval operations as well as lightning land maneuvers. But beware, his opponent can prove himself a much better show than his historical counterpart.

Source: The Developer Website.

205913.name: Pride of Nations - The Franco-Prussian War 1870-1871
205913.description:
DLC for Pride of Nations

This scenario covers the longest and bloodiest war in Europe during the 19th century, which saw the end of Napoleon III’s Imperial France and the advent of the Second Reich under the aegis of Otto von Bismarck. Prussia and her allies must crush the armies of France, invade the country and capture Paris before the end of 1871, using numbers and excellent leadership. France has quality of troops but abysmal command, and can later rely on Republican spirit to may be turn the tide…nothing is decided from start, it’s all yours to re-live!

Source: The Developer Website.

205914.name: Pride of Nations - The Scramble for Africa Campaign 1880
205914.description:
DLC for Pride of Nations

This medium campaign scenario starts in 1880 with most major powers having a solid industrial base and solved domestic issues (Civil War in the USA, Meiji reforms in Japan) or international recognition (Germany and Italy have succeeded in their unification process). The Berlin Conference of 1878 has opened a large field of expansion for the European Powers in the Dark continent: the Scramble for Africa will begin soon… But conflicts will not be limited only to colonial expansion overseas, as the rampant imperialism of all the Great Powers shall likely trigger a lot of crisis…till the major one, the Great War. Will you be the one to avoid it, or win it when the guns of August have started firing?

Source: The Developer Website.

205915.name: Annexe
205915.description:
Description from the designer:

Annexe is a two player strategy board game built around the subject ‘Colonization’. It throws light on the nuances of discreet exchanges taking place in the process of colonization and the hidden transactions that happen inconspicuously. It is these unseen exchanges that define the future of a culture, hence constructing its crux.

The two player represent the native leader and the conquistador each and while the conquistador tries to claim their land with the power of money and army, the natives try to counter them by using their indigenous wisdom and the knowledge about the natural resources. But the play can take overturn if any of those two can manipulate the heritage in the process to their own favor by strategising well.

205916.description: Codenames: Pictures – Promo Tiles is a set of five tiles (two agents and three bystanders) that were originally available at Gen Con 2016 when purchasing Codename: Pictures. By adding these tiles to your game along with using the key cards from Codenames, you can play Codename: Pictures with a 5x5 grid instead of the recommended 4x5 grid. These tiles will also be available by other means.
205916.name: Codenames: Pictures – 5x5 Promo Tiles

205919.name: Cat-A-Pillar
205919.description:
Description from the publisher:

After an unfortunate autocorrect mistake, a mad scientist attempting to create elemental cats with 9 lives has instead created elemental cats with 9 limbs - and counting, as the cats are mutating more arms by the minute! Armed with their new elemental powers, the cats are now engaged in a fierce battle for dominance - and with the ability to absorb limbs from their fellow mutants, some dismemberment is bound to happen.

Reign supreme as the longest cat in Cat-A-Pillar, a 3-6 player card game about building long cats out of things like dragon wings, or shark fins, or...cherry blossoms? Use your special limbs to dismember your friends’ cats, then add their limbs to your own body to become the longest (and best) cat on the table!

Each round, players have the oppurrtunity to both draw from the deck and steal another player cat’s limb and add it to their own cat. Drawing from the deck can also get you powerful Catastrophe cards, which will help your cat become longer, faster. The first player to reach 9 limbs and shout “Cat-A-Pillar” wins!

205920.name: The Red Token
205920.description:
From the introduction:

The players take on the roles of former participants of an oppressive, totalitarian regime that now lies in pieces. The setting can be anything from real-life post-war society to a fantasy world after a dark wizard has been defeated. The setting should satisfy these points:


● The characters were complicit - if not active participants - in the horrible actions of the former regime.
● The political winds have changed and each of characters are under suspicion for their role in the former regime.


It is not clear from the outset what each character knows or thinks about the others’ actions. These are things which will be explored through gameplay.

205921.name: Monk
205921.description:
From the introduction:

Monks of the Way of the Chakras are healers who mix traditional medicine with martial arts. They specialize in calling upon the restorative power of the Ki to balance the good and bad energy within people.

205922.name: Paladin
205922.description:
From the introduction:

The Oath of the Bulwark is a vow to defend others and put their safety above yours. Paladins who follow this oath are selfless, heroic souls, and the most iconic of heroes.
...
The Oath of the Holy Light is an ancient code swearing to bring light and comfort back to the world. When nights grow darkest these paladins stem the tide of darkness with holy magic, and when the dawn comes they heal their charge's wounds.
...
Not all paladins loathe undead or fight for others. The Oath of the Undying is a solemn vow to walk the earth eternally. Followers of this vow aim to transcend the limits of their mortal bodies and to become everlasting.

205923.name: Ranger
205923.description:
From the introduction:

The Beast Master becomes one with his animal side, and manifests it as a spirit companion that follows and helps him.
...
Not all rangers choose the wilds, some track down evil and fight their enemies in the crowded streets of the cities. While other rangers might balk at these urbanites and call them City Slickers, their abilities make them deadly in their chosen environment.

205924.name: Rogue
205924.description:
From the introduction:

Bandits are a diverse lot: Brigands, enforcers, highwayman, mobsters and the generic thug. Their tactics always deal with shows of force and the clear threat of violence if won't give up.
...
Some rogues have their skills of stealth and investigation enhanced with the touch of divine. These Inquisitors act where their armored brethren can't, searching for the enemies of faith in both dungeon and sacred halls.
...
Shadowdancers exist in the boundary between light and darkness, where they weave together the shadows to become half-seen artists of deception, unbound by any specified morality or traditional code.

205925.name: Sorcerer
205925.description:
From the introduction:

Your power comes from the world of spirits and dreams that exist just beyond the mirror. Whether it is a gift or curse is not always clear, but your dreams guide you to exciting adventures.
...
You are scion of forgotten kings or villains, with a lineage rich with the dust of ancient empires spanning every golden age of history, and you have a great future ahead, be it on the side of good or evil.

205926.name: Warlock
205926.description:
From the introduction:

You have made a pact with a powerful celestial creature, fighting against the tides of evil and chaos on its behalf. Warlocks who choose this path should make no mistake: The Celestial may be as demanding as other patrons, if not more so.

205927.name: Wizard
205927.description:
From the introduction:

Among wizards, there are few who devote themselves to learn and practice the secrets of the Arcane Healing arts. Their unique ability to heal earns them a warm welcome on most places and adventuring groups.
...
Many wizards employ familiars to assist them, but only a few have unlocked the power of their magic through the familiar itself. For them their familiar isn't just a sliver of their conscience, but a true friend and powerful companion.
...
Wizards who do not specialize, known as Generalists, apply their intellect to the arcane magic as a whole, and because of that have the most diversity of all arcane spellcasters.

205928.name: Introduction to Corelad
205928.description:
From the introduction:

Age of Expansion is the campaign setting for my current 5th Edition game, centered on the continent of Corelad and the blend of steampunk and colonialism that comprises its culture. It features many of the trappings of traditional fantasy and steampunk settings, but with conflicts entirely its own and a myriad of races of my own creation, each inspired by a mythical creature from real-world ancient cultures.

205929.name: Mystery of the Fey Crater
205929.description:
From the introduction:

This [item] focuses on the Fey Crater, a massive forested area in the center of the map caused by a meteor that landed a century ago. The crater is inhabited by countless beasts and fey, as well as the Archfey, three gods that, for the most part, live among their followers.

205930.name: Devoted Operator
205930.description:
From the introduction:

An elf wearing leather armor and a tranquil smile readies her spear and charges at the orc raiders. Mid-stride, a flash of light covers her in an extra layer of armor, and her movements become faster, her strikes deadlier. Their weapons seem to barely scratch her, if they manage to land a blow at all.

User summary:

Devoted Operator is a new base class.

205931.name: Journey Into the Realms
205931.description:
User summary:

Journey Into the Realms presents a compact series of encounters appropriate for various levels of play. Each "exploit" has a suggested level of adventurer and also a suggested location within Faerûn.

205932.name: Lingering Injuries by Damage Type
205932.description:
User summary:

Lingering Injuries by Damage Type provides a series of penalties for recipients of specific types of damage. Damage type ranges from standard "pierce", "slash", and "bludgeon", to include various spell effects such as "Force", "Acid", and "Cold."

The effects range from inconvenient to crippling.

205933.name: Vampires and Vampire Spawn
205933.description:
User summary:

Presents a vampire spawn template, a vampire spawn prestige class, a vampire template, and a vampire prestige class. These allow any creature to be turned into a vampire using the standard game rules and the templates. Creatures thus changed can then be advanced to significant power levels by using the prestige classes.

205934.name: Tome of the Bard
205934.description:
From the introduction (corrected for grammar):

Wielding her harp in the middle of the battlefield, the pretty elf plays a song while her party charges toward the dreadful dragon. The roar of the beast is not enough to dissuade the party while the elf’s song warms the heart of her friends.

User summary:

Presents several class-specific options and proposed enhancements.

205935.name: Tome of the Cleric
205935.description:
From the introduction (corrected for grammar):

Clerics are not mere priests or fathers that preach in churches or try to spread the name of their gods in great pilgrimages. They are devoted agents of deity among mortals, capable of making miracles through divine power shaped in magic.

User summary:

Presents several class-specific options and proposed enhancements.

205936.name: Tome of the Druid
205936.description:
From the introduction (corrected for grammar):

In the middle of dense woods, an elder hermit moves without difficulty through the vines and trees. He hears nature calling for help as a horde of orcs burn the trees and spread death in the heart of the forest. When he finally sees the nature destroyers, the elder turns in a powerful bear and charges on the gang of orcs. The hermit puts the orcs down one by one...

User summary:

Presents several class-specific options and proposed enhancements.

205937.name: Tome of the Fighter
205937.description:
From the introduction (corrected for grammar):

Fighters are warlords. They master the battlefield as no other warrior, charging in and leaving behind just a pile of enemy corpses. When a fighter finally faces a worthy opponent, he engages in a duel to the death where his confidence and combat skill are put to the test.

User summary:

Presents several class-specific options and proposed enhancements.

205938.description:
Description from the publisher:

Hello, Commander. The war continues – at great cost. We now believe another force is at work against us. If not dealt with swiftly, it could destroy us…

XCOM: Evolution is an expansion for XCOM: The Board Game that complicates your war effort with new missions, enemies, and invasion plans, as well as mechanics that make your struggles more dangerous than ever. As the alien forces spread and peril increases, the sinister humans of the EXALT seek to take advantage of the chaos to infiltrate and destroy XCOM from within. Their treachery leads to new challenges, and you'll face new crises, you'll find your work subverted, and you'll have to deal with new threats to the very resources you need to win the war.

Fortunately, your team has also made some advances since the war began. The discovery of the mysterious alien substance known as Meld promises to unlock some astonishing breakthroughs in the field of biomechanics. And XCOM: Evolution allows you to pursue some of these advances, potentially bringing formidable new weaponry to the field in the form of MEC Troopers!
205938.name: XCOM: The Board Game – Evolution
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 025 – Gen Con 2016

205939.name: Tome of the Monk
205939.description:
From the introduction (corrected for grammar):

A man wearing simple vests and wielding nothing more than a stick wanders quietly down the street. When this man enters an alley, thugs demand he give them his possessions. Keeping a countenance of peace, the man puts his stick in a box and gets ready for the imminent clash. When the first thug approaches, the man unleashes a punch that throws the thug far away...

User summary:

Presents several class-specific options and proposed enhancements.

205940.name: Tome of the Paladin
205940.description:
From the introduction (corrected for grammar):

Wearing shining armor and raising a hand wielding a sword, this proud knight makes a motivational speech at the battlefront. The solders, tired from endless days of fighting, listen to the knight. His words inflame the hearts of the listeners and they recover their breath. Led by the knight, they charge against the horde of creatures of the Abyss.

User summary:

Presents several class-specific options and proposed enhancements.

205941.name: Tome of the Ranger
205941.description:
From the introduction (corrected for grammar):

After a week has passed, the trails of the beast are nearly unseen. However, the faint traces are enough for the hunter to follow the tracks of the monster into the woods. At a given moment, the predator is sighted, totally sure its escape had been successful. But the beast was not counting on an expert hunter in pursuit.

User summary:

Presents several class-specific options and proposed enhancements.

205942.name: Tome of the Rogue
205942.description:
From the introduction (corrected for grammar):

Sheeted by a dark mantle and hidden by the shadow of the night, a mysterious man walks through the dirty alleys of the city. His steps are noiseless and the sailors playing cards inside a damp and dark warehouse do not notice his presence...

User summary:

Presents several class-specific options and proposed enhancements.

205943.name: Tome of the Sorcerer
205943.description:
From the introduction (corrected for grammar):

Wielding an energy orb in one hand, the young lady dressed in a sexy suit flies through the air while unleashing an energy blast upon the goblinoid army below. The goblins shoot arrows, but an invisible shield appears in a blink and stops the arrows...

User summary:

Presents several class-specific options and proposed enhancements.

205944.name: Tome of the Warlock
205944.description:
From the introduction (corrected for grammar):

At the center of a huge pentagram drawn on the floor with blood, a pale and gaunt human hefts a skull and drinks blood from it. Uttering mystical words and beseeching for the powers of the occult, this human summons the presence of a powerful evil entity.

User summary:

Presents several class-specific options and proposed enhancements.

205945.name: Tome of the Wizard
205945.description:
From the introduction (corrected for grammar):

The old man with a long gray beard, wearing a worn tunic and a pointed hat, walks slowly aid by his staff. While everyone runs away, astonished with the demon invasion coming through a portal in the middle of the town, the old man walks the opposite way, going toward the abyssal army. When the wizard finally sees the planar portal, he starts to make complex gestures and lifts his staff, issuing words of power...

User summary:

Presents several class-specific options and proposed enhancements.

205946.name: Tome of the Barbarian
205946.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This supplement presents ten new primal paths for the barbarian.


Path of the Bear Warrior
Path of the Destroyer
Path of the Elemental Rager
Path of the Eye of Gruumsh
Path of the Forsaker
Path of the Furious Whirlwind
Path of the Immortal Rager
Path of the Impetuous Colossus
Path of the Runescarred Berserker
Path of the Tribal Protector

205947.name: Half Sized Adventures!
205947.description:
Short Solo Adventures for Your Original Game Clones

From the introduction:

Half sized Adventures is a collection of short (mostly under 20 paragraphs) solo adventures adapted from the experimental Tunnels & Trolls blog Hobb Sized Adventures for the clones and variants of the Original Role Playing Game (or thou that shall not be named in public, at least print). They are meant for low level characters, but not for weaklings or the faint of heart.

205948.name: Hobb Sized Adventures! Blog
205948.description:
Short Solo Adventures

Publisher's blurb:

Hobb Sized Adventures is a blog featuring short solo adventures for the Tunnels & Trolls role playing game. Submissions of solos is encouraged as it may increase the frequency of postings. Solo adventures for other games like Awesomesauce!, Bean and others may show up on here as well.

User summary:

Includes dozens of solo adventures for a variety of game systems (mostly Tunnels & Trolls). Each blog post presents a new solo adventure.

205949.name: The Chapel of the Fountain
205949.description:
From the introduction:

The Chapel of the Fountain is a Holy Lands adventure for 3-4 1st-level player characters. It may take place in any remote area that is isolated from a large Church or Monastery. The party should include at least one a Cleric or Saint and a Warrior (or other fighter type class). The PCs (obviously) should be good-hearted, as the primary motivation for the adventure is to save the life of a dying villager and rescue others.

205950.name: The Coming of Twilight
205950.description:
From the introduction:

Long ago, before civilized man came to this land, the worshipers of the demon spider Ungol ruled the land with fear and terror. After a long and bloody reign, the followers of this vile demon were thrown down by the Knights of the Holy Sword, and the Demon Ungol was destroyed... or was it? One late afternoon, a bloody man crawls from the underbrush, and into the firelight, before he collapses at your feet.

205951.name: Home Sweet Home
205951.description:
From the introduction:

The Cairn Hills; a vast series of hills filled with the remains of the Old Empires buried dead. Raiding undead from this area has been on the rise lately. An isolated raid by a horde of Orcs has raised the ire of the local Lord and a reward is issued for them to be destroyed.

Can the Heroes track the Orcs to their lair? What dangers await the Heroes as they enter the Orc home?

205952.name: One Page Adventure Collection
205952.description:
From the introduction:

Presents these one-page adventures:


Shrine of the Moon (HL6)
The Coming of Twilight (HL5-6)
The Well of the King (HL2-3)
One-Eye Pass (HL3-4)
Home Sweet Home (HL4-5)


Note the collected adventures previously were published separately as five separate documents.

205953.name: One-Eye Pass
205953.description:
From the introduction:

Villagers are running for their lives! A recent series of raids by a Cyclops is terrorizing the area. It comes from the One-Eye Pass in the Cairn Hills. Old One-Eye was a black wizard who has a tower in the area, but he has not been heard from in a decade. Several locals have been taken by the demons and a local hero "Praga" followed their trail into the hills, but has not been heard from in over 2 weeks. Will the Heroes help rid the area of this evil and rescue those lost?

205954.name: Shrine of the Moon
205954.description:
From the introduction:

Deep in the Bone Hills, is an ancient pagan shrine. Dedicated in centuries past to the worship of deceptive gods it is also the resting place of the Moonstone, a Moon Opal of great beauty. The Dwarfolk merchant Delbar Munsten, has hired you to recover the Moonstone, which was stolen from his clan 50 years ago.

205955.name: The Well of the King
205955.description:
From the introduction:

The Heroes are in a village when they hear a disturbance near an outlying well. The villagers are yelling that little Timmy was playing near the well when several small people came out and grabbed him. His pet collie attempted to fight them off and they shot it with a little arrow. They are afraid to go into the well after Timmy. Timmy’s poor mother begs and beseeches the Heroes to go after him and rescue him.

205956.name: Shadows of the Past
205956.description:
From the introduction:

Shadows of the Past is a short Holy Lands Light Edition classic dungeon adventure based on an old Basic D&D fanzine adventure written by Jessie Walker. The Racmaster will need the Holy Lands LE rules and the Devil Hunters Manual to run this adventure. All additional rules, creatures and or additions will be listed in text or at the end of the adventure.

205957.name: Noggin Workshop Word Mixers
205957.description:
Description from the publisher:
