Word Mixers card-based brain game plays with words within words within words. Put your knowledge of the English language to the test with these tangled word mixers brain games. Each card is its own puzzle to solve, players race to be the first to come up with their solutions.

Players determine game length by deciding how many cards (rounds) they will play. Games using 3 cards, for example, might play in 10 minutes while games having 10 rounds can be an hour. Game plays well as a party game, a family game, and even as a solitaire puzzle.

Knowledge of the English language is necessary as the primary element of the game is based on one's ability to create or derive solutions based on word structure and composition.

205958.name: Königsdämmerung
205958.description:
From publisher blurb:

Die Sterne stehen günstig. Hasturs Blick streift die Erde, und Dinge ändern sich!

The stars are right. Hasturs view falls on the earth and things start to change!

Three connected adventures about Hastur playing Great Britain most of the time. One of the players should be a psychiatrist and one should be an artist. In addition to this game master book a players book is available.

205959.name: Spielleiterschirm
205959.description:
From publisher blurb:

Und mit diesem Spielleiter-Sichtschirm (passend zur neuen Regeledition 7) bleiben seine Geheimnisse in dem Maße gewahrt, wie es dem Spiel förderlich ist! Auf der Innenseite befinden sich natürlich alle wichtigen Tabellen und Übersichten, die der Spielleiter für seine Abenteuer benötigt. Die beiliegenden 8 beidseitig - und natürlich vollfarbigen - Bögen erlauben den schnellen Zugriff auf Regelzusammenfassungen während des laufenden Spiels!

With this gamemaster screen (made for the new edition 7) the secrets are hidden to support the game. In the inside are all the important tables overviews the gamemaster needs for the adventures. There are 8 doublesided and coloured sheets to allow fast access on rules during the game.

205960.description:
Kickstarter edition includes:
Halfdan (hero card)
Hakon (hero card)
Ragnor (hero card)
Valhalla is Awaiting All of Us (raid card)
Novgorod (raid card)
Paris (raid card)
Rouen (raid card)
3 New ship cards

These contents are packaged inside the game box which has a Kickstarter sticker on the outer shrink wrap to designate it from a retail edition



In the Name of Odin is a strategy game for 2-5 players, each with a claim to become the new Jarl. You are all brave warriors, shrewd traders and bold explorers, but only one of you will become the new Jarl to rule in the name of Odin!

During the game, each player expends action cards to construct new buildings in their village, gather companions, recruit famous Vikings, and build longships that will carry them to fame and glory.
205960.name: In the Name of Odin: Kickstarter Edition

205961.name: Travelin'
205961.description:
Description from the designer:

In Travelin', you're a traveler making your way through Europe using a combination of trains, buses, and planes. Built to be accessible for non-gamers while at the same time having solid strategy, Travelin' uses card drafting, hand management, set collection, and take that mechanics to inform gameplay.

Turn-based and consisting of draw, action, and discard phases, the goal of Travelin' is to amass the most points before the game ends (which happens once one player has reached five countries).

You could go the fast and furious route, racing through countries like France and Germany to speed up the end of the game. Or you could take a long-haul strategy of collecting high-point countries like Cyprus or Iceland. Each player starts with 8 cards - countries to be played and actions to be taken.

Whatever road you choose, you'll be forced to adapt your strategy to your opponents and keep a delicate balance between stopping their travels and advancing your own.

205963.name: Team Yankee
205963.description:
Team Yankee is a video game adaptation of the 1987 Harold Coyle's World War III novel Team Yankee that was developed by Oxford Digital Enterprises for the Amiga, Atari ST and DOS systems.

It was released in 1990 by publisher Empire Software, and was followed by two sequels that used the same game engine (titled Pacific Islands and War in the Gulf). Team Yankee is a mixture of real-time strategy and simulation game and uses a 3D environment and 2D sprites. The player is able to use several well-known late Cold War-era tanks and other armoured vehicles (M1 Abrams, M2 Bradley IFV, M113, T-72, T-62 and BMP-2)

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Team_Yankee_%28video_game%29 Team Yankee (video game)]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

205964.name: Combat Classics
205964.description:
User Summary

First of Combat Classic compilation box.

205965.name: Pacific Islands
205965.description:
Pacific Islands is a computer game published by Empire Interactive in 1992 for the PC (DOS), Amiga and Atari ST. It is the sequel to the 1987 video game, Team Yankee.

Plot
Pacific Islands is a tank simulation game which simulates platoon-style tank combat. A member of the Soviet Communist Party has seized control of the fictitious Yama Yama Isles in the South Pacific that are an important outpost for the Western nations. The player will have to regain control of the islands in five missions.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pacific_Islands_%28video_game%29 Pacific Islands (video game)]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

205966.name: Combat Classics 2
205966.description:
User Summary

Second box in the Combat Classics series by Empire, which again contains Land, Sea and Air combat games.

205967.name: Campaign
205967.description:
Campaign is a strategy war game developed and pusblished by Empire Interactive. It was released in 1992 for DOS and in 1993 for the Amiga and Atari ST.

The game is set in World War II. The player may play out scenarios like the Battle of the Bulge and D-Day. Apart from the strategic map, a battle mode will be opened if two hostile forces venture too near each other.

The military units are rendered well in this game, and it includes a 170-page-long equipment manual which also serves as the Game's copy protection. It also includes a map editor to create scenarios or modify parts of the game.

It was followed by a sequel, Campaign II.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Campaign_%28video_game%29 Campaign (video game)]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

205968.name: Combat Classics 3
videogamedeveloper: Blue Byte Software GmbH (Blue Byte Studio GmbH)
205968.description:
User Summary

Third combat compilation from Empire, this time giving us something little different than the two other in the series did (one tank game, one submarine game, and one plane game). This time we get both simulation and a strategy game, instead of a naval game we get a WWI game, and the tank game is WWII themed.

205969.name: The Golden Path
205969.description:
The Golden Path is a point-and-click adventure video game published in 1986 by Firebird Software.

The game's player character is Y'n Hsi, a Chinese Bhikkhu (Buddhist monk) and nobleman. Y'n Hsi seeks to depose Ch'un Kuei, a tyrannical warlord who murdered Y'n Hsi's father.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Golden_Path_%28video_game%29 The Golden Path (video game)]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

205971.name: Computer Hits Volume 2
205971.description:
User Summary

Second and last compilation of four games. Different from Computer Hits (first compilation), the four games were spread on three diskettes instead of four.

205972.name: Brataccas
205972.description:
rataccas is a video game released in 1986 for the Amiga, Atari ST, and Macintosh, and was the first game published by Psygnosis. It is a science fiction action-adventure game, with role-playing game elements.

Brataccas is believed to be the remains of the much hyped vaporware project Bandersnatch, which was partially developed by Imagine Software. Having been talked about in the press for some time before finally emerging, Brataccas saw considerable coverage in the computer press. It was generally reviewed poorly due to significant control problems, although the graphics were widely praised.

Story
The player controls Kyne, a genetic engineer who has developed technology for creating supermen. The oppressive government of the day desires this research to create a breed of supersoldier, but Kyne refuses to assist. In retaliation, the government frames him for treason, claiming that he is seeking to sell his work to the underworld. At the same time, the government secretly offers a reward to anyone in the underworld who turns Kyne over to them. With both the forces of law and lawlessness aligned against him, Kyne is forced to flee Earth.

During his escape, Kyne learns that evidence needed to clear his name can be found on the distant asteroid of Brataccas. Brataccas, first of the asteroids to be colonized, is a backwater mining colony with a "wild west" feel of lawlessness and corruption. Kyne has to find the evidence in order to win the game, obtaining it from the in-game characters. The manual gave no indication of who held the evidence, suggesting that everyone was equally corrupt and dangerous to talk to.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brataccas Brataccas]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

205973.name: Deep Space
205973.description:
Game manual
Deep Space is an interstellar adventure encompassing warfare and exploration. You take charge of a STRIX fighter, an advanced long rang raider in which you embark on a journey to find fame and fortune.

Working for rthe Acency as a freelance buccaneer you venture forth to earn Credits for your daring deeds and with them purchase the energy and weapons to enable you to tackle some of the most deadly adversaries in the known universe.

Negotiate meteor clusters and storms, clear minefields, steal communication satellites from out of their orbits, dog fight with Kogon interceptors, encounter the awesome Vexon mothership. These and other adcentures await you in DEEP SPACE.

Deep Space was produced by Psygnosis in assembly language especially for 68000 based computers. We hope you enjoy this product which we enjoyed creating so much.

205974.name: Computer Hits
205974.description:
User Summary

Compilation of four games on four diskettes. The diskettes are labelled with the game, their original publisher copyright note, and a copyright for Beau Jolly 1988

205975.name: Supply Line
205975.description:
Supply Line is a 4X game which attempts to simulate and demonstrate the logistics problems of traditional ground warfare.

Suitable for 2 to 12 players, aged 14+, who have 90-240 minutes spare to enjoy a 4X game of logistical battle.

The game involves developing and maintaining a network of goods (fuel and metal is extracted from wells and mines) and military units which are built both to protect one's own network and also to attack opponent networks and sometimes even sieze them.

What makes this game significantly different to many other war games is that it concentrates upon maintaining a supply line at all times. Units that are cut off from headquarters ('the fortress') are disabled and destroyed.

The game ends when a player resigns or cannot pay off their debt at the beginning of a round - the remaining players are ranked based upon the size of their territory.

Similar to crayon-based games, Supply Line uses whiteboard markers to represent the network growth.

Each game starts with players concurrently developing their home area - this is quite fast, and takes about 30 minutes. Once basic networks have been developed, the game moves into turn-based rounds which concentrate on expansion, defence, and attack.

205976.description:
Description from the publisher:

Exquisite Beast is a board game of mad scientists, minions, monstrosities, angry peasant mobs, lightning bolts, and wanton property destruction. Each player takes on the role of a mad scientist, sending minion pawns around the board to collect cards which represent the body parts of fantasy or horror creatures. Each part has specific stats and may provide a unique special ability. Each player then constructs a beast out of these collected parts and can use their assembled beast to score victory points by either defeating other players monsters or by capturing locations in the town centre on the board. The first player to reach 15 victory points wins. Beasts that fall in combat lose one of their limbs, but may have new ones stitched on and be sent back out on to the board.

The town also fights back through a special pawn on the board: the angry mob. Each turn a card is drawn from the villager deck which determines how the mob will act for the turn. Generally these cards strengthen the mob and send it to attack the players beasts and minions as well as occasionally scoring victory points for the board. If the board reaches 15 victory points before any of the players, the villagers have successfully stormed the castles of the mad scientists and the players lose. The players can steal victory points from the board, but this usually requires cooperation between at least 2 players in an otherwise directly competitive game.
205976.name: Exquisite Beast
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 05.5: Interview with Turtle Dream Games

205978.description: Predator Blob Ship is an alternative art promotional card for Star Realms, initially given out at Gen Con 2016.
205978.name: Star Realms: Predator Alternate Art Promo Card

205979.description: Thundarus is an alternative art promotional card for Epic Card Game, initially given out at Gen Con 2016.
205979.name: Epic Card Game: Thundarus Alternate Art Promo Card

205981.description: Priest card with alternate art (i.e. illustrated background).
205981.name: Mage Wars: Priest Alternate Art Promo Card

205982.description: Forcemaster card with alternate art (i.e. illustrated background).
205982.name: Mage Wars: Forcemaster Alternate Art Promo Card

205983.description: Johktari Beastmaster card with alternate art (i.e. illustrated background).
205983.name: Mage Wars: Johktari Beastmaster Alternate Art Promo Card

205984.name: Dungeon Saga: The Return of Valandor
205984.description:
First expansion to Dungeon Saga, taking place after the story contained in the Dwarf King's Quest base game and The Infernal Crypts expansion.

This expansion serves mainly to expand the contents of the Dwarf King's Quest base game, rather than provide a new campaign like those found in subsequent Dungeon Saga expansions.

205985.name: Nukie McPooch and the Zombie Mutant Presidents
205985.description:
Description from the designer:

Armed with a plasma rifle and a hella cool dog, Nukie McPooch is our only hope against the dead U.S. Presidents that we really shouldn't have reanimated.

As punk rocker Nukie, you engage in a constant shootout with the Zombie Mutant Presidents (ZMPs) in a bombed-out city. Move yourself and your dog, Schwartz, on a randomized battlefield grid and use the ruined walls as cover. Command Schwartz to loot the bodies of ZMPs you've wasted, videotape the ZMPs for valuable intel, and plant nukes at the ZMP hideouts so you can blow them sky-high!

Each of the 43 ZMPs has his own zombiefied portrait card, combat rating, and unique National Treasure that Schwartz can loot if he's lucky. When you've defeated them all, tally your score and read the secret ending you've earned.

205986.name: My Secret Pets!
205986.description:
"My Secret Pets!" is a romance game where you can live a secret second life at home with your pets, which suddenly transformed into cute guys!

Source: The Developer Website.

205987.name: Warhammer 40,000: Death Masque
205987.description:
Description from the publisher:

Eldrad Ulthran, the most skilled of the Eldar’s prophets and one of the most powerful psykers in the galaxy, whose existence has spanned ten millennia, has put into motion a series of incredible events. Descending upon the planet of Port Demesnus, his intention is to seize its crystal moon, Coheria, for a forbidden ritual capable of awakening a slumbering god…

Watch Captain Artemis – born into violence, recruited into the Mortifactors, his talents in the art of detecting and slaying the merest hint of xenos taint saw him plucked from his Chapter and sworn to lead Kill Teams of the Deathwatch. The first to respond to the distress signals from Port Demesnus, and the first to realise Eldrad Ulthran’s motives, he has diverted his strike force to Coheria.

The battle for this moon, and the events that transpire, will send shocking reverberations throughout the galaxy.

In the Death Masque boxed game, you’ll find two forces of Citadel miniatures with which to re-create the tense battles set upon Port Demesnus. The included booklet contains 3 Echoes of War missions which allow you to play through the story, with full background explaining each battle. Full rules for all the miniatures are included, with an exclusive formation for both forces. Also included is a 208-page softback copy of Warhammer 40,000: The Rules with an exclusive Watch Captain Artemis cover.

205988.name: Crimson Gargoyle (HERO 6)
205988.description:
From publisher blurb:

This PDF contains a full write up of Crimson Gargoyle. Once a prominent Neurologist, Dr Rudd is now a demented crusader for 'the people'. She believes she is freeing others from fear but all the while is subjecting them to the terror she fears.

205989.name: Archetypes of Cthulhu
205989.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Stars Are Right…For Your Next Character!

The eldritch, the strange, and the weird are often relegated to the domains of villains and NPCs in fantasy, with the good guys being the ones who stand in the way of the dark things that remain just beyond our perception, which we can never truly understand. But sometimes, it can be fun to take on the mantle of the otherworldly, and to embrace the alien terrors of the cosmos. Each installment of Weekly Wonders: Eldritch Archetypes contains five archetypes for eldritch characters—those that are weird, alien, and otherworldly, who don’t fit in with normal society—as well as a cleric domain devoted to a specific mythos entity or race.

For this book, we focus on the most famous Lovecraftian horror of them all, Great Cthulhu. Slumbering for aeons in the cyclopean city of Rl’yeh, the alien horror introduced in The Call of Cthulhu has the power to drive men mad from across the globe. Whether or not they reference this mythos entity directly, each archetype builds on themes closely associated with it, including dreams, sculpting strange statues, and gaining power when the stars are right. This book contains the following archetypes:

The dream warrior, a fighter archetype who is empowered under the right stars, can enter the dreams of others, and even survive in dream form if slain.
The eldritch investigator, an inquisitor archetype that can detect otherworldly creatures and read the dreams of those she encounters.
The seer of strange aeons, an occultist archetype plagued by horrible psychic nightmares that provide myriad strange insights, and who can store extra focus in a dark stone idol.
The Cthulhu mystery, for oracles, which grants a wide range of Cthulhu-themed powers.
The mad chanter, a skald archetype whose insane chants can drive men mad or grant strange visions.
A bonus cleric domain devoted to those who worship Cthulhu.

205990.name: Across the Ocean
205990.description:
From publisher blurb:

Long ago, they were masters of Everglow. Competition against the dwarves, orcs, and humans drove their eyes to seek a less violent home, but some still remained. New feats, spells, traits, gods, class archetypes and equipment all designed for elves!

205991.name: Raising Stakes
205991.description:
[Taken from the publishers site and product covers.]

Raising Stakes, a tabletop RPG

A Game of Wild West Drama

The game uses a unique set of cards that reveal events that happen to your characters during the night. It includes a pdf of the cards to print and cut-out at home and an audio soundtrack to keep pace of the days and nights.

4-10 players; plays with or without a full-time facilitator; 2-4 hour game length plus 1 hour set-up; adult themes, not for children; medium-to-heavy intensity experience.

205992.name: Psychopomp Ushers of Porphyra
205992.description:
From publisher blurb:

Because I could not stop for Death, She kindly stopped for me…

Even in a world fractured by conflict over Deism and Elementalism, the bureaucracy of Death and the duties of Her functionaries goes on… the outsider race of psychopomps protecting and guiding the souls of the mortal departed to their judgement, and their reward in the afterlife, be it torture in Hell or bliss in Heaven. And to aid the Queen of the Underworld are the pantheon of Ushers, equivalent to Elysian or Demon Lords, holding portfolios of interest to mortals and the departed alike, and secretly upholding the desire for the Balance, away from the turbid views of Law, Chaos, Good and Evil.

Psychopomp Ushers of Porphyra from Purple Duck Games introduces Ereshkigal, the Pale Empress, and her assistant Ushers such as Anubis, patron to the pyramid-building anpur; Black Crow, comforter to victims, and the Blessed Guides, Hecate and Hermes, finding their niches in a crowded cosmogony. Full deity-statistic pages for 8 Ushers, including domains, subdomains, and religion traits are included. And much more!

Faith traits for those that admire the Ushers of the dead
A new clerical domain, Neutrality, to balance good and evil, law and chaos; two subdomains, Balance and Indifference
The Neutral magic weapon quality
A new cabal for the brujo, cousin to the bokor of the Guedia Ushers, and a new psychopomp, the loa, from that faith
A fun new prestige class, the Transdimensional Eliminator, otherwise known as the ghost-sunderer! (Who ya gonna call?...)

205993.name: Forest Glades
205993.description:
From publisher blurb:

Modular Kit: Forest Glades is a printable dungeon tileset compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. It can be used as a standalone set, or combined with any same-scale tileset.

Modular Kit: Forest Glades comprises 10 different tiles (each sized 12x10) that can be printed multiple times and arranged in limitless combinations. They are ideal as stand-alone battlemaps, but are best used combined together with tiles from the Modular Kit: Forest Paths set.

This set contains:
Three open glades, a small camp, a druidic altar, a stone henge, a grand tree, a woodsman hut, a pool, and a ruined tower

205994.name: Weapon on the Wall
205994.description:
From the introduction:

The party finally has some time between adventures to rest, sell some loot, restock supplies and upgrade equipment. But a mundane excursion to the local weapon shop turns into an unexpected adventure involving a long-forgotten menace, foul sorcery, and ancient power. Can the party solve the mystery of the weapon on the wall?

User summary:

For 2nd - 4th level characters.

205995.name: Spinner 10
205995.description:
Spinner 10 is a card game played with 2 Special Dice (numbered 1-5 + Spinner) and 100 cards (10 cards each, 1 through 10). A game of luck won by the roll of the spinner dice.

"A family card and dice game by the originators of Spinner Dominos."

Players are each dealt ten face-up cards to start. In turn, each player rolls the dice and then discards a card with the corresponding die total from their hand. A spinner counts as zero, while double spinners allows you to discard all of the cards of one value from your hand (your choice). If you roll and have no matches, you must draw a new card. When it is your turn, instead of rolling you can use the die roll of the person before you, but must roll if the previous player did not roll.

Play continues (roll dice, discard if you can, draw if you can't) until one player has successfully discarded all of their cards. Everyone totals the remaining value of the cards in front of them, adds that to their own score, and a new round begins. After ten rounds, the player with the lowest score wins.

205996.name: New Arrivals
205996.description:
From the introduction:

You Arrive in Crests Fall a small harbor town, you take to The Erotic Goat, a small tavern that is near the port, asking around about work, the barkeeper tells you about The Taskmasters Guild in town that may have work for you. You awake in the morning ready to take a trip to the Taskmasters Guild.

User summary:

For 1st - 4th level characters.

205997.name: The Clockwork Man
205997.description:
From the introduction:

After arriving in Crests Fall taking on a few contracts and a least temporally sorting out a small cult, [the party is] told by Revol that the man at Number 14 has requested help from them.

User summary:

For 2nd - 7th level characters.

205998.name: Temple of Caecus & Drunken Horse Inn
205998.description:
Publisher blurb:

[This item] introduces two new locations in the village: The Temple of Caecus, the blind god & The Drunken Horse Inn.


One quest for level 1 to 4 characters.
One quest for level 2 to 4 characters.
Six random encounters in the swamp.
Two tables for easy and hard encounters in the swamp.

205999.name: Martial Enemies: Volume 1
205999.description:
[Taken from front cover and site.]
MARTIAL ENEMIES
Volume 1: Kazeronin, Otokoyama, Talon, Xiu Kwan, and Zhua Teng

Martial Enemies, Volume 1 is the first in a series of PDFs to detail the villains, monsters, and other dangerous beings who inhabit the Martial World of the Champions Universe.

Within the pages of this volume you’ll find:
Kazeronin, a modern-day samurai who wields the mystical Sword of the Four Winds
Otokoyama, the super-strong man-mountain who cannot be moved against his will
Talon, a lethal warrior who grows bone claws and spurs from her hands, feet, and joints
Xiu Kwan, the last of the lin kuei, the legendary “forest demons” of ancient China
Zhua Teng, who uses martial arts powers learned in dark to enrich himself at the expense of others

206000.name: The Leader
rpgseries: Monster of the Week Hunter Playbook
206000.description:
From publisher blurb:

Created for use with Monster of the Week by Michael Sands published in partnership with Evil Hat.

You are the core, the head of the snake, the heart of the effort. You have followers or minions or summons. Where as other hunters keep their war private or only between a handful of friends and others work for the interests of wider organizations, you lead an organization.

You might be the leader of a coven of vampires, employ a mercenary army, command legions of vengeful spirits or have lots of people who are inspired by you. Regardless, your power is manpower.
